results.description: This group is for anyone interested in discovering "What is Montessori?" The meet-up topics will be driven by the interests and needs of the participants. Each month a theme will be chosen by the group for discussion and discovery! The discussion will be facilitated by a Montessori professional or experienced Montessori parent. Bring your children for play while you have an opportunity to share and discuss!
results.name: Montessori Meetup Group

topics.name: For Folks to Meet and Greet with other Small Dogs

results.description:
We meet once a month, usually the 3rd Sunday of each month, at the Holliston Meadows, 140 Summer Street, Holliston, MA 01746, T: (508) 429 1500.

We are also open to meeting at other locations. If you have a great location that can accommodate 15-20 small dogs, inside or outside, let me know.

The Holliston Meadows is a beautiful multi-million dollar newly-built dog resort and spa with free parking. The area for the meetup is indoors, clean, elegant, cozy and personal, and has windows. The staff is angelic! And there is plenty of seating, but feel free to bring your own chair. The meet is a casual play group for our small dogs and a chance to talk to each other about our dogs while they play together and have fun.

All small dogs (under 20 lbs) that have good doggy manners and are polite with other dogs of any breed or mix are invited. Please be sure your dog(s) is healthy and up-to-date with shots.  Come join our fun and friendly group!
results.name: Small Doggy PlayDates

results.description: Boston has a fantastic history of equality and being very open on many fronts, including alternative lifestyles, and Massachusetts itself was the first state to legalize gay marriage. This group is for all gay, lesbian, bisexual and transexual and LGBT friendly people to come out and socialize in safe and welcoming environments, and to build connections and lasting friendships!
results.name: Boston's Fun LGBT

topics.name: Infant to Toddler Music and Play Group
Music Learning Groups for Adults and Kids
Family Music Making, Mom and Me Groups

results.description: This is a group committed to providing caretakers and young children the opportunity to learn music together! Classes will awaken and develop any child's inborn talent for making music by providing action filled classes that bring child & caregiver together for singing, dancing, listening, and playing instruments. Aside from music, children will learn pattern recognition skills important for mathematical learning, develop language and literacy, and grow socially and emotionally. My hope is to offer classes one time a week throughout Boston based on demand. So if you are interested, join the group and let's organize or find an existing class for you and your infant/toddler to experience music together for the first time! Looking forward to meeting you and your child/children!
results.name: Music for Toddlers and Babies of Boston!

results.description:
This group started off as Wing Woman strategy for meeting professional men in Boston.  However, it has morphed into more of a social group for professional single women over 40 in Boston who want to take advantage of our amazing city's many cultural and after work events.  We have made some amazing friendships that have also turned into networking pals. So...let's go out to Boston's hot spots and happy hours, have a FUN Girls Night Out and see what happens. NO PRESSURE. If you're single or a recently divorced professional woman like me and just want to get out and mingle in the great city of Boston, with an eye towards meeting someone the old fashioned way, this group is for you. If you've tried the online sites and sick of spending two weeks getting to know someone, only to meet them in person and find out they don't look anything like their photo and there's no chemistry. If you "ain't got time for that" this group is for you.  At the very least, this will be fun to mingle with other professional single / divorced women who like to get out in the city after a hard days work, and whose other girlfriends may be married or paired off and not willing to go out in town.  The wing woman concept is a great idea, as long as we keep it low key. Consider it a Girls Night Out Plus!

Please note these are all city of Boston events geared toward professional single women in their 40s + on the waterfront, downtown, Back Bay etc. not in the suburbs. We are open to the many vendors approaching us with special offers specific to our demographic.

Venues will include the Waterfront, Back Bay, South End, cultural events, sports bars on football Sunday and more fun places with great food, atmosphere and fun!

Also need help running the group please so please feel free to email me with suggestions or ideas for meetups you can host!
results.name: Boston Wing Women - For Professional Women 40+

results.description: A3E is a Business-to-Business Exchange Dedicated to the Exploration of New Technologies & Apps that are Transforming the Music Industry and the Creative Process of Musicians & Audio Professionals. A3E has uniquely targeted and is creating a business-to-business exchange, and environment, for the 3 critical components and communities that make up the creative aspect of the music and professional audio industry; 1. musicians and audio professionals, 2. music and audio technology manufacturers, 3. music and audio software developers. The interaction and symbiotic relationship between these three ecosystems is where the paradigm shifts, the new applications and the new business models are and will be emerging from. A3E is at the core of these universes and A3E’s mission is to facilitate and create an Exchange of information, data, technologies and relationships that will help all these individuals and organizations build the best products, create the best music and content, as well as drive the most profitable businesses possible.
results.name: Advanced Audio + Applications Exchange (A3E) - Bos

results.description: Destiny REIA is a Real Estate Investors Association that is about helping you the investor to succeed. We work to create and cultivate win-win relationships for every member. You’ll feel the excitement in the air of new investors eager to become financially independent through real estate, and the confidence of investors who already have. We encourage new investors to learn everything they can about Real Estate Investment, while providing networking with people, investors and the opportunities to create more success for everyone!
results.name: Destiny REIA: Real Estate Investors Association - Boston

results.description:
Are you pregnant or breastfeeding? Do you have questions about nursing your baby or toddler? Are you pumping or supplementing? Nursing Mothers' Council is a supportive group of women & accredited counselors that can help!

  • Our mission is to make breastfeeding and parenting more informed and satisfying family experiences by providing ongoing education, emotional support, community service, and advocacy.
  • We want to see breastfeeding become universally recognized as natural and healthy. We also want to ensure that women and their families have the knowledge and support they need to make informed choices about breastfeeding and feel empowered to do so.

With that said, please know that we do not feel that breastfeeding is an "all or nothing" relationship. We welcome ALL moms, regardless of their breastfeeding status.

Attendance at our gatherings is free of charge. All mothers and their children are welcome. There is a comfortable seating area for moms with babies and a small adjoining space with toys where older toddlers and children can play.

We meet 10:00-11:30am on the FIRST Friday of the month in the Mother’s Room at St. Peter’s Episcopal Church (4 Ocean Street, Beverly, MA 01915). Please use the entrance located off the rear parking lot. Although both the Church and WIC have generously allowed us to use this space, Nursing Mothers' Council is not affiliated with either.

We are also available anytime for help over the phone. Please call us if you have a question that won't wait!

Maire: 978-468-1876

Jen: 919-619-0657

 

NMC (Nursing Mothers' Council) is part of BACE (Boston Association for Childbirth Education). Founded in 1953, BACE is one of the oldest community-based childbirth associations in the country. Visit the website at www.bace-nmc.org.
results.name: North Shore NMC Breastfeeding and Parenting Group

results.description:
This is a collective of people who share a passion for night photography.

This Meetup is about gathering in groups, small or large, to capture the night and share the outcome with each other. Education, respectful and constructive feedback, exhibition of images and socializing during and after our gatherings are all part of our activities.

We will explore old, new, popular and exotic places in the greater Boston area, southern New Hampshire and Maine, Rhode Island, northern Connecticut and central Massachusetts and there are occasional field trips to places such as New York or Maine. Inner city nightscapes will be as much part of our portfolio, as will be dark sky star, astro-landscape and Milky Way shoots or light painting opportunities.

Most events will be free (no special fees beyond membership dues), membership dues will cover Meetup.com costs, minor group expenses and promotional means, invited lectures and trip organization expenses. Some events, such as field trips, may incur further cost, as announced in those meetups. You can sign up for free and attend one meetup to see if this is for you, but you are expected to pay dues if you continue membership. Limited attendance meetups are only for paid members. Note that this is the only continuously active night photography meetup in New England, we average one photo shoot every ~10 days, one meetup every week, and even keep it alive and going throughout the winter. Browse our "past meetups" to see what we have been doing.

Night photography is exciting, presents the world in a truly different light and is serene and calming in many ways. However, it is also very different from daytime shooting, sometimes physically taxing and requires to watch out for yourself and others. The meetups here will always be conducted with adult and mature members, who provide safety through numbers, but you will always be responsible for your own safety.

Before you start browsing around, please take a look at the MORE-POLLS in the menu and let us know your preferences and then please review the DISCUSSIONS, also in the menu, for various resources and some pointers on equipment, safety, attendance and membership rules.

We are looking forward to seizing the night with you!

Jürgen, GBNP Organizer
results.name: Greater Boston Night Photographers

results.description:
This is a group for anyone who is interested in meeting new people or just having fun while participating in social activities: watching movies, bowling, going out to dinners, card making, and more. This group is for you if you want to get out of the house once in a while and have a great time!

You do not have to pay any dues to join this group.

If you are a woman in your 20's, 30's, or 40's and looking to meet new friends or feel doing something fun then you should join this group!

We are always looking for people to host events so please feel free to suggest events.  The goal is to have at least one event per week.

Please only joint this group if you are actively going to participate in the acitivities. Members who have not attended any meetups and have been member of this group for over a year, will be automatically removed from the group.
results.name: Dracut Area Ladies Movie Nights & More:  20's, 30's, & 40's

results.description: Monthly games of White Wolf LARP including OWOD (Vampire: The Masquerade and Werewolf: The Apocalypse) and NWOD (Vampire: The Requiem and Accord: Combined NWOD venues)

results.description: This group meets around a shared interest in the artistic, pedagogical, and technical aspects of instructional design and the development of interactive educational media.  Our meetings have an emphasis on real-world projects, with members following progress, offering support and encouraging collaboration.
results.name: IDIEM: Instructional Design and Educational Media

results.description:
Welcome to the North of Boston Volunteers!

Do you want to volunteer but...

    You don't know where to begin

    You don't have the time or commitment in your schedule

    You don't want to volunteer alone

Well this may be the group for you!

Our mission is to find and bring awareness of local volunteer events all throughout the North of Boston region where we can volunteer as a team and bring the community together.

I hope you'll join our community and spread the word about our group!  You can find us on Facebook and Twitter!
results.name: North of Boston Volunteers

results.description: A place for anyone looking to build their tribe and brand, bring community to their business, engage and grow an existing community, or connect with other community professionals.
results.name: Boston Community Managers Meetup

results.description:
I just discovered Meetup a short while ago, but after joining a few of the social groups, I noticed that many of them hardly ever have any events (that and everyone and their mother is trying to get you to join a social bowling league for some reason). Call me crazy, but I thought the point of having a Meetup group was to actually meet up.

This group is a little special because I'm not a promoter, and I don't make any money off the members. I pay all of the group dues out of my own pocket, and the only thing I'm looking to get out of it is the fun of your collective company. Shouldn't that be what Meetup is really all about? Drinking? But, I need your help!

So, whether you're new to the city, or you're in my boat where many of your friends moved or got married, or you just plain want to meet some new interesting people, together let's create an active group to gather some fun drinking buddies. Let's kick it old school: all we need is a time and a place and let the good times roll.

Watch out though, this Meetup group is actually going to have meetups.
results.name: 20's & 30's Happy Hours (with actual meetups for a change!)

results.description: The National Society of Black Engineers' - Boston Professionals (NSBE Boston) is a 501(C)(3) non-profit association dedicated to the academic and professional success of African-American engineering students and professionals. NSBE offers its members leadership training, professional development, mentoring opportunities, career placement services and more! The purpose of this meetup group is to invite you to participate in our organizations events and activities. Non-Engineers ARE WELCOME!!!

This is also a good place for Vietnamese people to practice English. Our goal is to form real friendships, keep up-to-date with the culture, and have fun. We'll also announce various cultural events, including concerts, movies, plays, and festivals. Anyone can suggest a meetup and everyone can join.

results.description: This is a group for anyone considering, going through, or who's already been through a divorce or relationship break-up. We will meet to learn from each other! Come share your experience and help someone else. Ask questions to get help from someone else. The group is intended to offer support and encouragement as well as share knowledge about how to heal ourselves from a divorce. Unless you heal, you will likely repeat and experience another failed relationship.

results.description:
Socialize over drinks, dinner, pubs and enjoy night life.

We meet in classy establishments and the occasional dive for dinner drinks and conversation. Not exclusively dating, but great way to mingle! Most events in Boston.

Please don't join this group if you are interested in just giving a sales pitch. We believe that referrals will come organically with trust but we don't push them.

results.description: Gaudeamus igitur! This group is for anyone interested in learning to speak Latin, whether you're a complete tiro (beginner), an advanced speaker, or a teacher/student who has learned about Latin in school but would like to try it conversationally. We'll work together to provide a number of different experiences, including weeknight coffee hours, beginners' workshops, intermediate and advanced speaker symposia, and weekend cultural events like museum visits, city tours, or hiking. At each meeting, there is an informal discussion about a different social media-related topic. For more information on the Sudbury Social Tweetup, please contact either Bob Cargill (@CargillCreative) at Cargill123@gmail.com or Phil Hollows (@phollows) at phil@feedblitz.com. To register to attend the event, go to http://sudburysocial.eventbrite.com/. If you decide to write about the event please use the hashtag #SudburySocial.

Northeast Scuba is starting the group to foster more local diving with our New England friends.

results.description: Zumba Fitness class hosted by Zumba with Cynthia in Billerica Ma. Join us every week Monday and Wednesday at 7:00pm and Saturday morning at 9:30am.  Monday and Saturday are all about the cardio and core benefits of Zumba, while Wednesday night we work to sculpt our muscles with Zumba Toning.  If you've been looking to start your fitness journey or just want to change things up, Zumba Fitness is a great cardio workout! All fitness levels welcome!!

results.description:
It's difficult to improve what you can't measure, and difficult to measure something that everyone defines differently. Join fellow hackers, Quantified Selfers, and the City of Somerville as we tackle both challenges in a pilot to quantify, visualize, and improve subjective citizen well-being in Somerville.

For more details, check out our about page.
results.name: Hacking Somerville Happiness

results.description:
Boston Dads Group is a diverse community of fathers who take an active role in our children’s lives. We seek to create an online meetup group to bring fathers together in person. We'll meet several times per week, with our kids, at parks, playgrounds, museums, parent-and-me classes, and living rooms across the greater Boston Metro area. We'll also organize parenting workshops and dads-nights-out to give our members an opportunity to socialize, learn, and support each other as we navigate parenthood.

There are not enough resources, social groups, or services for dads. This is a destination for all active dads. A diverse group with dads of all stripes: Stay At Home Dads, Dads with flexible schedules, work from home dads, freelancers, working dads, teachers, and involved fathers in and around the Boston metro area to socialize and interact with other guys who enjoy spending quality time with their children.

** Please note this group is strictly for Dads, we understand sometimes wives will try to join for their significant others but we encourage them to join on their own accord. We want this group to be a comfortable place for Dads to learn and talk about anything dad related.

Follow us on social media here:

Facebook

Twitter: @BostonDadsGroup

Questions, Sponsorships, Media Inquiries: bostondadsgroup@gmail.com
results.name: Boston Dads Group

topics.name: Meeting Locals and New in Town

results.description:
New to town and want to explore the area while making new friends? Been here a while and know all the best dives, events and activities? MetroWest Boston has something for everyone! Let's explore it and make great new connections while we're at it! So many Meetup groups are extremely specific to their target demographic and activities. The goal of this group is to not have boundaries on what we will do and who joins the group. The best Meetups come from the ideas of its members - you! MetroWest refers to a sizable chunk of Massachusetts and I hope to see people from all over the area in our group!

Don't forget to download the Meetup App for Apple and Android phones so you can be in the know about the latest updates for meetup events!

A few important notes...

    Business: Please no solicitations for your business.  Content posted to the website about your business will be removed.  This is a social group.

    RSVP Courtesy: When RSVPing Yes to a meetup, please keep your commitment. A lot of planning goes into these events. We know the life happens so if you do need to cancel, please give more than 24 hour notice before the event.

    RSVP Policy: After three no shows, you will be removed from the group. This is not meant to be harsh, but a gentle reminder to be courteous

      What is a No Show

      • If you do not show up to an event to which you have RSVPed "Yes"

      • If you change your "Yes" to "No" less than 24 hours before a meetup 

      • For those meetups which require reservations, if an individual cancels after the RSVPs are closed (clearly shown on those meetups which this applies)

    Your Profile Picture: Please make it a picture of you! It's really helpful to know what people look like so we can find you at meetups!

    Emails: Make sure you're subscribed to organizer emails. Your organizers will be in touch with you via email to give you important information about events like where to meet, contact information, etc.
results.name: Out and About in the Metrowest

results.description:
StoryCode is an open-source community for emerging and established cross-platform and immersive storytellers, spotlighting case-studies in current storytelling innovation.  www.storycode.org

StoryCode Boston aims to have a meetup every one or two months where we showcase our diverse community of creators, producers, educators and innovators in storytelling and transmedia.

In collaboration with MIT Open Documentary Lab http://opendoclab.mit.edu/

StoryCode started as a meetup in New York City in 2010 and quickly gained popularity among professional and indie media makers and storytellers alike.  Speakers at StoryCode in New York have included PunchDrunk (Sleep No More), Campfire (marketing for Game of Thrones), Marcelo Guerra (ARG design for Dexter), and Frank Rose (Wired contributing editor who literally wrote the book on transmedia The Art of Immersion).
results.name: StoryCode Boston

results.description: Hello Boston Community! We are redefining the afterwork networking experience and YOU are cordially invited to a unique atmosphere with Hors D'ouerves, music, and spirits. Imagine a world where you can enjoy tantalizing cocktails, meet new people, and escape it all for a few hours. Please come dressed in business casual or upscale trendy attire. Doors open at 6PM and there will be no cover until 8PM.
results.name: Boston's After Work Networking Mixer

results.description:
WHO ARE WE?


We started off as a dissident band of renegades from the Boston Social Strategy Gamers group (OK, many of us are members of that group, too -- but still) who were in search of fellow fans of gamer's games -- broadly speaking, stuff with more complexity and/or a nastier streak than you get from Settlers of Catan or Ticket to Ride. Since then, we've grown dramatically (close to 200 members at the time of this writing) and we have Meetup events to play all sorts of stuff. We're open to anyone with a good attitude and an interest in strategic tabletop gaming -- though being the sort of person not scared off by rulebooks with more than eight pages doesn't hurt.


WHAT DO WE DO?


In addition to an event almost every Wednesday in Porter Square, Cambridge, we periodically host get-togethers to play games we're interested in at various places -- time and availability permitting. All of our events are free and open to anyone who's interested unless otherwise noted. Newcomers are always welcome at our events; you don't need to be an expert in the games we play. A good attitude and a willingness to learn is all that is necessary.


We have a once-per-month session of 18XX games, and a kinda-sorta-once-per-month session of multi-player wargames. Apart from the longer time commitment, these events are like the others; everyone is welcome, including newcomers willing to learn the ropes.


We also have running online competitions for the games Brass and Through The Ages. Newcomers are welcome to be a part of these as well, and you can play them from the convenience of your own homes.


WHERE DO WE MEET?


We're a pretty urban lot, so the vast majority of our events are in the Boston/Cambridge/Somerville/Watertown/Brookline/Newton area. If this area is inconvenient for you, you are welcome to suggest an event for a venue more convenient for you; we just can't guarantee you'll get a big turnout.


WHAT IS A "CUBE CARTEL GAME?"


Basically, it's what you make of it.


We started out as a group to get together and play "heavier" examples of "Euro" (or "German-style") board games (think Agricola or Age of Steam) and that is still probably the majority of what we play. But, as mentioned, we also play some 18xx (complex, nasty "business" games with a railroad theme, like 1830: Railroads and Robber Barons) and some wargames (especially GMT's card-based wargames, like Twilight Struggle and Virgin Queen).


What we don't play much of: classic strategy games (like Chess, Go or Mancala), super-popular mass-market games (like Monopoly, Risk or Clue), traditional card games (like Poker, Scopa or Bridge), role-playing games (like Dungeons and Dragons) and collectible card games (like Magic: The Gathering). There are people in our group that like these sorts of games, and no one's going to give you a noogie if you suggest playing them, but they're not the focus of the group and are thus unlikely to make it to the table. There are some excellent local Meetups if you're interested in any of these.


In the end, we're less interested in drawing a bright-line distinction between what is and what is not a Cube Cartel Game than we are in playing what we like. The real purpose of this group is to be a sort of "safe space" where no one's going to look at you like an uberdork for pulling out your copy of Le Havre or Chicago Express.


Thanks for checking us out. We hope you'll join us soon.
results.name: Greater Boston Cube Cartel

results.description: The purpose of this group is to facilitate interaction between Pakistanis in Boston, and their well-wishers. We plan to try different restaurants, attend sporting events, and try all the various activities Boston has to offer. Everyone is welcome to suggest meetups of their own as well. Please note this group is not a forum for any political or religious discussions. I hope it can be a casual and fun group, where we can enjoy one another's company and make new friends.
results.name: Boston Pakistani Society

results.description: Get outside and get in shape! All fitness levels welcome. This group offers a great workout that improves your overall level of fitness, from cardio and endurance to speed and agility. Whether you are already in great shape and want to keep it that way, or you are just starting out on the road to a healthier and happier lifestyle, you are welcome here. All workouts will be tailored to the fitness levels of the group on that day. So get outside, get in a great workout, and become even more awesome than you already are!
results.name: South Shore Outdoor Fitness

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in learning, discussing, contributing and playing with Cloud Foundry. Cloud Foundry is an interoperable Platform-as-a-Service framework that allows users to have freedom of choice across cloud infrastructure and application programming models, and cloud applications. Cloud Foundry is the leading open platform-as-a-service, providing an open ecosystem of developer frameworks and application services. Cloud Foundry makes it faster and easier to build, test, deploy and scale applications. Cloud Foundry is an Apache 2.0 licensed project and available on Github: https://github.com/cloudfoundry. To learn more about Cloud Foundry visit http://www.cloudfoundry.org
results.name: The Boston Area Cloud Foundry Meetup

results.description:
OVERVIEW:  This group is for men and women of all backgrounds interested in Viking-age culture and combat. We gather every week to train in live steel combat techniques and learn the many skills of the Viking age.

GROUP WEBSITE:  vikingirish.org.

NOTES: 

(1) We do most of our coordinating via Facebook--you must be willing to use Facebook daily for this purpose to participate in the group. 

(2) We are not a casual group from which to come and go--what we do takes commitment and mutual support.  Please consider whether you can afford to spend most Saturdays from 2-7pm with us.  If that's unreasonable, we are not the group for you.

(3) Recruiting of new Fighters is currently closed, and re-opens OCTOBER 3rd, 2015. Recruiting of Hearth members is still open.

We draw our inspiration from the worldwide influence of the Jomsborg, a group of Modern Vikings. For more about the Jomsborg, see their website for this region and "To Go Viking"--a recent documentary made about the group

If it's your first time, contact us ahead of time to let us know you are coming so we can plan accordingly and give you proper attention.Click here to e-mail us.
results.name: The Viking Irish

results.description: Join us for Open Screen once again at the Coolidge Corner Theatre. Open Screen is Boston's one and only open mic night for film-makers! Whether you sold your home to finance your 35mm masterpiece, or you made it last night in your basement -- if your movie is under 10 minutes, we'll screen it! results.description:
ABOUT US

HackerNest is a grassroots nonprofit organization that runs unpretentious community events and epic, meaningful, universally-acclaimed hackathons. Our mission is economic development through technological proliferation. Check us out >>> Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Wikipedia

Connecting people is awesome. And community good breeds fab karma. We cram smart, accomplished techies into a room, often with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth Tech Socials are now Canada’s largest tech meetups and growing quite quickly internationally. Our membership is diverse and highly technical. Developers, designers, engineers, social media/business folk, entrepreneurs, investors, etc. regularly gather to socialize, talk tech, hear the occasional speaker or watch a demo, and meet future co-founders, employees, funders, and friends.

Our formula: laid back atmosphere + free drinks + brilliant people = fireworks. We're not scienticians, but this seems to work. We became Canada's largest tech meetups in a year, before even leaving Toronto. Today we have "splinter cells" in multiple cities internationally. Our goal is to complement and strengthen existing nerd ecosystems – we come in peace. We hail the ideal of a strong and supportive tech community - pretty much anyone that isn't a jerk can be a part of it, so we have a strict no-douchebag policy.

Interested in running HackerNest in your city? Take a look at the FAQ. Whoa, longest description evaaar. Need to know more? Here's some answers. 

RSVP to get a custom, hand-written nametag. This is important, because people without nametags aren't even really people. There, we said it. :)

Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Wikipedia

SOME DETAILS:

********

When: Pretty darned regularly. Check back!

Format: Relaxed. Hang, talk tech, occasionally a speaker, plot to take over the world, etc.

Where: Usually in the large private office of a tech company (have a venue?)

At any given HackerNest meetup, you may find people who are:

developing incredibly snazzy Ruby (most likely on Rails) applications - heady hardcore designer types - PHP/Perl/.NET/Python/django addicts - ...Fortran devs?! - looking for a tech/entrepreneur/new business story to cover - Objective-C experts and iPhone/iPad/Apple product pundits - engineers and managers and CTOs looking for co-founders to join their angel/VC-backed tech startup - looking to write articles/stories about the obscure, interesting, hilarious hacks you've pulled off - totally oblivious and just wandered in because they heard there was booze (!?) - building a top-secret app out of their basement that's going to change the way the world does X; like "Facebook for Squirrels" - scrambling to find a partner to work with on a well-paying contract that's just a wee bit too much workload for the anticipated deadline - heroes, because they're part of the burgeoning community that will reverse all this insane brain-drain - incredibly talented, smart, entrepreneurial go-getters who are absolutely dangerous to the status quo - pretty bloody interesting, because seriously, if they're coming out for drinks ON A MONDAY (or Tuesday, or Wednesday) NIGHT... they've gotta be.

Chances are, you'll fit right in if you're a(n):

software or hardware hacker/h4ck3r (or maybe just a hack) - coder/developer/programmer/designer, UX-oriented, or just like making things pretty - biotech/electrical/computer or basically any kind of engineer - network/network/system/IT administrator - front/back-end specialist - angel investor - demon investor - venture capitalist - venture communist - tech enthusiast - tech/entrepreneur-oriented media/journalist - OCD blogger/Tweeter - bloodthirsty recruiter looking to poach developers - internet mogul - nerd/geek/freak/tweak - entrepreneur - SEO/SEM pro - writer/project manager/business analyst - 1337 individual - etc., etc.


...and aren't a douchebag. <3
results.name: HackerNest Boston Tech Socials

results.description:
Join with confidence. I’m a founder/organizer and event organizer of many other groups with a direct network of over 10,000 members!

What we’re all about:

Too much of Meetup surrounds awkward get-togethers in bars—some of which, that’s all they do. So let’s be serious, it’s tough to avoid alcohol. It’s everywhere. This group will make every effort to set events without alcohol as well as create an environment where you can feel more comfortable not having a drink in your hand. 

Members are required to abstain from alcohol and drug consumption while in attendance at any of our events... this still applies even if there are other groups there who are drinking.

We are not limited to those who had or have problems with their alcohol use; nor do we advocate teetotalism. The sober, recovering, fitness/health focused, and those with medical issues—all are welcome.

Members are allowed to suggest their own Meetups!

Here are the guidelines for suggesting Meetups:

• No excursions or day trips. 
• No political events, rallies, or religious activities.
• Nothing that costs over $25.
• Boston/Greater Boston area only. Ideal locations will be directly accessible by subway or bus. A significant amount of members do not have a car.

Are you also into Fitness? In your 30's? Please join either of the below groups!

http://www.meetup.com/fitness_friends/
http://www.meetup.com/club-30

Code of conduct:

1. It is CRITICAL that you keep your RSVP’s up to date. It creates false expectations of our members, puts vendor relationships at risk, and is just plain rude. So please use that cute red button. It only takes a second. If you can't go in the first place, do nothing.

2. Contacting other members prior to meeting them is seriously frowned upon. This isn't Match.com or a career website. Members leave the group and will never attend an event because of this behavior.

3. While at an event, treat our members AND the staff of venues with respect. Your behavior has an affect on all of us.
results.name: Fun WITHOUT Alcohol of Boston

results.description: At edX, we believe in the highest quality education, both online and in the classroom. EdX was created for students and institutions that seek to transform themselves through cutting-edge technologies, innovative pedagogy, and rigorous courses. Through our institutional partners, the XConsortium, we present the best of higher education online, offering opportunity to anyone who wants to achieve, thrive, and grow. Our goals, however, go beyond offering courses and content. We are committed to research that will allow us to understand how students learn, how technology can transform learning, and the ways teachers teach on campus and beyond. As innovators and experimenters, we want to share what we discover. The edX platform will be available as open source. By conducting and publishing significant research on how students learn, we will empower and inspire educators around the world and promote success in learning. Our aim is to become a leading resource for learners and learning worldwide by staying focused on the goals and principles set forth when forming edX: Our goals Expand access to education for everyone Enhance teaching and learning on campus and online Advance teaching and learning through research Our principles Not for profit Open source platform Collaborative Financially sustainable EdX is based in Cambridge, Massachusetts and is governed by MIT and Harvard. https://www.edx.org/about-us

results.description:
What is Apache CloudStack?

Apache CloudStack is open source software designed to deploy and manage large networks of virtual machines, as a highly available, highly scalable Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) cloud computing platform. CloudStack is used by a number of service providers to offer public cloud services, and by many companies to provide an on-premises (private) cloud offering, or as part of a hybrid cloud solution.

CloudStack is a turnkey solution that includes the entire "stack" of features most organizations want with an IaaS cloud: compute orchestration, Network-as-a-Service, user and account management, a full and open native API, resource accounting, and a first-class User Interface (UI).

CloudStack currently supports the most popular hypervisors: VMware, KVM, XenServer and Xen Cloud Platform (XCP).
Users can manage their cloud with an easy to use Web interface, command line tools, and/or a full-featured RESTful API. In addition, CloudStack provides an API that's compatible with AWS EC2 and S3 for organizations that wish to deploy hybrid clouds.

Join the CloudStack SF Bay Area Users Group

Anyone is welcome! Come and chat over pizza and drinks.

We will have talks from members of the foundation, committers, and users of CloudStack discussing various aspects of its development, history, architecture, operation and in general the direction of the project in this and upcoming meetups. And most importantly - how to get started on contributing yourself! Anyone is welcome to the group and we'll have beginner sessions available as well.
results.name: CloudStack Boston User Group

These movies are usually screened Mon. to Thur. 7 PM.  Members are required to get in line starting at 5 PM but should be in line before 6.  These times depend on the movies appeal.  Seats are not guaranteed since they overbook to assure a full house.

This may not work for all people with jobs and or may have to travel to the theater screening the movie.

Friendships will develop over time while waiting in line and than after being seated waiting for the movie to start. After the movie may want to do something with a new friend or friends and than you get to be the first to blog about it on your Facebook page or Tweet it to your followers or any social group your into.

Please use your full name when signing up or at least a last initial with your first name if your afraid of stalkers.  It helps when I need to search for members.  Also your join date helps for me to find you.

To cover costs to run this group we had to require a $5. yearly fee.  New members have 30 days to decide if they like the group and want to remain a member.


My Twitter account is mostly for spreading the word of injustices and political stuff.

topics.name: Support for People with Hearing Loss

results.description:
Did you know that more than 48 MILLION people have hearing loss?!

Being deaf often means being part of a unique community that hearing people are not part of. Hearing people routinely go and socialize at events where they think little of having to listen and hear. This is a group for those of us in between; those of us who are hard of hearing, late deafened, orally deaf, use hearing aids and/or cochlear implants. We live and work in a hearing world and know very little or no sign. We are able to hear to do our jobs but are limited socially when our friends want to go to the movies or a concert, etc. Captioning helps but isn't always available or easily accessible. Let's get together and just talk. It'll be nice to know that there are others out there who are "straddling the divide."

Please check out our sponsor, Hearing Loss Association of America Boston Chapter, website: HLAA Boston Chapter, or click on the link to the left of this page under Our Sponsors.
results.name: Straddling the Divide - Living with Hearing Loss

It offers an atmosphere that we all long for! It offers a fun way to exercise and focus on your own health.  It offers ways to contribute to communities where the Steppin sets are held. It offers a place to be around folks with a common love of dancing. It offers music that will soothe your soul, make your toes tap, and fingers snap.  It offers the opportunity to meet new folks with similar interest. It offers networking opportunities.  When you join the culture you will be so excited and wonder where has this been, I have been waiting for this for a long time!  Come join us!

Classes offered on Wednesday and Saturday evenings at 6:30-8:30 P.M. Held at the Cambridge Community Center. Cost $8.00 per class. Classes also offered on Saturday afternoons at the Old Colony YMCA on Main Street in Brockton. Membership is encouraged or you can pay at the door. results.description:
Daytraders are amazing people.  It takes a certain kind of passion and intellect to bring entrepreneurial skills into the realm of financial engineering to manifest self directed investment.  Enabled by the power of the computer, the connectivity of the Internet and the deregulation of the SEC, self made traders find themselves at the bleeding edge of a new revolution of wealth creation. 

Daytrading is not for the faint of heart but the alternative of working for someone else can make you feel like you're part of a 20 mule team.  Finding security in long term employment is a thing of the past and pension plans aren't what they used to be.  However, financial engineering can be accessed through day trading and it's a lot more fun when you share your experiences with others.

After graduating with a master's degree in Engineering and taking my first job as a consultant, I wanted to invest my money to generate enough wealth to become financially independent.  Years later I found I was no closer to my goal and the world of work left me cold.  I set about exploring different forms of entrepreneurship but when I discovered daytrading, the passion that fueled my work ethic reemerged like a phoenix from the ashes.  I started this group as a place where traders can celebrate their successes as well as find support and advice to do their not-always-so-easy job.  Come join us!
results.name: Daytrade!

topics.name: Making a Difference in the World

results.description: Welcome to "Biology and the Computer after Dark"! Whether you are an academic researcher, a coder, an entrepreneur, an industry professional, or simply a dreamer and a doer, we want to meet YOU. Borne from a collaboration between the Helix Bioscience Institute-HBI (www.helixbioscience.org) and Science Shaping Our World-SHOW (www.scienceshapingourworld.com), Biology and the "Computer after Dark" seeks to provide a venue for a diverse and innovative gathering of individuals interested in the amazing potential that exists within multidisciplinary groups with the desire to bring about positive change. In a business casual setting, old friends and new, can gather to network, share their ideas, pose challenges, raise a toast, tell a joke, and share in the group camaraderie. Despite our many “touch points” that allow us to be virtually connected 24/7, we often find ourselves more disconnected from each other than ever before. In the hyperfast pace of our daily lives, we are awash in an ever-increasing fog of noise and distraction that can obscure those things most important to us. Through this meetup we seek to do exactly that “meetup", connect, share, and create a rich "physical network" of colleagues and friends that can serve to enrich our professional as well as personal lives. With that I invite you to joins us for an evening of intellectual stimulation, good food, great company, and beer!
results.name: Biology and the Computer after Dark

results.description:
"Calling all Real Estate Investors, Real Estate Professionals, Realtors, Mortgage Banker's, Attorney's, Investment Bankers, Traders, Contractor's and anyone active in the Real Estate Industry. Are your hitting your goals you set for yourself this year? If not, your clearly doing something wrong as right now everyone knows we are in the best time to buy, and sell real estate!

Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations (REIA) was Established in 2013. Today Massachusetts Real Estate & Investors Associations is the largest & fastest growing real estate investment community in the tri-state area!

Whether you are just starting out in real estate investing and looking to learn, or are working on deal number one-hundred, the Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations can help you accomplish your goals all while having a ton of fun doing it. You are here because you know this is the best times to invest in real estate and you're right!

Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations members include beginner, seasoned, full, and part-time investors, accountants and attorneys, real estate agents and brokers, contractors, mortgage lenders, property appraisers and inspectors, property managers, and renovation specialists — people looking to enjoy the many benefits of the real estate industry.

We invite you to learn more about Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations, by joining us at our next General Meeting. Guests are always welcome and RSVPing is highly encouraged. Guest fees may be applied toward membership.

results.description:
The Boston Real Estate Investor Association, is an Investor Association for real estate investors and other real estate professionals dedicated to the highest level of professionalism and integrity. 

Whether you have been involved in the real estate industry for years or are just getting started, you will feel at home at our group since we will be catering to all levels of knowledge and experience. 

We will be providing you:

•  Access to local, national and international experts, trainers and experienced investors who are actively investing

• Access to local vendors and service providers that matter Fun, exciting network opportunities with other like minded professionals and industry experts,

• Ongoing educational opportunities for new and seasoned investors on many different real estate strategies 

• A platform to market your properties to other investors and buyers as well as allowing you to be the first to purchase other member properties 

• A Main Meeting on the first Tuesday of each month 

• Specialty satellite meetup groups that meet throughout the month at locations around town 

• Other seminars, workshops, bus tours, webinars, and meetups throughout the year to keep you informed on the exciting and ever changing real estate market 

We are a different from other Boston area real estate investor meetings in that we do not focus on bringing in national speakers each and every month who want to sell you books, cds and seminars for thousands of dollars. Instead, we will be focusing on delivering you affordable, local real estate education taught by local investors and professionals who are actually doing deals.  

We are also putting a very strong emphasis on live networking events, social networking and community outreach programs through local charities whom we help build, renovate and repair homes for needy families in the Boston area. We multiple meetings each month that you need to know about and attend…
results.name: Boston Real Estate Investors Association

topics.name: Mah Jongg for Experienced & Novice Players

results.description:
This meetup is for any new or experienced person who is interested in playing American style Mah Jongg in the Peabody MA vicinity.

What do you need to play?

• A rule card for the current year (this shows the permissible hands). Some extras will be made available as loaners, but you can purchase them for $7-$8 online at Amazon.com or the National Mah Jongg League web site.

• A Mah Jongg set (tiles, racks and dice). The group organizer will bring 1-2 sets to each meetup. As our group grows, it would be great if members with their own sets can bring one as well. If you want to buy your own set, they run roughly $100 for the tiles, racks and carrying case. A great source for sets is wherethewindsblow.com.

• Enthusiasm and patience. It takes a while to learn how to play Mah Jongg, but it's definitely worthwhile. It never gets boring and will give you years of enjoyment! Some members are new to Mah Jongg, and we'll help them learn the rules and get practice to hone their skills.


Choose Files from the More menu to see a Word or PDF document that explains the basic rules for American Mah Jongg.
results.name: Peabody Mah Jongg Meetup

results.description:
Inquisitive, respectful, compassionate armchair philosophers explore whether ethics can be objective, whether human freedom can be rigorously justified, whether initiation of violence is ever ethically permissible, and whether any state can morally support human freedom. We also explore how to address -- compassionately, but from universal, consistent ethical principles: 

• common objections to human freedom (e.g., "But how will roads be built?" "How will the poor survive?" "How will we defend ourselves from Iran?" "How can I stop my child from messing up his life with drugs.")? 

• false morality claims that justify the initiation of violence (e.g., "It is Good to pay teachers more.", "It is moral to protect ourselves before we are attacked.", "It is Good to pay everyone a living wage." "It is moral to prevent women from selling themselves.")

And we study important thinkers in this area.

If moral relativism, nihilism, utilitarianism, religious morals, ethics dictated by Authority, democratic ethics, etc. have felt wrong to you, but you couldn't clearly state why, come and help us figure it out.

Please join our discussion.

• Read the notes from our first meeting

• Read some thoughts about how this meet up might run
results.name: Exploring the Ethics of Human Freedom

我来自于中国大陆，来美前曾在吉林大学中日联谊医院从事临床及教学工作15年，任副教授，副主任医师，研究生导师。2001年受国家教委公派去日本东京大学留学，并取得博士学位。2007年来美国从事博士后研究。现工作于波士顿的某家大型医疗机构。
我出生于中医世家，从小接受的教育就是“不为良相，必为良医”。来美国后亲眼目睹很多美国人被肥胖所带来的疾病所折磨！也有很多人过早的离世！我利用美国的先进技术，用自然的方法，成功的帮助到很多人减肥成功！
我们的宗旨是：聚集一些减肥成功，有减肥经验的并愿意帮助他人，有爱心的有志之士。共同帮助一些想控制体重的人。主要教会他们如何健康饮食，如何保持良好的生活习惯。如何用自然的方法成功减肥，并不反弹！
本Meet Up 的对象是所有的人！既欢迎愿意帮助他人减肥的人，也欢迎自己想控制体重的人。本Meet Up 不收取任何费用。属于非盈利活动。

results.description:
The Network of South Asian Professionals of Boston (NetSAP Boston) (www.netsapboston.org) is a chapter of the NetIP America. Our mission is to serve as the unequivocal voice for the South Asian diaspora in Boston by developing and engaging a cohesive network of professionals to benefit the community. The backbone of the NetSAP community consists of not only professionals, but also leaders in business, politics, and civic life. We interact closely with the industry leaders and other South Asian organizations in furtherance of our goals. We will continue to interact closely with many of the acquaintances we make through our experiences within the NetSAP Boston organization. 

NetSAP Boston believes that our members are undeniably our greatest resource. We strive ardently to work with everyone in our local communities to provide a single platform for progressive professionals to target the many opportunities and challenges that come our way. The NetSAP Boston board members are comprised of very talented and passionate professionals pulled from various educational and professional background from engineers, doctors, advisory consultants to law students.
results.name: NetSAP Boston

results.description:
Sometimes, you just want to try a dish that scares your feebler friends away. I'm starting this group to build a network of adventurous eaters in Boston! It's never fun to sit down to dinner alone, especially when there are crickets involved. We'll work with local restaurants and chefs to host small dinners in the city and surrounding suburbs to meet new people over exotic, authentic and truly exciting food you might not otherwise have a chance to enjoy!

NOTE: Space will be limited, so dinners will likely be with 10-12 people. Watch out for dinner announcements to grab a chair at the table!
results.name: Boston Gastronauts

results.description: Does everything about food excite you? We're not talking about just the eating part, but also learning where it comes from (e.g., farms, kitchen gardens etc.), where it is sold (e.g., outdoor markets, ethnic neighborhoods, restaurants etc.), how it is prepared (e.g., smoked, blanched, steamed, fried etc.), and much, much more... Our goal in this group is to explore all things food-related - from eating at unique restaurants, attending food-themed workshops and embarking on food crawls of ethnic neighborhoods to attending cooking demos, taking classes and teaching each other our favorite dishes while cooking together. We look forward to sharing many culinary adventures!
results.name: Well Fed - Boston-area Ultimate Foodies & Cooks

results.description: This is a meetup group for people with big weight loss challenges. I have more than 100 lbs to lose and am looking for people interested in teaming up to help motivate each other, group gym visits, creative activities to get moving, and general goal support. The lifestyle change will be one of the greatest challenges, but together we can do better and have fun. Everyone with a weight loss or fitness challenge is welcome.
results.name: Drop 100

topics.name: MBTI INFJ INFP INTJ INTP ISFJ ISFP ISTJ ISTP HSP

results.description:
If the name of this group appealed to you then I doubt you need paragraph after paragraph describing what an introvert is. You know what the general perception of you is and that it tends to be far from the truth. Exhibit A: the first Google search result for "definition of introvert": noun: 1. a shy, reticent, and typically self-centered person. Really, Google?! You were doing OK until you described us as "self-centered"...

If you're on this site it's because you're looking to meet new people, and for introverts that can be a scary endeavor. I'll admit up front that I joined this site more than two years ago and I haven't attended an event yet. If this sounds like you let's change that together. My hope is that by clearly defining our age range and the types of activities we will be partaking in we will attract like-minded individuals who have common interests and passions, which will lead to meaningful connections. I also plan on mixing things up in an effort to not let the group get monotonous. Boston is a fun city which merits exploration in lieu of hanging out at the same coffee shop, bar, or bowling alley. A sampling of potential events:

• Restaurant meetups, with an emphasis on culinary offerings (I am a foodie) in a comfortable setting. Perhaps do them in a variety of series? (international, adventurous, seasonal, restaurant week, brunch, tapas, dessert)

• Bar/coffee shop meetups in small groups (4-6 people) in a laid back environment that is conducive to conversation

• Wine tastings, brewery/distillery tours

• Movie meetups - more cerebral movies instead of blockbusters (indie/foreign/art house), with the occasional must-see 3D movie (Boston Common, Coolidge Corner, Kendall Square, Harvard Film Archive, Brattle Theatre, Somerville Theater)

• Concerts - more intimate venues/jazz clubs (MFA, The Sinclair, Paradise Rock Club, Brighton Music Hall, The Middle East, Cafe 939, Orpheum Theatre, Club Passim, Regattabar, Symphony Hall, Berklee Performance Center) instead of large, loud, crowded venues

• Lectures (Harvard, MFA)

• Comedy shows (Wilbur Theatre, Laugh Boston)

• Sporty activities (snow tubing, ice skating, bowling, hiking)

• Sporting events (Red Sox, Celtics)

• Museum/aquarium outings

• you get the idea...

Please Note: this group is meant for those between the ages of 20-39. Membership will be limited to those that fall within this age range. For those who fall outside that range I appreciate your interest but hope you will join and participate in other groups that are targeted at your demographics and interests. If you feel none exist I would suggest you create one.

Code of Conduct: I ask that you please be respectful to me, our other members, and the businesses/vendors we interact with (e.g. servers, business owners, etc.). Rudeness or behavior that makes other members uncomfortable will not be tolerated and you will be removed from the group. If you encounter such behavior please let me know as my goal is to preserve a comfortable and friendly environment.

New Members: if you submit an incomplete profile or have a profile picture that isn't of you (nature, animal, etc) then your membership request will be declined
results.name: 20s & 30s Boston Introverted Explorers

results.description: Stuck in a rut with the same circle of friends and co-workers for quite a few years now? I just turned 30 and am in the same boat. I want to meet some awesome new people and maybe do some things for a good cause at the same time. I am new to the Lowell area and didn't seem to find many meetup groups near here. I love the idea of this website but didn't want to drive an hour to Boston to meet a bunch of people I don't know! Who is with me? Any ideas for awesome places in or around the Lowell area would be much appreciated!
results.name: Lowell Areas Places and People

results.description:
Social Group for the LGBT community living in and around Dorchester MA. Why travel Downtown, when you can meet others right in your neighborhood. While we will try to have events in a variety of places, most events will take place right here in Dorchester. If the group grows large enough, I will be looking for co-organizers to assist me. I love the arts and socializing in a relax atmosphere so a lot of my event ideas will be focused around that. However, I look forward to working with other leaders in the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender community interested in co-organizing and giving the group new dimension.

Need a ride?: Feel free to message me, call me or text me. Lloyd Mandrell 617-818-0403.  Just introduce yourself and let me know what group your from.  If I can't pick you up myself, I will try to find you someone I'm familiar with, within the group, whom can.
results.name: The Dorchester LGBT Group

results.description:
We're here to talk about, program, share, and demonstrate software, hardware, and ideas for the upcoming new wave of virtual reality.  Whether you're an avatar who spends more time in virtual worlds than the real one or someone who's never even worn a head mounted display, you'll find a great group of people who love VR. Each month we bring in presenters from companies who are pioneering VR technology and also feature an array of demonstrations created by our local VR developers. They can help you embark comfortably on your first VR experience or dive deep into VR design and discuss the latest news from the fast changing world of VR.

Join us on Google Groups BostonVR

On Twitter @BostonVRMeetup

Also at our LinkedIn group 

And on YouTube thanks to Robo Mouse Reporter
results.name: Boston Virtual Reality

results.description:
NSCoder Night is a monthly get-together for iOS/Mac developers. If you've got a project you want to hack on, or a problem you'd like help with bring it along. If not, just bring yourself. Developers of all experience levels more than welcome.

Who should join: Objective-C developers of all experience levels are welcome! Even if you've never even opened Xcode, we'd love to help get you up to speed!

Why you should join: No matter what your experience level, you'll be hard-pressed to find a better way to be able to ask other devs the questions that are keeping you up at night. It's also a great opportunity to solidify your knowledge by teaching. Additionally, there will be plenty of great conversation with a group of intelligent like-minded people.

What can you expect? This meetup is super laid back. After a brief introduction, we'll naturally fall into smaller working groups. People might be working individually, or in small groups, but there will always be interesting conversations about areas of iOS/Mac development that you might not be aware of.
results.name: NSCoder Night Boston

results.description: This is a group to provide single parents with fun activities to help them rebuild their social lives following separation, divorce or the death of a spouse. This group also provides events and resources to give single parents support, education and guidance in all areas to help change the course of their and their children's lives. While the purpose of this group is centered around single parents, all are welcome to join! This group is for single parents as well as anyone looking to make a difference in the lives of single parents, including professionals and business owners who provide services relating to tax and legal issues, as well as health, wellness and family issues.
results.name: HOPE for Single Parents - Boston and Metrowest

results.description:
Successful startup ecosystems begin with a collaborative culture.

Boston Startup Founder 101 brings together aspiring and experienced tech entrepreneurs to discuss, meet, and collaborate to build great new startups in Boston, and to push the local startup ecosystem forward.

In this group you can learn the best practices of starting a company from people who have been there and done that. In addition, you can meet local founders, exchange ideas, get feedback, engage in startup workshops, meet business partners, and more.

Join the group to be invited to our next event!
results.name: Boston Startup Founder 101

results.description: Join our campaign to tackle this global challenge on a local level! We're working to put more solar panels on city rooftops, create energy efficient education programs for our schools, empower Quincy residents to lower their electric bills... among many other projects. Come be a voice for change in our community.
results.name: Quincy Climate Action Network

results.description: Let's jumpstart a Making Community on Boston's South Shore. I'd love to see what others are interested and involved in in the area, and would like to get feedback and pointers on some of my own projects. A second goal is to create a teaching environment and to share teaching resources to get kids of all ages excited about turning their concepts and ideas into reality.
results.name: South Shore Makers Meetup

results.description:
Are you a wedding planner, makeup artist, floral designer, musician, videographer, wedding photographer, calligrapher, dj, caterer, owner of a bridal boutique or wedding venue, or other wedding artisan in the greater Boston area?  

Join us for an occasional cup of coffee and conversation or evening of networking with your fellow local wedding vendors.
results.name: Greater Boston Wedding Professionals

results.description:
Isha Yoga offers free meditation classes, classical hatha yoga programs, public events, and social gatherings to learn yoga and meditation, practice yoga and meditate together and have fun! We look forward to meeting you, soon! 

-----------------

What is Isha Yoga? 

Isha Yoga was founded by Isha Foundation, an international nonprofit organization dedicated to raising human consciousness. The Foundation offers powerful tools for inner wellbeing from the ancient science of yoga.  Through classical yoga and meditation, Isha empowers individuals to transform their lives, raising the consciousness of humanity one person at a time. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUeyqLTsGJs

Jump right in!   Meditate Effortlessly on your own right NOW!... 

Try Isha Kriya, FREE Guided Meditation at www.IshaKriya.com 

Isha Kriya Free Guided Meditation:

Many people find meditation difficult and frustrating when they first begin practicing, struggling with the ceaseless activity of the mind and restlessness of the body. Often, people give-up on meditation before they can reap its incredible benefits, including stress reduction, relaxation, inner peace and mental focus. 

The Isha Kriya guided meditation is a simple, but powerful inner process to align your mind, body, and inner-energies to naturally arrive at a meditative state.  Once you are meditative for even a few minutes on a daily basis, your perception of yourself and the world around becomes much deeper and richer. 

Isha Kriya guided meditation can be learned through 1-hour free meditation classes (live, local to you on Meetup), live online meditation webinars (listed weekly on Meetup, FB, Twitter), anytime through our online guided meditation video (at IshaKriya.com), or anytime and anywhere with the Isha Kriya Mobile App, available for free on all Android and Apple mobile devices.  Search for Isha Kriya in your play store to download. Meditate anywhere... then share the bliss with a friend!

12-18 minutes of Isha Kriya meditation practice daily reduces stress, anxiety and depression; increases health, energy and vitality; enhances mental focus and clarity and establishes a sense of peace and deep inner balance. Isha Kriya meditation is a gentle, seated practice. No previous yoga or meditation experience is necessary.  Realized yogi, Sadhguru, explains more about the Isha Kriya free guided meditation in the introductory video below...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4hCvdDn7Zc

"Meditation is a simple process that gives you a little distance from your own mind and your own body," explains realized yogi, Sadhguru. "You have probably heard of the word 'Buddha.' 'Bu' means 'buddhi,' or the intellect. 'Dha' means 'dada,' or one who is above. One who is 'above his intellect' is a Buddha. A Buddha has clear perception of the nature of his mind...Once you are in your intellect, stress, anxiety and tension are very normal; Once there is a distance from your physical body and your mental structure, that is the end of suffering." 

----------------------- 

Take a Deeper Step and Completely Transform Your Life:  
Eliminate Stress, Improve Relationships, Enhance Mental Clarity and Much, MUCH, more...

Inner Engineering Online Program - 7 Life-transforming Sessions in Your own Space:

"If life were to come with a manual, this in my opinion would be it! If we all applied the Inner Engineering technology, our world would instantly transform to exist from a foundation of peace, joy, and compassion for all beings." ~Evita Ochel, Evolving Beings, Consciousness Expansion and Heart-centered Living. 

What is Inner Engineering about? Inner Engineering is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. The program has been designed by Sadhguru, a yogi, visionary, and one the foremost authorities on yoga. 

Inner Engineering gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods that are the distilled essence of the yogic sciences. The course imparts practical wisdom to manage your body, mind, emotions, and the fundamental life energy within.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ooFAmT4n89Y

 Inner Engineering Benefits - A Family Physician Shares her Experience:  
(See more on the IE Youtube Channel)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ZRs69hpNB0

Today's Experiences:  Live Reviews from Inner Engineering Participants


Who is Sadhguru?...   

“A world full of love, light and laughter; its time has come. Let us make it happen.” - Sadhguru 

Renowned for his powerful programs and humanitarian initiatives, Isha Foundation founder, Sadhguru is a realized yogi, mystic, and visionary who tirelessly works for the wellbeing of all. Sadhguru has been hosted to speak and offer guided meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress. 

Isha Foundation has offered the immense benefits of classical yoga and meditation to over 7 million people over the last 30 years. Isha's US-based meditation and yoga retreat center, Isha Institute of Inner-sciences (iii), is located on 1400 breathtaking acres of Tennessee's spectacular Cumberland Plateau.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1PSNvu3JNc

Isha Institute of Inner-sciences - A Serene Mountain Getaway to Learn Classical Yoga and Meditation 

Relax and Rejuvenate at Isha's Yoga Retreat Center— 

The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences is a breathtaking mountain yoga retreat providing stress relief, rejuvenation and outdoor recreation just 45 minutes outside of Chattanooga, Tennessee. The retreat is a world-class yoga center offering classical yoga and meditation classes from beginner to advanced levels. Guests journey from around the globe to visit this unique destination to relax, reflect, and reconnect within at this tranquil oasis nestled in Tennessee’s spectacular Upper Cumberland!

Drop-by for a Day Visit

The Isha retreat center offers campus tours daily that include light hikes to one of many beautiful bluff vistas or waterfalls and a visit inside the largest yoga and meditation hall in the western hemisphere! Free guided meditation sessions are available each day, offering guests an 18-minute meditation practice called ‘Isha Kriya’ that participants can take home and do on their own. Isha Kriya is a gentle practice for anyone age 12 or older.

Hiking and Mountain Biking on Pristine Forested Trails

The Isha yoga retreat center also offers myriad opportunities for hiking and mountain biking on forested trails winding throughout its nearly 1400 acres. The yoga center's five miles of mountain biking trails have been professionally classified from beginner to intermediate skill levels, with steep climbs, water features, and tight switchbacks on the more challenging portions of the bike trail. The trails are part of an expanding network of over 15 miles of hiking and biking trails featuring beautiful waterfalls, a meandering spring-fed creek, and breathtaking bluff overlooks.

Relaxation & Wellness Retreats

Overnight stays include the option of private studio accommodations, delicious vegetarian buffet meals, and beginner-level yoga classes of the visitor`s choice, such as the 'yoga of sound', yoga for strengthening the joints, and yoga for purifying life energies.  Extended retreat packages feature Ayurvedic rejuvenation consultations and therapies; guided hikes and outdoor adventure outings to nearby caves, rivers and falls; and even vegetarian cooking classes to bring home some of your favorite vegetarian delights!  Learn how to mix the pungent, tangy spices of the East, culture farm-fresh milk into yogurt, roll vegetarian sushi, or bake homemade sourdough bread in the Isha center's popular international, vegetarian kitchen.

For more information on Isha yoga retreats and meditation programs at iii, visit: Visiting Isha Retreat  
For programs nationwide, visit: Isha Yoga Programs 

Connect: 
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/IshaUSA   
IshaUSA - Blog - http://www.ishaUSA.org/blog 
Twitter - https://twitter.com/IshaUSA 
YouTube - http://www.youtube.com/user/ishainnerengineering 
Pinterest - http://pinterest.com/source/ishausa.org/ 

Isha New England is a local non-profit that serves the metro-Boston, the Seacoast and Worcester areas. It has been based in Chelmsford, MA since 2007.
results.name: Isha Yoga New England (Free Meditation Classes)

We will get together for a weekend brunch, in home playdates, relax at the park, go for a stroll etc. Once in a while, we will also get  together without our little ones for some "me time".

However, I am moving to Southie, I have never lived in Southie before. I thought why not find a group of girls to explore South Boston spots, hang out in Southie and have fun! I figure we can have weekly dinners, coffee meet ups, brunch on Sundays, girls night out at some of the cool local spots and of course we can venture into the city.
results.name: Boston Beauties (Southie Edition)

Exchange ideas, expertise, learnings with other Engineering VPs and CTOs at tech startups in Boston. 

Talk about running and scaling start-up engineering organizations, technology choices/challenges, resource challenges.
results.name: Boston Startup Head of Engineering

results.description: Nectar is a non-verbal dance inspired by conscious and ecstatic dance. It is a space to enjoy and explore embodiment, physical expression, and the body’s wisdom. After an opening unguided warm-up period, a playlist of music progresses through a wave—beginning spacious and mellow, gaining intensity, and arriving back into stillness. Participants are welcome to move, dance, and be still as their bodies desire. Nectar opens and closes with intentional circles. Opening circles feature inspirational comments on a theme by the Facilitator-DJ, and closing circles offer participants a chance to share about their experiences in the dance. Nectar was created by Amorn O'Connor and Harrison Blum, and is supported by a rotating crew of Facilitator-DJs.
results.name: Nectar: A Conscious Dance Wave

results.description:
This group is for local 20-somethings and 30-somethings who have hands-on hobbies and would like to get out of the house, meet other creative folks, and embark on their hobby projects in a more social environment.  Graphic designers, sculptors, soap-carvers, scrapbookers, knitters, painters, drawing artists, etc.  Any hands-on creative task that is portable, containable, and safe to do around others is welcome.  (We’ll plan to be in a conference room at the Watertown Public Library.)

Come enjoy each other’s successes at the completion of projects, gasp at the sound of every “oops,” and console those who fall victim to glue spills, dropped stitches, or snapped-off pieces.  Most importantly, meet other creative types and just have a good time while doing what you love!
results.name: Waltham-Area 20s and 30s Hands-On Creatives

results.description: League of Legends is a great game, but the soloqueue experience is crap. If you want to avoid the raging Q.Qs of the soloqueue grind, join this meetup and find like-minded people in your area who want to pair up or even form full-made teams! The main focus of this group is to band together fellow league enthusiasts. I don't know if we can manage actual LAN parties (there aren't too many suitable venues around boston) but we can at the very least meet up online. If all goes well I can invite peeps over to my house to play.
results.name: Boston League of Legends

results.description:
Welcome to Adventurers of North Metro West! This group is intended for fun people who are in the age bracket 25-30's looking to get to know others in their area. Some activities might include trivia, karaoke, bowling, game nights, dancing, wine tasting, brewery tours, hiking, bonfires and much more. We will have weeknight and weekend meet-ups. Adventurers of N. Metro West is co-orgranized by Rachel and Justine.

Suggesting Events: We love new and exciting ideas from our members! If you have an idea, please message Justine and Rachel personally first. We like to gain as much information as possible to see if the event is a good fit. In order to become an event host, you must be a committed member to the group and have attended several events before we send you off on your own. We currently have four event hosts. Sarah D. enjoys hosting coffee and bar meet-ups. Tom enjoys hosting monthly restaurant meet-ups. Jami and Mike like a variety of events including kayaking, ice cream and karaoke!

Common Courtesy Policy: If you decide to RSVP "yes" to an event, please keep your commitment. A lot of planning goes into these events. We understand that things do come up. If you must cancel, please give more than 24 hour notice before an event. We would appreciate a reason why, but it is not necessary. If you do not show up to an event after you RSVP "yes" or change your RSVP to "no" more than twice without notice, you may be removed from the group. This is not meant to be harsh, but a gentle reminder to be courteous. We respect members who are committed and active in our community.

Community Funded: Our MeetUp is community funded by donations from our members. With these donations, we pay for our annual fees to run the MeetUp group, use funds to supply you with fun activities, and keep a reserve for other future events. Each summer we have an annual fundraising barbecue to raise money to fund our group. We appreciate donations at anytime! If you would like to donate, please click the "chip in" button on the desktop version of meetup.com. Thank you for being awesome!

Please make your profile picture of YOU! We like to know what you look like before an event so we know who to look for. Please subscribe to organizer emails. We send out an email 24 hours before an event to make sure you know all of the important details,

We do not tolerate any harassment of any kind. If you feel you are being harassed, please contact an organizer immediately.
results.name: Adventurers of N. Metro West 25-30's
