results.description:
Do you live in the Brookline, Brighton, Allston area? 

Do you like discovering favorite local restaurants, local hot spots and meeting new people? 

Do you want to network with interesting people your age? 

Our community is for you! We are a local community of 20's and 30's professionals who are active, fun and adventurous. Sometimes we'll dine at favorite local restaurants, other times we'll play tennis at a local tennis court. We are a popular community that emphasizes: Great variety. Good times. Inclusivity! 

Some of you may recognize me. I am also the entrepreneur and executive director of the Boston Volunteers, one of Boston's most well respected nonprofits. 

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org
results.name: Brookline Area Social for 20's and 30's!

results.description:
We would love to welcome you to be a part of Oh Baby! Fitness. We offer fitness classes for expecting moms and new moms with their babies on the south shore in Massachusetts. Exercising during pregnancy is one of the best things you can do for your changing body. It helps your mind as well as your body. We offer pregnancy water aerobics classes in a heated pool at Webb's Pro Fitness in Norwell.  Let us help you feel your best during pregnancy. 


For moms who have recently had babies and babies up to a year, we want to help you get your body back while exercising with your baby. We offer mom and baby pool class at Healthtrax in Hanover and at Plymouth Fitness in Plymouth. Join us for a great pool workout while your baby rides alongside in a pool float. At Webb's Pro Fitness, we also offer mom and baby fitness classes. Mom's wear their baby in a front carrier while getting a fabulous workout in.

In the spring we will be adding outside stroller classes!
results.name: Oh Baby! Fitness exercise classes on the South Shore, MA

results.description: This group is for all Doodle varieties, be it Labradoodle, Goldendoodle, or anything in between! We have a Goldendoodle ourselves, and several doodles in daycare with us every week. They're sweethearts with lots of energy and we want to give them a space to play with their curly and furry brothers and sisters! We'll plan on meeting once a month at our daycare facility Big Dog Walkin' in Brighton, MA. Once it gets warmer outside hopefully we can have some meetups at nearby dog parks.
results.name: Doodle Daze

results.description:
The Dedham School of Music cordially invites you (and your friends!) to join us for a growing series of Acoustic Jams and musical events. We rent "The Classroom" at the Mother Brook Arts and Community Center (the old Avery School), 123 High Street, Dedham Massachusetts and use our space to play, promote and enjoy music in all its forms. Check back for additional events . . . we are programming more events growing month by month!!!

ON VACATION -Join us 7:00 - 9:00 pm for our monthly "4th Sunday Acoustic Freestyle Jam." This FREESTYLE Jam is for folks who like a wide music palette (rock, jazz, swing, etc.) and who enjoy playing flute, clarinet, brass and wind instruments. The "4th Sundays" Jam is deliberately and unabashedly freestyle: from the Beatles and the Boswell Sisters to The Box Tops, Dan Hicks, gospel and acapella, the loose structure of the "4th Sundays Acoustic Freestyle Jam" is designed for singing and playing music in all its forms.

For those who love Bluegrass music we have two possibilities for you.

ON VACATION  - The first is "Really Strictly Bluegrass" held the 3rd Friday of every month. Suitable for intermediate or advanced Bluegrass jammers, this Jam welcomes those playing traditional stringed Bluegrass acoustic instruments like mandolin, guitar, banjo and fiddle. We do traditional Bluegrass songs to start our weekend. 

For novice players or those who want to start learning Bluegrass we offer a Bluegrass SLOW JAM the third Tuesday of every month from 7:30 - 9:00 pm. Taught by longtime Bluegrass performer George Chapman, we sloooowly play through  simple traditional Bluegrass songs, offering guidance and encouragement as we go. We make this the safest possible place to get comfortable playing with others.  Players of all levels are welcome and we take special care to provide guidance for beginners and casual musicians. 

All our Jams are free . . . we "pass the hat" to help cover our rent and expenses.
results.name: Musical Jams and Concerts by the Dedham School of Music

results.description: Its all about fun for our little ones! Lets make friends, discover new local places that are kid friendly, and keep our children active.
results.name: Merrimack Valley Moms

results.description: Unique and fun events, along with your standard happy hours, parties and bar crawls. Toss in an occasional hike, networking event, or sporting event. 20's - 30's. Let's throw together some good events where people can get out and meet. Come on -- Be social! ENJOY BOSTON. Have an idea for an event? Suggest it!

results.name: Brighton and Brookline Moms Meetup

results.description:
The Oldest Women's Motorcycle club in New England...

The Moving Violations Motorcycle Club, Inc. was founded in June of 1985 by a small group of women who enjoyed riding together and sharing information about motorcycling. Women on their own bikes were few and far between, and the experience of meeting and riding with one another brought strength, friendship and knowledge. From this experience evolved our basic philosophy: to enjoy safe, noncompetitive riding with other women motorcyclists. Although most of our members are based in Metro-Boston, we also come from greater New England,  New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and as far away as Colorado.


Our activities can include picnics, camping trips, bowling, movies, leading parades, maintenance clinics, motorcycle safety courses,  fund-raisers and spontaneous rides to just about anywhere. All members are encouraged to develop and participate in group events. We have several official rides per year: 2 Novice Rides (Spring/Late Summer), the Benefit Run (May), the Provincetown Run (July/August), the Berkshire Run (September/October) and we lead the Lesbian and Gay Pride Parade in June. Some of our rides are exclusively for members and prospects only. Additional rides may be announced in the club newsletter or organized informally.


If you don't know any of us yet, come meet us! If you would like to attend our next club ride or come to a general meeting, please contact us at info@movingviolationsmc.com
results.name: Moving Violations Motorcycle Club

topics.name: The Open Web Application Security Project

results.description:
The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a 501(c)(3) worldwide not-for-profit charitable organization focused on improving the security of software. Our mission is to make software security visible, so that individuals and organizations worldwide can make informed decisions about true software security risks.

Everyone is free to participate in OWASP and all of our materials are available under a free and open software license. You'll find everything about OWASP here on or linked from our wiki and current information on our OWASP Blog. OWASP does not endorse or recommend commercial products or services, allowing our community to remain vendor neutral with the collective wisdom of the best minds in software security worldwide. We ask that the community look out for inappropriate uses of the OWASP brand including use of our name, logos, project names and other trademark issues. We usually meet the FIRST WEDNESDAY of EVERY MONTH (Unless a speaker can only present another night), 6:30 to 9 pm. Everyone is welcome to come to any meeting, there is no signup or joining criteria, just come if it sounds interesting. Feel free to sign up to the OWASP Boston mailing list.


Any questions or comments, tweet us at @owaspboston or email us!
results.name: OWASP Open Web Application Security Project Boston

results.description:
This is a group focused on LGBTQ culture, heritage, social issues, and politics from a Russian and Eastern European perspective. 

Originally focused on Russian-Speaking LGBTQ individuals, we welcome progressive people who identify with and support Russian LGBTQ culture and heritage. We welcome everyone who has ties to Russian (and neighbors) LGBTQ communities to join us. 

Our activities have included social action around the Sochi Olympics, a gender and sexuality conference, wine tasting, meals, and local happenings (like the Dyke March).  Most events use English as the dominant language. 

This is the Boston branch of RUSA LGBT Meetup group located in New York City. Anyone from Boston area or visiting from another state or another country is welcome to attend.

Let's celebrate our identity and fight for diversity, social justice, human and civil rights for LGBTQ people everywhere we live. Let’s join together in creating a social network and community united by common culture.

Bring along your family, friends and significant others. Let's get together, hang out, share our stories, have fun and create a Russian-and-friends LGBTQ community along the way. We are single, we are couples, we are parents, we have parents, sisters and brothers - we are just like you!

Tell us a few words about yourself. Our approval process is quick and easy. We are very friendly bunch and our meetups are a lot of fun. Go ahead and join us. We hope to meet you soon!

We also invite you to join us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/rusa.lgbt.

results.description:
Are you a writer? A self employed business owner who works from home? A blogger? A grad student with a dissertation to finish? Do you find that when you work from home, distractions have a way of sabotaging the time you try to set aside (even self induced ones like Facebook and email checking)? Do you find yourself battling with procrastination every week? 

This Meetup is for people who want to have a designated block of 2 hours (or more) a week to focus on uninterrupted writing or other work. We have different days, times and places we gather. 

The idea is to bring your laptop or whatever you need for your work. Come 15 or 30 minutes early to get your coffee, say hello to each other and settle in --- then there's a start time when we agree to finish up the social chat and get down to our respective work intentions for the meetup time. The simple, supportive presence of each other makes for good connection & accountability. 


My name is Katrina. Being self employed, I always welcome a little structure for self-accountability and procrastination management. I often do my work in coffee shops anyway - perhaps you do too? 

That's why I started this Meetup. Thought it would be a great way to commit to showing up and working in a focused way every week. Also a nice way to make some new friends and connections. If you're looking to structure a time to work for yourself... I invite you to join us. 

Important Note: (please read) We do ask that you, please, only sign up if you are serious about using this as focused (read: quiet) work time. 

Our opportunity for enjoying social, conversation time happens before and after our official self-work hours. 

Any questions - feel free to ask!
results.name: A Time for Work

Our national goal is to bring together the nation's minority professionals in the real estate industry to promote the meaningful exchange of ideas about our business and how best to serve our clientele. We strive to create an environment where creativity flourishes in both the workplace and the marketplace. 

To service our target market, we ensure training and educational opportunities are available to our entire membership across the many disciplines we represent, providing certifications and special designations in many areas of interest. Our ability to professionally service our client base is the foundation by which we operate. 

Our organization was founded in 1947, making it the oldest minority trade association in America. It was formed out of a need to secure the right to equal housing opportunities regardless of race, creed, or color. Since its inception, we have participated in various meaningful challenges and legislative improvements, to establish fair housing for all.

NAREB is governed by a board of directors and an executive committee comprised of members and leaders in the industry from across America.

results.description:
CALLING ALL CHRISTIANS, YOUNG AND NOT-SO-YOUNG :-), NEW AND SEASONED IN THE FAITH:

God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son.  Jesus Christ so loved us that he laid down his life for us.  He came that we might “have and enjoy life, and have it in abundance (to the full, till it overflows).”  [John 10:10 from The Amplified Bible]  He died for us so we could live for Him.  It’s our time to let the Son shine in our lives…and to have fun along the way! 

Our meetups are informal, non-denominational gatherings focused on practical Christianity.  Some of our meetups are Bible studies which include brief, powerful, and practical teachings from God’s Word.  Other activities we enjoy together include game and movie nights, dining in and out, dancing, bicycling, community walks, music in the park, field trips to local attractions, city excursions, etc.

Our goal is to encourage each other in our efforts to learn, live, and give the light of God’s Word.  We want people to see how awesome God is and that His Word works every time we believe it. 

Some scriptures that guide and inspire us are (visit the "pages" tab for the full text of these verses):

Matthew 5:14 and 16

II Corinthians 5:14 and 15

I John 1:4 and 5

Hebrews 10:23-25

results.description:
Are you a budding actor and/or filmmaker?

Got a scene you're working on?

Need a place to air out your creative process? 

In this group you will find:

- a place to run scenes you are working on for auditions, films, and theater projects.

-  a supportive, creative environment in which to work on developing your own methods and process as a filmmaker and/or actor.

- the opportunity to observe and learn from others.

- a chance to act in or direct scenes.

If you plan on coming, please RSVP, and bring:

Scripted material you want to work on, 3-5 pages max, or something comparable. Don't forget copies for the people you may want to read for you. Or just show up and improvise a scene you've been thinking about. Or just show!!

Most scene study groups charge $60.00 or more.

The cost here is $5.00  

Also, please be aware that this is not a group critique, and that we divide up the time as evenly as possible for people to get a chance to work on their own thing. When it's your turn, you are in charge of your time - so please feel free to be explicit with the group about what sort of assistance/ feedback you want or don't want. When the times up we keep it rolling along to the next scene..

Look forward to seeing you there!

Best, 
Robert

results.description:
Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

WomenWhoCode.com

Twitter | Facebook | Blog

results.description:
Who we are

We are a group of baby boomers, family members and working adults caring for elderly parents, sick or injured spouses, neighbors, friends and other loved ones. We want to succeed in this role while maintaining our own lives and wellness.

What we do

As givers of care, many of us need support but often do not qualify for publicly-funded support programs yet are not fortunate enough to afford private help, private care management services and guidance on an ongoing, private pay basis (out-of-pocket). Our goal is to get together, support each other and get affordable group-based support, advice and guidance. We'll meet in person once a month to exchange information, learn and practice critical skills, get our questions answered, hear from experts, see practical demos, share tips and ideas, discuss solutions to common and new challenges, share reviews, get advice on maintaining our own wellness and sanity, discuss any issues of concern, explore useful strategies, organize day trips, nights-out, movies, games, dinner … and anything else that looks like fun. We'll shape the agenda together and look forward to meeting you.

To RSVP for our next event or make suggestions, go to http://www.meetup.com/www-boomergiv­ersofcare-org/
results.name: Boomers & Working Adults Caring for Parents & Spouses

results.description:
Please read this entire page prior to joining New England Dog Friendly Day Trips, Getaways, Gatherings.


This group is for dog lovers who would like:

- Weekend getaways with your dog

-Attending day trips that are dog friendly

- Exploring New England with your furry friend

-Socializing with others that love their dog

-Participating in fun dog friendly events

 -Or just spend an afternoon together


If you are like me, your dog is a very important part of your life.

I love to be outdoors and exploring new places, but most meetups that I belong to don't offer a lot of dog friendly excursions. Through my research I have found many great places to go, events to attend, and overnight getaways to participate in with my faithful companion. Join us on some of these adventures!

Only well behaved, socialized dogs and their humans are welcome to join. If you like the company of dogs ( and their humans) and don't have a dog in your life at the moment, you are welcome to join us as well.

Please post a current photo of you, or you and your dog, so that we can recognize you at an event!

If you are a no-show on 2 or more events, you will be removed from the group. Simply update your RSVP if you cannot attend, so that someone else can attend. A no-show is when you do not attend an event that you RSVP'd yes for, and do not change your RSVP to indicate that you will not attend.

Rules:

1)If you choose to let your dog(s) off-leash, you are responsible for the dog's actions according to the terms of the Liability Waiver. You also agree to be responsible for any fines that may be incurred due to a breach of rules of the organization owning or responsible for the meetup location.

2) Dogs are expected to be well behaved and under owner control at all times. This group is for well socialized dogs only! We are not the venue for dogs that are learning how to socialize! The Meetup organizer reserves the right to remove or limit participation of members in any event due to a members inability to control their dogs behavior, including excessive barking, making others in the group feel uncomfortable in any way, aggressive behavior, or any behavior that exhibits lack of control of the dog, or causes another dog to feel unsafe.

If your dog barks excessively, any restaurant  event may not be appropriate for your dog. Let's face it! All dogs will bark! Barking within reason is expected!  Excessive barking is when your dog continues to bark and will not stop even when you use a voice command to attempt to stop his/her barking. Please be prepared to remove your dog from the event, if you cannot control his/her barking. It is not fair to other patrons of the establishment who are trying to enjoy the venue as well. We want to be invited back to a chosen venue, and do not want to jeopardize that in any way!

If your dog has an incident of aggressive behavior, causes other dogs or people in the group to feel uncomfortable in an way, you will be removed from the group.

3) You agree to take personal and financial responsibility for any damages to property, people or other dog(s) caused by your dog(s) or any dog(s) you have brought to the meetup.


4) By becoming a member of this group, you are confirming that your dog does not have any history of behavioral issues or aggressiveness.

5) Dogs must be leashed at all times. Retractable leashes,shock collars, choke collars are not allowed. Any type of restraining collar is not permitted. If your dog needs a shock collar or choke collar, this group is not for you and your dog. Off leash walks are not encouraged.

6) This meetup is about having fun and meeting new friends. Please be kind and respectful of others at all times. I am not responsible for the actions of others, and cannot be held responsible for members actions. Any complaint about an individual will result in removal from the group.

7) Please understand that this is a public meetup group. We take lots of photos and add them to the Meetup site. Please let us know in advance if you do not want to be photographed.

8) No solicitations, advertisements, postings of items for sale, or promotions of any kind are allowed by members without the consent of the organizer. Members in violation will be removed.

9) In order to participate in any overnight trip, you must be current with member dues, and have attended 2-3 day trips prior to the overnight trip.

10) Please be respectful and pick up after your dog at all times.

11) Your dog must be over 2 years old to participate in events.

12) By joining this group, you are confirming that your dog is up to date on all shots and or titers, is healthy, and is spayed/neutered.

Liability Release - In order to join and or participate in this meetup group, you agree  :  to hold harmless the organizer and her heirs, and all members and participants of this Meetup group and their heirs, from any and all claims of injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and or any other reasons. You also agree to assume all psychological , physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. All meetup activities pose assumed risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.


            Let's start exploring New England with our faithful companions!
results.name: New England Dog Friendly Day Trips, Getaways, Gatherings

results.description:
Our group is open and friendly to everyone interested in triathlon training or one of the following: Swimming, road biking, or running. Let's be real - what beats a group that gets a bunch of people together in speedos and bike shorts? This is a great group for people interested in exercise, especially those who are training for road races (such as 5k, 10k, half-marathon, marathon), bike rides, swim competitions, or triathlons such as the annual August Boston Triathlon. It's also a social group for people to meet other GLBT athletes in the area! 

Here are some examples of past meetups: A six-mile Charles River run loop, a four-mile South Boston beach loop followed by a beer at a pub, a bike ride along the Minuteman Bikepath from Cambridge to Bedford, a 40-mile bike ride and swim to Walden pond, a one-hour swim workout at a local pool followed by dinner, and an open water swim at Pleasure Bay in South Boston.

 Looking forward to meeting everyone! Please suggest this to any of your friends that are interested in running, biking, and swimming.
results.name: Boston LGBT Triathlon Group (Swimmers, Cyclists, or Runners)

results.description:
Improvisational photography is exercise for photographers.

We meet regularly, in a t-accessible location, to sharpen our eye, our instincts and our technical skill with improvisational challenges. 

At each meeting, we have a chance to introduce ourselves and discuss photography before getting a one or two word photo prompt and setting out to find images inspired by that prompt. 

Afterward, we meet up again, talk about the images we've found and gain inspiration from each other's creative solutions. 

Prompts are posted after the event for those who can't make it,  and members are encouraged to participate in the monthly challenge online via instagram and meetup.

**To maintain an active group, there is a minimal yearly membership fee of $5 to join this group. You will have a 60 day grace period in which you can attend a meetup and participate before paying the fee to officially join. There are no additional charges for individual meetups.
results.name: Improv Photo Boston

We are able to tackle many studio photo projects not normally available to photographers or models because of our home studio.

results.description:
Driven by the motivation to predict, influence and create the future, Boston Futurists seek to take the best this city has to offer in terms of its diverse investment in technology, science, ecommerce and the arts. Let's gather together and forge a new direction, and have a fun time doing it! 


On the first weekend of the month from 1pm - 3pm, we have an event based meetup where we demo cutting edge technology or listen to speakers who work in future related fields.


On the third Tuesday of the month from 7:30pm - 9pm, we have a discussion about trends and topics related to future studies. This is a great time to get to know our group and gives everyone an opportunity to think and discuss the future.

 

There is a subreddit reddit.com/r/BostonFuturists to work in parallel with this community, and a much larger subreddit dedicated to future studies - reddit.com/r/Futurology!

results.description:
Welcome, and thank you for stopping by!

This group was created to promote Catholic fellowship, and celebrate the blessed gift of Christ in the Eucharistic.  Deo Gratius. <br>

<br>

This group hopes to connect Catholics, for social fellowship... fellowship which of course might incorporate our faith.  Eucharistic Adoration seemed to be a subject which might bring that goal into focus.  

Of course, adoration is a quiet time. It is not conducive to social interactions. So, my thoughts are that maybe we could find a way to incorporate adoration into some other sorts of social activities.  Perhaps we would meet for a short adoration either before or after the activity.

What sort of activity? Well, some ideas might include:

• Short pilgrimages to local shrines

• Attending Mass at a parish we might not have been to before

• Attending movies (faith related) together

• Perhaps organizing more adventurous trips, like to the national shrine in DC

<br>

May God's blessings be with you; May the peace and mercy of his only son, Jesus Christ, fill your heart; and may the joy and wisdom of his Holy Spirit guide your every step, this day and always!

<br>

<br>

http://youtu.be/ASHEyV8Wr4U

results.description:
We run a FREE Women's Self Defense Program every Saturday at 10:00 AM, at our 16 000 Sq Ft Self Defense Studio in Charlestown. We teach the SEPS (Situation Effective Protection System) approach to Self-Defense & Self-Protection that teaches and empowers individuals how to predict, identify and avoid violence. Rather than teach a set of safety tips, and well meant good advice, we teach people how to make dynamic risk assessments of the situations they face and how to make correct and appropriate personal safety decisions. Our system is based on academic research and real world experiences of those working in the security industry.

For more information please go to: www.womensselfdefenseboston.com

We use Krav Maga Yashir techniques for the physical component of the system. Krav Maga is the system of close combat that is taught to members of the IDF (Israeli Defense Forces), and is based on instinctive, reflexive and natural movements that are quick and easy to learn.
results.name: Women's Self Defense Boston

results.description:
Boston Meditation and EasyYoga Group gathers for the purpose learning and practicing meditation and simple yoga. We will explore many ancient techniques from Yoga and other traditions. We will use sound and vibration. We learn and practice active breathing techniques designed strengthen the breath and focus concentration. We will promote meditation as a healing practice. We will come together as a group to practice and promote all of these ideas. 

We are not a religious group. We are not selling any stories about supernatural powers or death denial. We are not soliciting money for "noble causes".  We charge a reasonable fee to pay the teacher and support the studio. In return we teach effective methods for handling stress, anxiety, emotional instability, and depression. Though we use ancient Yoga methods as a system we are not attached to them. if Yoga practices fail to help us reach our goal of relaxation and inner peace either we work on it more or we abandon them for other more practical means.  

Please join us and help us to better define who we are.


peace
results.name: Boston Meditation and Easy Yoga Group

results.description:
WE ARE NOT A CHRISTIAN SINGLES DATING MEETUP.  

We want to get this out there in case you are looking for a group that is geared towards this. They are plenty of good ones doing this. So read on about who we are if you are okay with us not organized for those looking to meet your next partner.


We are Christians at Work seeking to honor God through our choice of work. 

We explore difficult questions:

How do we give God glory in our work?

How do we elevate work above only earning a salary?

How do we spread the Gospel by our actions and words when performing our duties?

How do we sanctify work that is toilsome and challenging and low paying?

What roles do faith, prayer and perseverance play when our work is more a duty than a labor of love?

How do we know when we are working for the glory of God and not just for the glory of our selves and to feed our insatiable appetites for material possessions?

How do we stay faithful to our duty when God says "stay" but we want to leave?

How do we leave in faith and in obedience to God when fear tells us stay because we can't see the future?

Are we living out, and how so, the command to return a tithe offering of resources, time and talent?

We are also about day-to-day realities like unhappiness and challenges on the job; difficult colleagues and superiors and how to leave when staying is unhealthy emotionally, physically and spiritually or staying when we have no choice. 

Where other groups focus on growing membership and define success by its numbers our focus is on small group intimacy, integrity, safety, confidentiality and encouragement and support. 

Before joining us we ask you to read and reflect on our guidelines and to consider whether you can commit to them.   

 

Meetup Guidelines for creating a Sacred Space:

Honor ~ Honor God and each other by our choice of words, manners and actions.

Disclosure ~ Disclosing if you have an association with a present member and whether that is through a referral by a present member or an external source. 

Confidentiality ~ We best exemplify our Christian values by keeping our conversations confidential when we part.

Respect ~ Treat each other with respect even in disagreement. Respecting the right/choice of each member to share or be an active listener. No one is REQUIRED OR INVITED to share unless he/she so desires. 

Sharing ~ Give our attention to the member speaking and likewise to receive the full attention of the group when speaking.  Sidebar conversation when others are speaking is considered rude and disrespectful.

Time ~ Speak concisely so as to give other members an opportunity to speak/share without interruption.


If these are guidelines you can adhere to, our group is happy to welcome you and look forward to meeting you. 

We welcome workers from all backgrounds; those who are happily employed and those not so happily; those nearing retirement; those in transition discerning a new career and those now entering the workforce or returning to it after a break. 

So now that you have learned who we are and what we are about, you may have decided to join us and " Commit your work to the LORD."  Proverbs 16:3.  

If you have joined us - Welcome!
results.name: Christians at Work for the Glory of God

results.description:
Boston 1 is a non-profit dragon boat club in Boston. We are always looking for people to join season round!

We're a crew of fun young international people who are young professionals and students who all share a love for paddling. Boston 1 is a team that balances a fun social atmosphere with a competitive edge - a family away from home where we encourage friendship, support and physical fitness. 


Schedule

During the summer season we paddle together 3 times a week (Mon/Wed 6-8pm, Sat 11am-1pm) at Fort Point Channel. We also race in regional dragon boat race festivals about 4 times over the course of the summer. We treat race events like road trips: driving with friends around the North-east, paddling competitively, having adventures, eating, drinking and getting to know each other better!

In the winter off-season we continue to workout together. Our strength coach has designed a winter weight lifting program and you get personal training from the coaches!


Prices

New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who decide to join get a $10 deduction from membership! Annual membership covers the start of the water season 2015 all the way through winter of 2015/2016.


What to expect

Dragon boat is an athletic sport. We aren't going for a lazy sight-seeing paddle. Your heart will be pumping, you will get sweaty, you will get splashed, you will have a lot of fun.  We work hard together so that we can race strong and be proud of our efforts. Do expect to get a good workout with some impressive beasts on the boat, but most importantly, we do all this in a non-judgemental and welcoming environment. All fitness levels are welcome.


Social Stuff

The team also comes together at social events that are organized throughout the year (long bike rides, bowling, pub nights, pot lucks, winter ski retreats and end-of-year banquets). 

Come try our club out, we welcome new members at all times of the year. No prior experience necessary! For more information on our team or the next practice, check us out on www.boston1.org, or email us if you have questions boston1.dboat@gmail.com

1 crew, 1 family, 1 goal!

http://youtu.be/8cS_t0YQ0bw


Admin Stuff

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water: http://bit.ly/Boston1Waiver

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in twitter, facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts here: http://bit.ly/JoinBoston1

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook


Attendance and Racing expectations

We understand your busy lives and many responsibilities. We encourage our paddlers to attend as many practices as possible, especially around race meets. Attending race meets are not a requirement...but racing is a ton of fun and very addictive.
results.name: Boston 1 Dragon Boat Team

results.description:
Join us for weekly practice in Boston just a couple of blocks from the Tuffs Medical Center Orange Line T station on Washington Street. Our practice is 90 minutes of traditional Japanese karate with direct lineage to Gichin Funakoshi and includes kihon, kumite and kata. Practitioners of all levels are welcome. You will receive the highest caliber instruction. Come experience Boston’s best kept secret!

Practice is on Mondays and Thursdays from 7:15 – 9.00 P.M. and Saturdays from 10:15 A.M. to Noon.

Karate-do is the Way of the Empty Hand. It is derived from the ancient Okinawan fighting style and heavily influenced by the Chinese martial arts. The style of karate we practice is the traditional Shotokan as practiced from the time of Gichin Funakoshi. We are affiliated with Shotokan Karate of America (SKA).

Master Gichin Funakoshi introduced karate-do to mainland Japan in 1916. He had been initiated into all the major Okinawan karate methods and taught a synthesis of the Okinawan styles as a total discipline. This method became known as Shotokan. Because of the great popularity of the style in Japan and, later, around the world, Funakoshi is widely considered to be the “father of modern karate-do. Aside from creating Shotokan karate and introducing it to Japan and the world, Funakoshi Sensei also wrote several books, one of which is “Karate-Do Kyohan” - The Master Text, which is the “handbook” of Shotokan. The original Japanese text of Karate-Do Kyohan was translated into English by Tsutomu Ohshima in 1973.

We practice Shotokan karate in the traditional manner for the development of mind, body, and spirit. This art form has been passed down from teachers to students in an unbroken line from Funakoshi Sensei himself to Ohshima Sensei to us. We believe it is the responsibility of each practitioner to learn and practice the techniques correctly so that the tradition is preserved and can be passed on intact to the next generation.

Shotokan Karate of America is a national nonprofit organization that has been teaching traditional karate-do in the United States since 1955. SKA was founded and is still led by Tsutomu Ohshima, who is one of Master Funakoshi Sensei’s last direct pupils. In 1955 Mr. Ohshima came to the United States and was the first person to teach karate to the U.S. public. To learn more, go to: http://ska.org/about/history-of-karate/.
results.name: Boston Area Shotokan Karate

results.description:
Welcome! 

I am happy to share I am now the owner of Life Balance Yoga & Wellness in North Billerica!

I started this group as a way to share my classes - since I was teaching in various places and now there is much more to offer and many more classes!    Great teachers here and Reiki , Soul Collage offerings and meditation events. :) 

Life Balance Yoga & Wellness 


Link to schedule Schedule  


Join the studio page on Facebook too if interested & for last minute cancellations .   The Facebook page is primarily where I post updates then the website.   

A bit about me....As a Registered Nurse for 17 years and with 20 years in Health Care I have seen the effects of stress on patients, their caregivers and my fellow Nurses. I have had a passion all of my life in the areas of wellness, self-improvement and the mind-body-spirit connection. I have experience in areas of Community Health, Oncology, Case Management, General Med-Surgical, Orthopedic, and Emergency Nursing. This experience as a Nurse has given me understanding of how all people - patients, their caregivers and the health care workers are affected by stress and burnout. Yoga became my LIFELINE when I was working night shift in the ER - It helped me so much to destress and ultimately take action towards regaining balance in my life. I do have a special interest in helping all Caregivers and Nurses with stress management & self-care. 

My Yoga style is gentle - moderate Hatha Yoga designed for stress relief. 

My classes are laid back and relaxed...stretch, laugh, build strength and flexibilty and repeat.   I am not interested in Yoga as a workout so much as a work IN.    My teaching style is focused less on alignment and more on the experience of yoga in your own body.   Finding what works for you...

Life is always a balancing act - Yoga is your net! My Mission as a Yoga teacher is to cultivate personal power, personal practice, personal growth and provide space in a class to experience your Yoga ~ I teach Gentle to Moderate Hatha Yoga always exploring our edges to grow and evolve. 

There are also free meditations & discussions on my you tube channel  - with more to come...    

I hope to see you in class & please contact me with any questions! Namaste - Kerry
results.name: Life Balance Yoga & Wellness

results.description:
This is a support network for those of us who have things to do or accomplish that we keep putting off and not doing, and for those of us who believe in giving and / or getting support to accomplish more in life. And for those of us who want to enjoy life! Have more fun! Suffer less!

The idea is to volunteer, give, get, or trade support. For example, I have a section of my basement that I want to clean up and get rid of stuff I don't need. And I never do it. I'd contact someone in the network (or someone would contact me, if they feel so moved) and we will agree to meet in my basement at a specific time, for one to three hours, and do what needs to be done. I may agree to barter with my support person the same amount of time, where I help him or her another day; or I may just receive the support as a gift, if my person isn't trading or doesn't need support in anything at this time, or prefers that someone else does it; or maybe just believes "what goes around comes around." Whatever.

You may want a different kind of support, such as to change careers or some action that takes a more sustained effort than simply cleaning up a basement. You'd find someone, or several someones, for that.

You may wish to volunteer and helps others, even though you don't need support.

You may be in a tough situation or very challenging time in life, and really need support; so you just receive help, without any compulsion to give back at this time.

I also wish to have more fun and more company in life! "Many hands make light work" is an old saying I find quite true. So I hope this meet-up will make doing stuff that needs to be done more fun!
results.name: GET IT DONE!: A Support Network for getting stuff done

results.description:
We are women 50+, professional and of course ... Fabulous, looking to expand their social life and meet some great new friends along the way. 

We can try new restaurants, go to a play or craft fair or just a simple walk. 

Because we all live in MetroWest, we can get together regularly after work for dinner,  plan fun events for the weekend or just meet for a drink. 

I would also love to meet some women to travel with. It could be a spa weekend or something more extravagant like renting a house in Tuscany for a week!!!

I don't believe in a lot of rules like some groups but I do have a couple:

1. If you RSVP Yes and then decide not to come PLEASE change your RSVP to NO as soon as you decide not to come. Many times we have people on a wait list and it is only fair that they have time to arrange to come to our event.

2. The 2nd rule has to do with no shows. If you no show an event that you have RSVP'd for (meaning you did not go in and change your RSVP to No), then that is a no show. If you no show a 2nd time then you will be asked to find another group to join. I think this is only fair. I put quite a bit of time into planning events and the 2 rules written here are my only rules.

Lastly, because Meet-up has raised their fees to $180 per year I now charge $5 a year to be part of the group! I don't think $5 is a lot to ask. 

Read the reviews! It makes me so proud to know I have made people so happy and I have made a great group of friends along the way.

Bonnie
results.name: ** 50+ and Fab  ** MetroWest Women's Social Club  **

The Young Member (YM) committee in the Appalachian Mountain Club's (AMC) Boston Chapter is dedicated to encouraging people in their 20s and 30s to get involved in the AMC and enjoy the outdoors!

With many volunteer leaders and co-leaders, we offer a variety of activities and events. You may find us leading day hikes, backpacking, social events, local walks, trail work, kayaking, mountain biking, biking, skiing, camping, and other activities. We sponsor trips throughout the year, most of which involve exploring different regions of New England. All of our leaders and co-leaders have completed an outdoor safety and leadership course offered by the AMC.

Nationally, the AMC promotes the protection, enjoyment, and understanding of the mountains, forests, waters, and trails of the Appalachian region. We believe these resources have intrinsic worth and also provide recreational opportunities, spiritual renewal, and ecological and economic health for the region. Because successful conservation depends on active engagement with the outdoors, we encourage people to experience, learn about, and appreciate the natural world.

To learn more about us check out our website or Facebook:

Newcomers and (other) people of all ages, shapes and fitness levels are welcome. Four-legged friends are welcome too. This is a FREE group, open to all!

Some of the venues where we will be walking are listed in the file posted on the More > Files pages. If you notice anything wrong or out-of-date in a location's write-up, please let me know so I can correct it.

I welcome your feedback and suggestions on how to make this a fun and  vibrant group. If you have walking locations you can recommend, please let me know. If you have feedback, please let me know or leave a group review.

Lastly, some of the venues do charge an admission, which is generally at a reduced rate during off-season or if you are a member. I encourage you to support the fine organizations that care for these venues by becoming a member.

• Trustees of Reservations operates many of the nicest locations like Halibut Point in Rockport, Long Hill in Beverly, and Appleton Farms in Ipswich.

• A MassParks Pass, offering admissions to Massachusetts State Parks, is available from ReserveAmerica.

Thanks!

results.description:
The Open Meadow Zen Group is a Korean style Zen Buddhism based group that is part of the Kwan Um School of Zen. It was was founded by Zen Master Bon Haeng. We meet every Monday and Wednesday nights (7:30 pm) and Sunday morning (9:00 am) for regular meditation practice which includes sitting, walking meditation, chanting, and a short Dharma reading. Practice takes place in the tranquil Dharma room, with expansive views of town conservation land.

Our Guiding Teacher, Zen Master Bon Haeng, is a Dharma heir to Korean Zen Master Seung Sahn, the 78th Patriarch in his line of transmission in the Chogye order of Korean Buddhism, and founder of the Kwan Um School of Zen. Practice includes Kong-An (Koan) interviews with Zen Master Bon Haeng every other week (please click the interviews link for more information and an up-to-date schedule).

Practice is free and all are welcome, newcomers are asked to arrive 15- 30 minutes before formal practice begins for a brief orientation.
results.name: Open Meadow Zen Group

results.description:
See our website at http://www.bio4climate.org

We get together to learn, discuss, understand--to spread hope for a livable climate in the decades to come by sharing knowledge of regenerative practices that work to sequester carbon and cool the local and global climate.  Our members are gardeners, growers, ecologists, climate activists, scientists, writers, researchers, innovators, local foodies, policy makers, educators, leaders, futurists, organizers, parents, Slow Money and Slow Food types, holistic thinkers, anyone curious about how biology shapes the earth.  Among other activities, we have a monthly potluck dinner and lively presentations and discussions, usually on Sunday evenings. Topics are varied, but all center around how ecological and regenerative resource management can reverse the effects of global warming;  by shifting our thinking to see the world in wholes we can collaborate and take action now--let's all be part of the worldwide mobilization of the biosphere to regenerate and restore damaged ecosystems and reverse global warming.
results.name: Biodiversity for a Livable Climate

Who we are:

Hola!

We are a group of Spanish speakers who like to get together to chat en español to practice our Spanish conversational skills and meet new people. 


What we do:

Meetup informally to practice our Spanish conversational skills over dinner or a margarita two nights a month at a local restaurant.


FAQ's:

Q: Do I have to be able to speak Spanish to come to the meetup? 
A: Yes, but you don't have to speak it well. We welcome all levels. It is a Spanish ONLY group, however, so if you don't know any Spanish at all you might feel a bit awkward. 

Q: What is the typical level in Spanish of the people who attend the meetups?
A: Some members who come to our meetups are native speakers or very advanced speakers. The other half are lower advanced to lower intermediate levels. 

Q: What time do people arrive and leave?
A: Most of our Meetups meet around 6PM for dinner and drinks and stay about two hours.

results.description:
This group is for people who like to go deep. 

 You know who you are. Wading in shallow pools might be fun for a while when your ankles are sweaty, but you've always preferred doing cannon balls from the cliffs -- if not in real-life, then metaphorically at least. 

 Chit-chat and small talk is all good and fine, but you find it ultimately boring and a waste of time to talk ad infinitum about the weather. And traffic.

 In this group we go deep, baby, deep...and quickly too. 

Sounds interesting but a little scary, doesn't it? That's because it is interesting and scary. To go with a group of strangers and sign up to do some mysterious list of activities that require honesty and presence and willingness to experiment.... well, that's just not everyone's cup of tea.  

But if you are somewhat brave and you tend to go towards new experiences instead of away from them, then this might just be up your alley.

The work/play/interaction will involve all of your faculties - physical, mental, emotional, imagination, sense of humor, etc. Body-mind-spirit the whole shebang.

This is *not* in any way like speed-dating. This is about joining in social experiments that challenge the self and create authentic Connection with others. 

It's for adults but you must bring your inner kid.  Similarly your wise-self will be asked to show up too. If you have trouble trying out and embracing new things then this is most definitely *not* the group for you.

RSVP'ing does not guarantee your spot in an event. After you read the meet-up and check your calendar and decide that you definitely want to attend, you may answer the questions that I ask.  The secret password is "Copacetic." In turn, I look at how people answered the questions and based on that, I put together an awesome group of people guaranteed to resonate with one another.
results.name: Going Deep, Baby!

results.description:
Would you like more “warm” referrals for your business/practice?

The MetroWest Health & Wellness Professionals Networking Group is a group of health and wellness professionals who meet for monthly business development programming, educational seminars, networking opportunities (in-person and online), a cross-referral network, and more. 

Members must: 1) be a credentialed, Massachusetts licensed health and wellness practitioner, 2) have a minimum of 5 years working experience, and 3) practicing or working in one of these MetroWest towns (Ashland, Bellingham, Framingham, Franklin, Holliston, Hopedale, Hopkinton, Hudson, Marlborough, Medway, Milford, Millis, Natick, Northborough, Sherborn, Southborough, Sudbury, Wayland, Westborough). 

Members include acupuncturists, bodyworkers, chiropractors, culinarians, dietitians, massage therapists, medical doctors, personal trainers, physical therapists, psychologists/psychiatrists, and yoga/pilates/fitness instructors. 

We will have regular meet-ups in local places. If you are willing to host a meet-up at your office or know a good location for a small group gathering, please let us know.

Goals of this group are: 1. Build your connections: "It's who you know, not what you know."; 2. Establish your reputation and raise your profile in the MetroWest business community; 3. Give and get business referrals; 4. Introduce you to collaboration and partnership opportunities in and outside of your particular field; 5. Learn / share something new: knowledge, skills, strategies, possibilities; 6. Surround yourself with and be energized by intelligent, positive, successful people; 7. Have fun; 8. Make friends; 9. Help others, 10. Be more successful 

Join this group and become your best!!

Add to the conversation on the #MetroWestWell hash tag.

Come and join other fellow crafters who love making cards without overspending on all the crafting supplies! And most importantly, make some new friends along the way.


You do not need to have your own supplies to join this group. All required tools are supplied at each workshops.   The cards will also be pre-designed, so you don't even have to worry about coming up with a concept.  All you have to do is assemble the card using glue, rubber stamping, punches, embellishments, etc.  Step-by-step instructions provided.

The workshops will be held around the Lowell/Dracut area.  However, if you are willing to open your house up to host a workshop, then it can be held anywhere.  Get a group of your friends together and you can have your very own private workshop.  If you decide to host the workshop at your place, I will still provide all the materials needed and bring them with me, so you do not need to worry about a thing.  All you need to do is provide tables and chairs.  This is a great activity for "Girls Night In". If you are interested, please email me for more information.

Array of workshops are offered to meet different needs/schedule.  The object of these workshops is to have some fun, leave all your troubles behind, and do something that YOU like to do!

If you have not yet taken a MindfulBoston program, please do not join this group.  Do join the public meetup that we offer for new folks at http://www.meetup.com/MindfulBoston/   

This Operators meetup is a closed group.  In general, members of this group started out by taking the MBSR intensive program with Gena Bean.   If you took MBSR with another teacher, you are still welcome to join us.  Yet Gena will probably contact you ahead of time to ask about your teaching history. 

MindfulBoston.com is a practice studio for meditation.  We are a growing community.  We are volunteer-driven.  We have a grass-roots vibe. 

The public meetup for new folks is http://www.meetup.com/MindfulBoston/   Please join that group first.  Once you have established yourself as a person who knows what the MindfulBoston studio is about, you could then join this Operators group. 

This is a meetup specifically for established members of the MindfulBoston community who are interested in giving their time to help our community grow and develop.  As "operators," members might give information in the way a telephone operator does.  Yet the definition of "operator" could include someday teaching meditation themselves, and or organizing our studio events. 

Thanks for your interest!

More info about what we offer is at http://MindfulBoston.com/

results.description:
This group is accessible via mobile browsers as well as the "Meetup" app for IOS & Android. However, due to the images/video content within each event we recommend viewing this group via laptop/desktop or 'desktop mode' on your mobile device browser when possible.

Join ME if you love to escape into, or discuss, the fantastic world of "Movies"!

The Movie Enthusiasts (of Southern New England) is a new movie based social group for movie enthusiasts to, primarily, arrange get-togethers for movie viewings at local theaters. We also provide an environment for sharing thoughts on various aspects of past, present and future movie releases.

Our group is open to everyone -- singles/couples, married or otherwise -- including those with children*.

Although we often attend PG-13 & R rated movies for more mature audiences we do attend many movies rated up to PG for those with kids or who are just a kid at heart.

*For everyone's enjoyment we only a few simple things, regarding children. Please review our guidelines regarding attending with and/or bringing children.  -- Available here

We've also created basic "Etiquette Guidelines" that we ask each member to review so we may all have a great experience together! -- Available here

Our events are typically in the Southern New England area. The most common locations are Randolph, Braintree, Dedham & Foxboro. We do plan to attend approximately 20 events in Kingston during 'Summer 2014' and occasionally travel to Attleboro, Mendon and more.

Location details are posted for each event. For a general feel as to where we frequently visit check out our theater location map.

This group is for everyone - teens, singles, couples - married or otherwise with or without children. However, please note that we ARE NOT a dating group. We are simply a group of movie enthusiasts who gather to enjoy movies together.

Friendships are expected to result -- but if your just looking to "hook-up" there are plenty of dating groups so please move on.

NOTE: BEFORE JOINING PLEASE BE SURE YOU HAVE A CLEAR PERSONAL PHOTO IN YOUR PROFILE. FAILURE TO DO SO WILL RESULT IN DELAYED/DECLINED ACCEPTANCE
results.name: Movie Enthusiasts of Southern New England

results.description:
Tired of not having anyone to go out and have fun with? Are you having the problem of going to meetups and never truly making any friends? New to town and need someone to hang out with? Single and looking to have a great time and possibly find someone to date? If any of this applies to you then you should join this meetup! This groups mission is to create a well connected group of friends and singles who will take their experiences beyond the meetup and make some everlasting friendships and relationships in the process. Meeting great friends and potential mates is hard, let this group be your stepping stone. Also, look forward to having fun as we discover new bars and restaurants, watch great shows, see new movies, go bowling, play some pool, and do any other fun thing that comes to mind! Looking forward to meeting everyone, hope you're ready for an adventure!


Most Meetups will be scheduled a week in advance, so don't think that since you don't see any upcoming meetups scheduled that one isn't in the process of being posted! Feel free to post any suggestions and even if 1 person RSVP's to a meetup, if I'm hosting the event I will still show up. :)

A Course In Miracles study and sharing group

results.description: Join us as we gather to deepen in understanding the teachings of A Course, and apply that understanding to our lives and our journeys. Beginning as well as experienced Course students are welcome. Together we will support one another as we gain insight into this powerful book. Bring your copy of the book, if you have one.

results.description:
Mobile Tea is a community-driven event focused on passions for mobile development, good music, and networking. The main technologies we discuss are: iOS, mobile web, Android, wearables, WebRTC, virtualization, etc.
Every event is a party where people share, discuss, and connect in a friendly environment of tech lovers.  We strongly believe that technology, music, and programming are an indelible combination that should not be diluted by marketing propaganda.
If you have a suggestion or you want to sponsor or speak at one of our events, feel free to contact us - anytime!

When a sponsor is involved in meetings, we will never use your time as a marketing tactic.

results.description: This is a group to support those learning Scots-Gaelic Language. We focus on conversational Gaelic rather than grammar at this time. People of all levels are welcome. We will have refreshments and share our experiences of moving towards fluency. We will follow the events in Scotland as it moves towards the vote for independence in September, 2014 and try to arrange a trip together to meet up with other Gaelic groups in Scotland working with the Gaelic Language initiatives there.

results.description:
This group was created for Boston’s urban communities with the purpose of educating its people about all things “money“. The group will get together on a monthly basis to discuss various topics surrounding personal finance. The goal is to improve the financial literacy of our communities. We believe good money management not only creates financial security, but it also builds a sense of financial freedom from everyday money constraints.

Meeting topics will include:
- Building, repairing & maintaining your credit
- Financing vs. Leasing – car buying basics
- Teaching your children about money
- Planning and saving for retirement
- The importance of owning a home
- Planning for the future, building wealth & entrepreneurship basics 
- Landing a good job, resumes & your online image


Questions/comments, please contact Denisha at Denisha@mandrellco.com. We look forward to helping you achieve financial success and impact your community.
results.name: Urban Money Matters

Sometimes it can be hard to find people to travel with, so this is an opportunity to get away and see the world with like-minded individuals. You can also invite friends, family, significant others to join on these trips as well. All ages are welcome!

results.description:
Welcome to the Mansfield Foxboro Area Social Group! We are a social and networking group for people in Foxboro, Mansfield, and the surrounding area.(North Attleboro, Easton, Norton, Wrentham, East Bridgewater, Plainville, Raynham, Taunton, Franklin, Norfolk, Sharon, Walpole, etc.) Don't worry- all are welcome, so if your town is not listed and you would like to join us, please do so.

Many of us work closeby, but a larger number of us commute to Providence, Boston, and elsewhere, creating contacts and a social circle further from our homes. Others work in this area and live elsewhere.The Mansfield Foxboro Area Social Group is for those looking to make friends in the area- whatever your interests, and whether on a professional level or to do fun things together and make new friends on a personal level.

I would love to hear from you when you join the group with your suggestions so we can work together to build a group that offers something for all of our members- whether meeting new friends, wine tasting, hiking, hearing live music together, attending sporting events, networking on a business level, etc.

Since we began in April 2014 we have had many fun events and many of our members organize events, keeping this a very active group.

Our event organizers work hard planning fun events for our members, but we need your co-operation to make our events successful. Please RSVP responsibly and attend if you sign up. We oftentimes make reservations in advance based on number of RSVPs. 'No Shows' hurt the reputation of the group and create frustration for your organizer, so please keep this in mind. This group will have a 3 No Shows And You're Out Policy, so if you sign up, please show up.

Welcome to The Mansfield Foxboro Area Social Group! We look forward to meeting you at an event soon.
results.name: Mansfield Foxboro Area Social Group

results.description: Meet people in Cambridge, create events and have fun.
results.name: Cambridge Social Group

results.description: If you're interested in the next generation of computing -- the cognitive era where technology that interacts in human manner and learns over time -- this meetup is for you. Whether you are passionate about the transformation it can create for client experiences, are starting to learn, or are knee deep in machine learning/AI/deep QA already this Meetup will provides a venue for visionaries, entrepreneurs, and technologists to learn and share about the cognitive computing wave.
results.name: IBM Watson Cognitive Tech Meetup (Boston, MA)

results.description:
A meetup focused on issues concerning the operation, development, and scaling of large, high-traffic WordPress websites. Topics tend to be technical, but not exclusively—all are welcome, including folks from the editorial and business side.

Why is membership restricted?

WordPress is hugely popular, and the needs of many Boston-area WordPress users are already well-served by the excellent Boston WordPress Meetup Group.

We're evaluating member requests on a case-by-case basis to make sure it's a good fit for everyone, and that we stay focused to our discussions about running enterprise / high-traffic / high-volume WordPress websites.

Where else can I find this meetup?

You can find the Big WP Meetup in Boston, London, San Francisco, Seattle, Toronto, and ﻿New York﻿. Use the hashtag #bigwp on Twitter!
results.name: Big WP Meetup Boston

results.description: Reiki For the People Boston Area MeetUp provides a comfortable and professional setting for those new to Reiki as well as for long-time Reiki practitioners. Newcomers may be interested in participating in the monthly low-cost Reiki Clinic or in receiving a private Reiki session. For those with some knowledge of Reiki, perhaps enrolling in a Reiki Training course feels right to you. If you are already a Reiki practitioner, then monthly Reiki Shares, Continuing Education Workshops, Mentoring sessions, and volunteering at the monthly Reiki Clinic might be just what you are seeking. Either way, I am committed to providing opportunities for you to explore the gentle transformative practice of Reiki in ways that feel right to you.
results.name: Reiki For the People Boston Area - Clinic, Shares, Trainings

results.description:
Once upon a time, there was a group called the "Fab Femmes" for the girly LGBTQ women of Boston, but it sadly disappeared in early 2013. This group was created in an effort to revive the group! If you're a femme, love women, and live in or around the Boston area, this group is for you. Feel free to join us for a drink, hobby, or outdoor adventure. And, if you would like to suggest an activity,  we welcome suggestions :) 

Please note the following before submitting a request: 

*Although we welcome all femme LGBTQ women, we do ask, for the safety of the group, that you provide a clear photo authenticating yourself - one that clearly shows your face, instead of body parts, cartoons, inanimate objects, landscapes, etc. If your photo does not meet these guidelines, your request may not be approved. 

*This group is about creating and maintaining friendships between femme/feminine women (lesbian and/or bi-sexual) in the community. There aren't many of us, so this is one way to connect with the other femmes of Boston.
results.name: The Wicked Awesome Femmes of Boston

results.description: We are a group of book lovers who like to get together and have insightful discussions. We are also a social group and enjoy meeting new people. Some recent examples include: Me Before You by Joyo Moyes, Orange Is the New Black by Piper Kerman, Life After Life by Kate Atkinson, Firefly Lane by Kristin Hannah, and The Cairo Affair by Olen Steinhauer.

The group is started with the vision of creating supportive community and enabling startup folks to learn, network and accelerate their careers. Join us to move Boston's startup ecosystem forward!
results.name: Boston Startup Career Network

results.description: Want to learn future of technology in Education Industry and learn how you could help? Cengage Learning would like to invite you on Monday, April 28th from 6:00pm - 8:30pm at 10 Channel Center, 3rd Floor South Boston. (10 Channel Center is on A Street in South Boston, 500 feet to the right of Barlow's Restaurant), to share how Education Industry is transforming in this age of data & analytics. Cengage will share the vision of the future of technology in the Education industry, product & technology roadmap over the next several years and corporate culture & environment. This event will be a fast-track ride into the world of education as seen by Cengage. Come and join the discussion. The following agenda is planned for the evening: 6:00pm - 6:30pm: Registration & Conversation 6:30pm - 6:50pm: George Moore, Chief Technology Officer - Mr. Moore will be providing his perspective on the trends in the Education Industry and how technology will play a significant role in defining and shaping the future of how students learning activities will be changing and how learning institutions will adapt over time 6:50pm - 7:10pm: Doug Mealing, Chief Architect - Mr. Mealing will be describing the current technology landscape at Cengage Learning and the challenges it faces and the direction of its enterprise architecture and frameworks 7:10pm - 7:30pm: Ryan Martin, Principal Architect/Designer - Mr. Martin will portray what it's like to be a technologist in Cengage's environment and the culture of the organization 7:30pm - 8:30pm: Q&A Open Discussion Please RSVP, and looking forward to seeing you all at the event.
results.name: Future of Technology in Education at Cengage Learning

results.description: Springer invites you to an evening of professional brainstorming and networking with your peers from the Boston/Cambridge Tech community. Startup and Established Tech Companies will discuss how Big Ideas take flight! We welcome private and industrial tech researchers and entrepreneurs; this event program is not tailored for an Academic audience. Space is limited so be sure to RSVP before April 25! Guest speakers will examine areas of innovation from three perspectives: Information Expertise, Research & Development, and Entrepreneurship. Speakers will spotlight the ways in which information resources and networking accelerate innovation. Breakout sessions with your peers will follow; we invite all attendees to join these lively discussions! Cocktails and hors d'oeuvres will be served throughout the evening, as part of your FREE registration. As a Thank You for attending, Springer staff will be available throughout the event to set you up with Free Trial Access to either Springer for R&D or SpringerMaterials in order to sharpen your company’s competitive edge! We welcome you to share this invite with your friends and colleagues in R&D, Information Technology Management, Product Development, Engineering, and New Technologies. RSVP to attend: https://www.regonline.com/springerbigideas Learn more about Springer by visiting http://rd.springer.com.

results.description:
This group is for an assortment of day time gatherings. Please feel free to send in your ideas for hikes, walks, bike rides, canoeing, kayaking, picnics, swims, beach days, bowling. Whatever you are into, we can do it. Just let me know. 


When joining this meetup, you agree to our Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and her heirs, and all members and participants of this Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. All meetup activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.


Just a few basics:

You must include a photo which  shows your face. This is for safety reasons. 

Please only RSVP in the positive. There's no need to say you're not going. This just clutters up my mailbox.

Please be sure to let the organizer/leader know if you change your mind. Life happens, we understand that, but no one likes being stood up. 


Anyone who accumulates 3 "no shows" will be removed from our meetup at the discretion of the organizer. 

Aim to arrive a bit early. Groups will wait no longer than 15 mins for latecomers at the discretion of your organizer. 


Dues are $6/year and you have a 180 day grace period during which you can check us out. In addition, this is a sister meetup to Nashua Adventurers. Dues for one count towards the other. 


Looking forward to meeting you!
results.name: MID DAY - MID WEEK ADVENTURES
