results.description:
This group is for those who want to expand their personal universe in ways that are beyond words, through the art and science of energy mastery! Discover ways to access your sources of ecstatic energy, and share it in a conscious way in your intimate relationships and your everyday life. Energy mastery allows us to heal our wounds and to create an ecstatic life of limitless possibilities.

Have you ever wanted to be able to find a place where you can journey back home into your body?  To discover powerful tools and practices that will make you magnetic and irresistible to the opposite sex, bringing love and ecstasy into your life?

It is our birthright to be fully embodied and present to feel our body and our senses in each moment. This opens the door to true intimacy and authentic connection with ourselves, our lovers and those close to us. It changes the way we experience the daily challenges of relationships and living in the world.

In this experiential meetup you will explore interactions of masculine and feminine energy fields. Guided by Yuliya Cohen, a world-renowned healer, teacher and energy coach, you will learn to see and feel energy fields and become aware of the dynamics of energy flow. You will take home skills for consciously working with energies to enhance the energetic exchange between you and your partner. As you draw upon specific universal principles rooted in ancient wisdom and modern science, you will finally be able to heal your wounds and leave what does not work behind.
results.name: Exploring Energy, Ecstasy and Intimacy

results.description:
Scenic Kayaking . . .

as in kayaking the scenic rivers, lakes and coastal routes of Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Maine . . .

This new kayak group is for fun, active people, ages thirty-five and older, interested in meeting people with similar interests to kayak with.   Our  paddle events  range from advanced beginner, Intermediate to Advanced, with paddle distances averaging about  8 miles (at an average paddle speed of 2-3 miles per hour). 

To Join: we require that you  provide your real name, a face photo (so we will recognize you at the meetup events) and, show(unhide) your meet up interests and groups (click on “unhide your interests and groups from others” in your Profiles section). 

Per club policy, no pets allowed, and no guests please. Have your guest join the meet-up group (and be approved ) so that they can agree to the liability release and attend an event.

Where we paddle: The meetup locations will primarily be within a two hour driving range (North/South/East/West) from the vicinity of the Boston area.

Kayak Gear: We recommend you bring your own kayak and related gear, as most of our paddle events do not have kayak rentals on site). You can also rent a Kayak for the day (from EMS or Charles River Canoe and Kayak). Wearing a PFD on all kayak events is required. No sit-on-top  or inflatable kayaks allowed.

Our plan is to schedule a kayak meet-up every week (weather permitting) during the kayak season, and in the summer months to include some extra kayak events on Fridays as well. Kayak season is from May to October.

 Meet-up costs: We do not charge member fees, nor do we have  sponsors (yet) who help pay the organizer’s meetup’s annual fee (which runs about $189 a year). However, if members would like to help contribute towards the cost of the organizers annual fee to meetup.com, we will cheerfully accept voluntary donations (cash or credit card).

As a way of saying Thank You to those members who donate $10 or more  for the kayak season, we are offering the following perks: If an event is full, whoever’s first on the wait list who has made a seasonal donation of $10 or more, gets moved up to the RSVP list. With a maximum of 2 donors per event getting to move ahead. (Applicable up to 48 hours before the event date). This perk is valid for each and every event throughout the season (Kayak season runs from May to October).   Scenic Kayaker fundraiser events; donors event fee is waived 

Donations are nonrefundable, and will remain with the group and only be used to fund annual organizer’s meetup.com fees or used for the groups safety gear. For transparency, we will post the donors' list in the groups Meetup page, under More section, subheading files, its called Scenic kayakers donation list.

We are also open to any kayak meetup ideas that you might be interested in. We look forward to having fun and meeting you all!

Please read the "Message Board" for other important information regarding the Scenic Kayakers,  and The  groups policy,  Important Safety Information, and other useful information (which is listed in the   "More" section under "Files"). 

Come explore the many scenic lakes, rivers and coastal areas of Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and Maine!

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING  and JOINING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  The organizers and event hosts in this group are not trained leaders or instructors. The organizers only set the time and place. Each person participating in any group event is responsible for their own safety. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol during any Scenic Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.
results.name: Scenic Kayaking Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in playing with paper - scrapbooking, card making, rubber stamping!

I have been an avid paper crafter for too many years to count!  I started with scrapbooking and then explored the world of ATC's (artist trading cards), altered items, and mixed media, always dabbling with stamping as well.   Scrapbooking took up 90% of my paper crafting time, and I got much joy from making pages to document and preserve my family's memories.  (My kids would say I was "obsessed" with scrapbooking!)

A few years back, I began going to Stampin' Up! workshops with a friend of mine who was a Stampin' Up! demonstrator.  I QUICKLY fell in love with their products!  I soon found myself making more cards than scrapbooking (Oh no!  How could that be??!!)  I decided to take the plunge and become a demonstrator myself.  While I still faithfully go to a monthly scrapbooking crop where I devote my whole day to only scrapbooking,  I find that most of my in-home craft time is spent making cards and learning new stamping techniques.   I offer workshops twice a month in my home and love to share new products, techniques and tips with other. 

Please check out my blog:  www.stampwithanna.blogspot.com for more projects and tutorials!

I hope you can join me for one of our "meetups"!
results.name: Waltham Area Stampers and Scrapbookers

results.description:
The National Black MBA Association - Boston Chapter is a Professional Business Organization looking to connect with the Diverse professionals living and working in the Boston Metropolitan area. We are looking to meet and connect with Seasoned Professionals (MBA's or Non-MBA's), Graduate Students, Undergrad Students, Community Leaders and Policy Influencers.

Our mantra: "Proactive Leadership: A Full Circle of Support" includes everyone in every field and every level professionally. We are an organization who strives to match our members with exceptional resources, strategically prepared programming, professional development, scholarship opportunities and career planning.

Who should join us? YOU SHOULD!
results.name: National Black MBA Association, Boston Chapter

results.description: Looking for a small group of aspiring or experienced writers for honest editorial critique of each other's work.  I was hoping we could meet once a week and give each other our thoughts on a few pages of active manuscripts that we are trying to perfect for publication.  People interested in fiction or non-fiction, personal essay or short story, would be welcome.  People of the same general age group, 40s, would be best.
results.name: Newton Writer's Group

results.description:
This group is for anyone interested in exploring the effect of laughter on the human mind and body through community and the ritual of play. Our meetups will be in the form of Laughter Yoga and Meditation sessions followed by brief discussions about laughter and play in our lives.  Laughter Yoga and Meditation involves simple movements, breathing, and obviously laughter, and is open to all ages.  Comfortable clothing is a plus but Laughter Yoga and Meditation isn't your usually yoga class so no special attire, mats, or props required although you'd be quite surprised on how much a workout continuous laughter can be.  No previous experience in yoga, meditation, or having a sense of humor necessary.  Please let me know if you have any questions.

Kevin and I started this group because we like to play and laugh, and laughter yoga was one of the best ways we have found to fulfill that basic need. There are many proven physical and psychological health benefits to the practice, which have been backed by peer-reviewed studies, but speaking to people about laughter yoga what comes up often is that people feel they’re not having enough fun in their life. We would like to address that. 

Which brings up the question: What is laughter yoga? Despite the name, there are 
no physical poses. What it takes from yoga is the attitude of practice – the idea isn’t 
to be the best at doing the exercises, but simply to start where you are and begin 
to develop, over time, an innate and core aspect of your humanity. While yoga 
concentrates mainly on the body, this practice focuses primarily on the capacity for 
laughter and playfulness. 

Laughter is by its nature contagious, so while it may begin like "fake" laughter, it 
often turns into real authentic laughter.  Playful exercises are generally the types of games you would play with a young child.

Time Magazine, The Huffington Post, and The New Yorker (subscription needed for 
full article) have all written about laughter yoga. Though he has no affiliation with 
laughter yoga, Dr. Stuart Brown gave an interesting TED talk on the importance 
of play to the human brain. In addition, there is a plethora of information on 
laughteryoga.org.   Or check out a local article here about one of our leaders Jason, http://huntnewsnu.com/2011/02/laughter-meditation-a-trend-in-relaxation/

This group will be led by two experienced leaders – Deborah Bennett who is a 
certified Laughter Yoga instructor and currently teaches it to veterans, and Jason 
Jedrusiak, a certified yoga instructor who leads a weekly laughter groups at Northeastern University and throughout Boston.
results.name: Boston Laughter Yoga and Meditation

The availability of our Parent Support Group has been around for quite some time. This is our debut on Meetup.com to try to reach and help even more families. All parents attending the group, therefore, will not be visible as RSVPs. We are a support group for parents who are overwhelmed or puzzled by their child's mental health, behavioral health, or emotional health challenges. Parents often join or group because they are feeling overwhelmed and isolated - like they are the only family dealing with such challenges. Parents find great comfort in our confidential small group discussions. The group is FREE and we offer free bottled water and snacks. The group meets at Wayside Youth & Family Support Network on 118 Central Street in Waltham, MA. Our atmosphere is welcoming, comfortable, and very relaxed.

results.description:
In this group we will get together to explore the benefits of essential oils and aromatherapy - both the physical and emotional benefits. We will learn from each other and share what knowledge we have of essential oils and aromatherapy. We'll have oils to sample, and put together topics at each meeting to focus on.

Ready to kick Summer 2015 off with like minded oil enthusiasts??  I absolutely love essential oils and learning about their many many uses.  I would like to make this meetup a regular weekly occurrence and will take your input as to days and times as I have some flexibility. We will go over the basics of oils and really just open up the discussion to whatever types of questions come up. Have an ailment or know somebody with an ailment that you would like to help?  Chances are there is an oil that will help!  If you have experience with oils, myself and the group would love to hear your input.  

This will be a no pressure environment with the ultimate goal being educating ourselves with the numerous benefits available through essential oils.  I have used them for aromatherapy, massage, treating illnesses such as colds/flu, treating abrasions/cuts/skin irritations, weight loss, household cleaning, etc.

As I mentioned my schedule is flexible and can accommodate morning, afternoon and evening meetups. For now we will begin with a weekday evening meetup and go from there.

Really looking forward to meeting new oil enthusiasts or those looking to explore natural living.  I highly doubt you will be disappointed.

We are a group of women who want to better honor our own histories, stories and emotions as well as support ourselves and one another in creating new ways of seeing, being and communing with others. Writing from prompts, we will share our grief and sorrows, as well as our joys, excitement and passions. We aren't asking for advice or a quick fix, but we are eager to be honest and create deep connection with others who aspire to stay present, share, and mindfully celebrate our vulnerabilities in ourselves, each other and the wider world.

We are a gathering place for like-minded spiritualists who want to have fun, connect, raise their vibes, and develop meaningful friendships. Our belief is that spirituality is not only about meditating or communing with the Divine, it is about so much more, including having fun, loving life, being love, loving ourselves, appreciating our humanity, and living a balanced and fulfilling life. 

In this group, we may come together for tea/coffee chats, a particular outing or any fun and aligned event. 

Our group is inclusive of all people, from all backgrounds and lifestyles, with no judgments; only love, support and appreciation for each other, ourselves, and the journeys we are on.

The mission of Mother Brook Arts & Community Center (MBACC) is to build community through the arts. results.description:
Welcome to The Boston Drupal Entrepreneurs Meetup Group! 

This is a meetup for everybody interested in learning, teaching and sharing all things Drupal, but in a context that strongly fosters innovation and entrepreneurship. 

Our goals are as follows, 

1. Gather and unite existing Drupal users in the Boston Metropolitan Area that are also interested in creating or help creating new web businesses of all sorts. 

2. Promote the use of Drupal (and other empowering open-source software) among everybody, particularly aspiring and existing entrepreneurs of all ages. 

3. Aggressively promote the participation of women in both, web design and programming, and entrepreneurship. 

4. Galvanize the synergistic possibilities that will emerge from bringing together people interested in web/mobile design and development, and entrepreneurship. 

We will have primarily two kinds of meetings: 

a. Monthly social and networking gatherings that bring together Drupalers and Entrepreneurs of all skill levels. 

b. Teaching Sessions related to specific topics, such as Drupal Basics, Drupal Commerce, Drupal for non-profits, Theming, Modules, Content Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, etc. 

Our first meetup will take place on Tuesday, June 17th, starting at 06:30 PM. Please join and RSVP now, if interested. All (or most) meetings will be held at the Cambridge Innovation Center (CIC) at One Broadway in Kendall Square (one block from the MIT/Kendall Red-Line T Stop.) 

Meetings will be limited to 25 people -at least for the time being.

There won’t be any fees, and refreshments will be provided. 

This Meetup Group is sponsored by:

About Drupal: Drupal is a free and open-source web publishing software framework, of the type that is called a CMS, a Content Management System. (Joomla and WordPress are also CMSs.) Drupal is used to create and manage all kinds of web content. Though Drupal is very powerful as a framework to build websites of all kinds, it is nevertheless remarkably user-friendly. Drupal empowers people from all walks of life, with little previous web design or development skills to relatively easily create dynamic websites with all sorts of bells and whistles. Of course easier doesn’t mean effortless! A growing number of educational, Fortune 500, governments, and nonprofits already use it or are now migrating to Drupal. Places like the MIT Media Lab, The White House, The United Nations, Amnesty International, Best Buy, Zappos, FedEx, and The Economist use Drupal. 

About Best Bilingual Solutions, Inc. : Best Bilingual is a startup publishing house based in Cambridge, Massachusetts that publishes printed, digital and audio books in all the major and many of the minor languages of the world. The company has so far published four titles in up to eight different languages, including English, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Russian, Portuguese, Arabic, and French, with many more titles and languages to come in the near future, in printed, audio, and eBook formats. Best Bilingual also want to empower the women and men of the world that have something important or interesting to share with the rest of humanity through the written word, by publishing aspiring authors in their native language and in any other desired language. 

(http://www.BestBilingual.com - presently revamping the website-migrating it to Drupal! )
results.name: The Boston Drupal Entrepreneurs Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to Boston Sci-Tech and the Future of Humanity Meetup Group! 

This is a meetup for everybody interested in learning, teaching and sharing all manner of things related to Science, Technology, and the Future of Humanity.

We won't just meet up; we'll party! We'll enjoy the pleasures of the senses and of the mind for as long as we remain full biological entities, indulging in the nectar and ambrosia inherited from our ancestors, burning them in an atmosphere of human warmth and kindness, all while celebrating the promises and preempting the dangers of our sci-tech civilization.
By the nectar and ambrosia of the world we naturally mean-and hopefully you'll agree, wine, chocolate, bread, and cheese, as refreshments will be provided.

Kind Planetary Companions of all species, orientations and persuasions are welcome! -even humans, though with caution.

Our goals are as follows:

1. Gather and unite people of all ages in the Boston Metropolitan Area that are interested in Science and Technology, in the context of our future -that means, the future of humanity, along with the future of all the other life forms that share the planet with us. (or better said, that we share the planet with.)

2. Educate ourselves and expand our horizons on many related topics through lectures and conversations given and moderated by scientists, technologists, philosophers, ethicists, artists, and others; i.e., the technorati and the literati.

3. Promote the inclusion and participation of women in all of our activities (as 50% of us are usually so glaringly underrepresented in these discussions!). 

4. Galvanize the synergistic possibilities that will naturally emerge from bringing together people interested in Sci-Tech and the Future so that we can take meaningful and effective action, whether it's in activism, research, learning, or entrepreneurship.

Note: We don't have to be called Singularitarians. We may keep it, but  in the meantime please don't be turn off by our temporary name.

We will have primarily three kinds of meetings: 

a. Social and networking gatherings  to just mingle and be merry while learning and discussing Sci-Tech & Future in an informal way. 

b. Lectures followed by Q&A on specific topics; e.g., the latest on Brain Research, General Artificial Intelligence, GNR-Genetics, Nanotechnology & Robotics, Disruptive Technologies, Technological Evolution and the Singularity, Space Exploration, Fundamental Cosmological Questions, Existential Risks to Humanity in the 21st Century, etc.

c. A nice combination of a and b, above.

Please join and RSVP now, if interested. All (or most) meetings will be held at the Cambridge Innovation Center (CIC) at One Broadway in Kendall Square (one block from the MIT/Kendall Red-Line T Stop.) 

Meetings will be limited to 25 people -at least for the time being.

There won’t be any fees, and refreshments will be provided.
results.name: Boston Sci-Tech and the Future of Humanity Meetup Group

results.description:
Please visit the beautiful urban oasis that is Goldfish Pond park in Lynn, Massachusetts. We maintain the area's largest all-volunteer garden with over 3,000 flowering plants, floating fountains and lots of community spirit. Join us for our 35th annual Planting Day on Sat, May 23rd! It's an amazing day. Experience what I call, "the paradox of volunteering." Give a little of your time, get back more than you could have imagined!

We also work on the Saturday mornings leading up to Planting Day, and you are welcome to join us.

results.description: This is a group for parents who are Japanese, Japanese-American or part Japanese, have a Japanese or Japanese-American spouse, or have no Japanese background but are interested in raising your children to become bilingual in Japanese and English, and to be familiar with Japanese culture. I am a Japanese woman married to an American man, and we have an incredibly cute 17-mon old baby boy. I started this group because I want my son to grow up bilingual, and to grow up in a community of Japanese speaking friends. We live in East Arlington, and initially this group will meet in the Arlington area but I intend on hosting events in the greater Boston area in the future. We'll be meeting at playgrounds, take walks on the Bike Path, hang out at beaches, take trips to the zoo, visit the science museum, etc. We'll be doing all the things we normally do as parents, but with a focus on speaking in Japanese, to our children and to each other. If you are interested in creating a community of parents committed to raising your child bilingual and familiar with Japanese culture, this is the group for you!

I also hold weekend retreats in the summer in the White Mountains combining yoga & hiking. My intention is to open up space in my regular classes for meetup peeps at a discounted rate to get more people on the water this summer! If this becomes more popular I would ultimately like to schedule and dedicate classes to meetup members only in the near future. More info at: www.sup-yo.com. SUP YO!

results.description:
Meet other citizens from the Boston-MetroWest area who are tired of feeling helpless in the face of climate change and who are ready to advocate for a solution supported by conservative and liberal economists alike: a national, revenue-neutral carbon tax.  Join us and learn why James Hansen recommends Citizens' Climate Lobby: "If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group.”

Citizens Climate Lobby is a five year old, fast-growing, nonprofit, nonpartisan, grassroots advocacy organization focused on national policies to address climate change. We train and support volunteers to reclaim their democracy and engage elected officials and the media to generate the political will for solutions that will stabilize the Earth’s climate.

Then come join us at our next Meetup! People of all skill levels are welcome!

Oh, what's up with our logo, you ask? Nothing.

results.description: This group is for folks in the Cambridge/Somerville area who are interested in playing poker for very low stakes (buy ins might range from $10-$30, and maybe occasionally a $50 game). We play mainly No-Limit Hold'em, but we will occasionally add some Pot-Limit Omaha and mixed games. We host a mix of cash games and tournaments, so if you're looking for a place to learn the game in a low pressure environment, this is a good place to start. That said, this group welcomes players of all ability levels, and we do take our game seriously, despite the stakes, so come ready to play! The host will provide cards, chips, and the table. Bring your own beverages and snacks, and if you like, some to share!

results.description:
Regular public meetups are held to play competitive contract bridge, usually in some coffee house.  We play party style, using Chicago scoring, with no duplicate equipment in sight.   Players will table-talk to learn how to become better players, diagnose hands afterwards, and socialize between hands with like-minded friends

Good card players started holding similar meetups in 18th-century London and New York, but they referred to their game as Whist.  We know and love its more challenging modern equivalent, which our Bridge Parties make easy for you to play and enjoy often.

The social networking payoff remains unchanged  - we stimulate our minds, catch up on news and gossip, eat dinner near people we enjoy, get up off our couches, and have a barrel of fun.

Bridge Party meetups repeat regularly in MetroWest or North Shore venues, usually midweek evenings after work, starting near supper time.   We expect you  already know rules, tactics, all common "Standard American" bidding conventions; have good "card sense"; enjoy competition; win or lose gracefully.   

We do teach beginners, but only in meetups held solely for that purpose.  Write the organizer if interested. Ask about our next scheduled introduction to the basic play and tactics of Contract Bridge, offered via free, public mini-bridge meetups. 

We honor and hold dear the memory of Dan Corwin - visionary, friend, teacher, and founder of Baystate Bridge Parties.
results.name: Baystate Bridge Parties

topics.name: Music Teachers Talking about Teaching Music
Create music and have fun learning from everyone.

results.description:
This group is designed to bring music teachers and music students of all backgrounds and expertise together to network with one another. The goal is to put fellow teachers and students in direct contact with one another so that we can cultivate a strong community of educators, musicians, and entrepreneurs. "The whole is greater than the sum of its parts" - Aristotle

What you might use this group for:

As a teacher:
-Find potential teachers to teach at your studio (or to create a studio with!)
-Cultivate a network of teachers who specialize in various areas of music so that you can refer your students to these teachers should they want to expand their musical horizons (AKA - build partnerships!)
-Brainstorm with other teachers
-Learn how to improve or enhance your current teaching through workshops, guest speakers, and more!
-Figure out the latest and greatest "tricks of the trade" - expand your lens to find out what others are up to in the area
-Exercise your creativity and visions; discover focus and inspiration by surrounding yourself by like-minded individuals; set goals and find the support you need to achieve them.

As a student:
-Meet many teachers of all different backgrounds & specialties & take your pick!
-Find out more about various teaching methods and studios that exist in your area
-Meet other students looking to make music a part of their life -Get proper support and motivation to follow through with your musical dreams!

As the founder/director of a local music studio in the South End of Boston called Musicians' Playground I've realized the importance of having a strong network of both fellow educators and students alike. I find it to be a shame that we lack the opportunity to have regular, casual, mixers to accomplish the above. So, please join me once a month for what I hope will become a more frequent and much larger movement for real connections and progress to be made.
results.name: Boston Music Teacher & Student Mixers

results.description:
A place to share, listen or both, You don't have to suffer alone. Living with PTSD can be a daily battle. It's easy to wonder if recovery of any type is possible. results.description: Welcome to the Single Moms Under 40 group! Sometimes being a a single mom is just plain tough-there is no one to share the enchanting moments and tantrums with, no one to read a book to our child while we take a shower, no one to reassure us that we're doing just fine. I knew there had to be other women like me out there looking for connection and support and that's why I started this group. To create a space where we can find other single moms with young children who "get" us, share tips and parenting wisdom that will help us find rest, hope and encouragement, and hopefully find new friendships for ourselves and our children along the way. And above all simply have some fun! We can do a mix of girls nights, play dates and fun outings, open to any ideas you ladies have for the group! **By the way we won't be strict with the age cap at 40, my intention was to simply target women with younger children around the same age for play dates ease so feel free to join if you're over 40 too, you don't need to share your age ;)
results.name: Single Moms of Young Children

results.description:
Speaking and presentation learning and practice group for solo entrepreneurs interested in using speaking to get clients.

If you ever present to a live audience as a way to gain exposure and get clients for your business, or if you ever need to get up in front of a group of any size and talk about your business or share information, then this group is a great way to improve on your skills and gain practice.

We welcome members of any experience level. Our focus is on solo entrepreneurs, consultants, coaches, holistic health practitioners and other small business owners who know that speaking may be an opportunity to gain exposure, become known as an expert, and get many more clients. You may have found this group because you've done some speaking and are wondering how to grow your business more effectively through speaking, or you may be here because you are curious as to what may be involved in using speaking to get clients. Wherever you are in this process, we are here to help.

Our Vision:
The purpose of the Speak to Get Clients Speaking Circle is to provide a safe place to learn, experiment and practice while receiving education and feedback throughout the process. The focus of the group is on becoming more confident and comfortable whenever you are in front of a group as a way to grow your business.

Our Structure:
Speak to Get Clients Speaking Circle is run by Kim Reddington of Cereus Women as part of her ongoing effort to help more people learn they are capable of so much more than they think they are.

We are here to serve our members in a variety of different ways:

• Monthly Meetings - hear from other speaking experts on such topics as how to actually get clients from a speaking engagement, how to better present yourself, what to do, what not to do,how to improve your skills, how to get booked, where to speak.

• Monthly Practice Sessions - come and practice up to 10 minutes of any speech you are working on. The audience will provide you with feedback on your presentation skills, as well as the effectiveness of your content. Not sure you want to practice? Come and just observe and provide feedback to others until you are ready for more. This is a great way to practice your marketing message.

• Workshops and Trainings - periodically we will be holding more in-depth workshops and trainings on various topics around speaking. These workshops will be priced higher than monthly meetings due to the depth of learning.

• Two Levels of Membership - our Basic Level will always be free. Read about our membership levels below.

• Leadership Opportunities - volunteer positions to join our leadership team or to present on an appropriate topic related to your business. Leadership positions will allow you to receive more exposure for you and your business.


=================
Membership Options
=================
We have 2 levels of membership depending on your commitment level.

1. Basic Membership
 Basic Membership is free and open to anyone. Feel free to join, check out what we are doing, and attend any and all meetings. There will be a $20 charge for each Monthly Meeting and Monthly Practice Sessions for members at this level.

Price: FREE to join

2. Premium Membership
 Premium Membership is for the member who is interested in making a year-long commitment to their improvement as a speaker and as an entrepreneur who's gaining more exposure, becoming seen as an expert and attracting more clients. Members at the premium level may attend all Monthly Meeting and Monthly Practice Sessions FREE of charge. (RSVPs are still highly recommended.)

Premium members will receive a significant discount to any workshops and trainings provided to the group that is in addition to the Monthly Meetings and Monthly Practice Sessions. Prices and discounts will be clearly noted for each meetup.

Price: $99 / year (Your year starts on the day you pay.)
==================

We look forward to meeting you and watching your skills and confidence grow with learning and practice.
results.name: Speak to Get Clients Speaking Circle

results.description:
The objective of the Group is gathering and meeting new people through the organization of homemade food events (dinner, brunch, BBQ). 

Our events will feature homemade food sampling prepared by the members of our group (or friends of friends) and will based at members' place or common spaces (i.e. function rooms in residential buildings). 

The group is open to foodies and amateurs cooks with the goal of finding a good balance for each event, try amazing food, share stories of life, travel and have fun together: this will make everyone happy! 

The group believes that experiencing different cultures and traditions, meeting new friends, when sitting at the same table, sampling traditional, or ethnic home prepared food from another region, country, state, or local, it is an intimate and rich experience.

Our members support the initiative of CookRadar, "connecting people through homemade food", a new disrupting concept that applies the sharing economy principle to food prepared at home, and its vision go as far as imaging a World in which, each country you travel to, you can connect with local people and socialize at the same table sampling amazing food prepared according local traditions and recipes.

A social, free to join community, now has its dedicated online presence, in which members create events combining an ethnic or local home prepared food offering,  with a specific interest like i.e. a foreign language, passion for travelling, cooking, painting, yoga, music, sport, with the goal of bringing people together, promoting friendship, integration, knowledge.

Our concept promotes eat social, discover different cultures and have fun!

You keep attracting the same types of partners over and over again.You’ve tried everything,  read every book and taken every class available trying to fix yourself because you know there must be something wrong with you.

results.description:
Maptime is a monthly meetup where we work on maps, learn about geospatial data, and teach each other the latest cartographic tools. 

Maptime is, rather literally, time for mapmaking. Our mission is to open the doors of cartographic possibility to anyone interested by creating a time and space for collaborative learning, exploration, and map creation using mapping tools and technologies. 

This open learning environment for all levels and degrees of knowledge offers intentional support for the beginner. Maptime is simultaneously flexible and structured, creating space for workshops, ongoing projects with a shared goal, and independent/collaborative work time. 

Inspiration for Maptime comes from both hack nights and knitting circles. Both are models of spaces for people to create and learn together. Our goal is to provide this space with an open heart and without pretension. You can bring your own projects to work on, or just hang out and socialize or ask questions. Some people are experts, and some people are just getting started, but all of us are learning, so why not do it together? 

Maptime is hands-on, so don't forget to bring your laptop! All skill levels are welcome. Beginners are especially welcome! 

For more information about Maptime, visit maptime.io. Also, follow us on twitter at @MaptimeBoston.
results.name: Maptime Boston

results.description:
We are a group of women that know that have experience early childhood developmental complex trauma , specifically the effects of  an emotionally absent mother who was not there for us, whether she was a narcissist or an abuse survivor herself.  Growing up our needs went ignored or even deliberately denied. We had to grow up on our own, as they could and/or would not be there for us.  Thus, we missed out on a normal childhood and as adults we see effects of this in our lives. We wish to support each other in the healing process. Together, we can grieve, grow, here.

This group is for women who experienced trauma specifically from their mother, likely that the trauma came out later, as an adult in life.

This group is planned to be a closed group for women and preferentially for women where there will be no healing with their moms, and thus, are faced with having to deal with this on our own.  These affects are often severe, and for this group , there is "Nothing to heavy to share"....as the group is intended to embrace the grief and sorrow of this experience and support each other in healing.
results.name: Please Notice Me:  Early Childhood Trauma Support Group

This is the events site of the Boston Camera Club (BCC), the leading camera club in the Boston area, established in 1881. You can read more about the BCC here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boston_Camera_Club or visit the club's website at http://www.bostoncameraclub.org

This meetup is primarily for members of the BCC to schedule, organize, manage and participate in the club's field trips and other events. Interested people who would like to participate in the field trips can join the meetup by either paying a field-trip-only fee of $20 per year or by paying the full membership fee of $55 for one year full club membership (students: $20 - your meetup fee will cover this, couples: $75). If you want to join the club as a full member, please sign up using the club's full website above. Once you're on the member list, you will be marked "exempt" here.

BCC field trips are to gather in groups and explore intriguing, unusual, new and old places of interest, take photos and post some after the event on this site for sharing or constructive critique. Most events will be for all levels of experience and our members will be willing to assist and share their knowledge. If an event is targeted to a specific topic, we may point out the difficulty level and we will always suggest what equipment to bring.

Before you start browsing around, please take a look at the MORE-POLLS in the menu and let us know your preferences and then please review the DISCUSSIONS, also in the menu, for pointers on safety, attendance and membership rules.

We are looking forward to doing group shoots with you!

Jürgen, BCC field trip organizer

results.description:
New technologies that capture the physical world digitally and deliver digital information physically are revolutionizing the design, production, and management of physical stuff, from buildings to highways, from automobiles to video games, and from dental crowns to spinal implants. This is Reality Computing. 

Reality Computing technologies allow users to digitally capture the existing conditions of objects and locations (e.g. laser scanning, photogrammetry, depth cameras) as reality data, compute and analyze reality data in design software, and physically create new work from digital information either directly (e.g. 3D printing, digital fabrication) or visually (e.g. augmented reality).

This group is for anyone interested in innovative technology that is changing the future. Our Meetups feature demos from startups and established companies working on Reality Computing technologies, great networking opportunities, and a chance for brief shout-outs from attendees seeking help from the community.

Hope to see you around, and meanwhile if you want to know more check out http://realitycomputing.com.
results.name: Reality Computing Boston

results.description:
Rejuvenate with Zentangle! 

Zentangle is an easy to learn, mindful drawing of structured patterns that create beautiful images. 

It looks complicated, but anyone can do it "one stroke at a time." 

If you want to relax and have fun, this meetup is for you. 

If you already know how, come and share your knowledge or just tangle with us.  

CZTs (Certified Zentangle Teachers) are welcome too! 

Classes and Retreats are conducted by your organizer, Jacki Rose, CZT Certified Zentangle Teacher.

Most programs include the supplies or have the supplies available for purchase. You are also welcome to bring your own if you have them.

Typical supplies we use are: Sakura Black 01 Pen, Zentangle Pencil, Tortillion, Zentangle Tiles


Imortant info about your RSVP
When you RSVP that you are going to an event, we are so glad that you have committed to attend. Please note that if your plans change and are unable to attend, it is very imporant that you change your RSVP. There is a lot of set up and preparation involved with these programs according to the number of people who sign up.  Also, many of the classes are limited, so when you do not change your RSVP you are taking a spot that someone else could have had. Keeping your RSVP up to date is very much appreciated.

topics.name: Living Your Plan B as a childless woman

results.description:
THIS IS A CLOSED GROUP - NONE OF THE INFORMATION YOU WRITE ON OUR PAGES IS EITHER SEARCHABLE BY GOOGLE OR VISIBLE TO NON-GROUP MEMBERS. WE UNDERSTAND THAT BEING CHILDLESS CAN BE TOUGH TO BE OPEN ABOUT AND WE RESPECT AND PROTECT YOUR PRIVACY AS MUCH AS WE CAN.

This Meetup Group is for US-based childless-by-circumstance women. Those circumstances might include infertility, not meeting the right partner in time (or yet), your partner not wanting (more children) and so many other ways that we can end up not being mothers when that wasn't the plan!

One of the things about not having children when most of your peers do can be that your social circle dwindles or dries up completely. This can leave you feeling very left out of 'normal' life - which in turn can make dealing with the unexpected situation you find yourself in even tricker on some days! 

We have new meetups starting all the time, but currently we have the following regular monthly meetups. Please join us and suggest your local town/city if it's not listed yet!

AZ: Sedona, AZ: Tucson,
CA: Los Angeles (Hollywood), CA: San Diego, CA: Sacramento, CA: San Francisco (Mission), CA: San Francisco (Oakland)
CO: Boulder
CT: New Haven
DC: Washington
IL: Chicago
GA: Atlanta
MA: Boston
MO: St Louis
NC: Charlotte
NM: Albuquerque, 
NY: Brooklyn, NY: Lower East Side 
OR: Portland, 
PA: Philadelphia, 
TN: Nashville
TX: Austin, TX: Fort Worth,
UT: Salt Lake City
VT: Burlington
WA: Seattle

http://youtu.be/tvXScNU6GAM

Here at Gateway Women our motto is:

We may not be mothers but we're here, we care, we count and we ROCK!!

If you're childfree (ie: childless-by-choice) you're welcome to join us, but you'll find that most of us are childless-by-circumstance which means that we wanted to have children (or are still hoping to one day) but:

• we didn't (or haven't yet) met the right partner

• we've got infertility issues

• we've come to the end of fertility treatments

• becoming a voluntary single-mother isn't right for us

• we've got partners who don't want children (or more children)

• we've got genetic or medical conditions that mean we've chosen not to have children

• we're ineligible as adoptive parents

• adoption isn't right for us

• you can read my article here on "50 Ways Not to Be A Mother" to show how many ways there are other than 'didn't want' or 'couldn't have'

There are so many reasons why a woman doesn't have children, and this is one group where no-one will mouth well-meaning platitudes at you! Or even talk about it because it's the ONLY place that you won't have to explain how complicated and loaded childlessness can be in our culture right now!

Gateway Women also hosts a private online community over on G+ which you're very welcome to join also. Often members get to know each other there and then progress to meeting each other face-to-face via this Meetup group. That's where most of our international members are.

Gateway Women can be any age with the majority of us are from our late-30s to late-50s. Some of us have partners, some of us are single, some of us are divorced, some of us don't fit any of those categories and that's fine too. Heterosexual, bi and gay members welcome.

Gateway Women are a band of very diverse women, but we all share the feeling of 'not fitting in' to a culture that doesn't seem to have a place for us.

You're not weird. You're not alone. You're a Gateway Woman.

And this is your Tribe. Welcome!

Jody Day
Founder of Gateway Women & Author of "Rocking the Life Unexpected: 12 Weeks to Your Plan B for a Meaningful and Fulfiling Life Without Children"
www.gateway-women.com
results.name: Gateway Women USA  for childless women www.gateway-women.com

topics.name: Support Group for survivors of mental abuse

results.description:
Those of us who've been in a verbally abusive relationship describe the feeling of "walking on eggshells" so as to avoid potential triggers.  But no matter how hard you try to prevent them, something, anything, will eventually light the fuse.  Words hurt and cut deep.  The emotional torment and covert abuse such as belittling jokes cuts even deeper  They cause confusion, panic, and a shattered sense of your very identity. 

Verbal abuse, and the underlying emotional and psychological abuse that often go hand in hand, is a painful, widespread social tragedy that knows no borders when it comes to culture, education, or income. It occurs among spouses and significant others, parents and children, teachers and students, bosses and staff. The trauma and confusion it causes cuts so deep that overcoming the effects requires a multi-step process of understanding the problem, coping with the feelings, and rebuilding your strength and identity.

Created by a survivor of verbal and emotional abuse, this Metrowest-based Meetup was formed to give individuals who are living or have lived with abuse validation of their experience and help find the strength to rebound and rebuild. Part education, part support group, events will include a mix of group discussions and speaker events on relevant issues.

Note: For everyone's privacy, this group is set to not show your name or profile to the public.
results.name: Stomping On Eggshells: Overcome Verbal & Emotional Abuse

results.description:
This group is for people who like, love or just want to go bicycling. Experience not necessary. It is NOT for those training for a race or triathalon, who want to to go for 20+ miles, or who are too proud to walk your bicycle up a big hill.

As a kid, I used to love bicycling. It was fun, cool even on a hot day, and made me feel great. I now have a shiny new bike and want to get back into it and realize it will take a lot of practice to work my way up to medium to long distances and build up muscles for those pesky New England hills. And it may well take some peer support to weather through all of that until the pain becomes pure unadulterated pleasure. 

I welcome your feedback and suggestions on how to make this a fun and vibrant group. If you have biking locations you can recommend, please let me know. If you have feedback, please let me know or leave a group review.

Is anyone else up for this?
results.name: North Shore Bicycling For Fun

results.description:
Thanks for joining!

Originally, the group started with running 3 times per week (M/W/F @ 6:30 pm on the Tufts University outdoor track, a.k.a. the Ellis Oval in Google Maps) with exercises from a couch-to-5K trainer. New members joined after the original members completed the training program, so we've evolved into a more free-form workout-buddy thing where new runners are welcome to start the interval training, old runners are able to do 5K time improver exercises or longer runs according to their own preferences, and everything stays social by scheduling workouts by time instead of by distance so that we all warm up and cool down together. The track is open to the public and I've seen people running, walking, and interval training regardless of what time I've been there, so it's been perfect. There's parking on the street for Somerville residents and a small commuter lot that the campus police seem to ignore. However - we're in a state of transition since we're getting into winter. Because it's been too cold out for regular runs, we've switched over to doing runs every week or two for social reasons/to get somewhere cool, like the recent runs to Bantam Cider and Downeast Cider. We've talked about Aeronaut Brewery in Cambridge and a few restaurants and festivals. Those runs are around 2 miles and that's the perfect distance to get there in about the same amount of time whether you're running intervals or just doing a straight jog, or faster if you're already really great at it. There's a virtual event posted for a fictional date in March - it's a place to suggest runs, which will then then turn into events. If you see something you'd like to try, please suggest!  You can always +1 if you'd like to bring a friend. In the spring, we'll go back to 3 times per week.  Send me a message if you have any questions, post comments in events if you have ideas, and I hope to meet you soon!
-Katie

results.description:
Why does God allow suffering in the world? How could a loving God send people to Hell? Why isn’t Christianity more inclusive? How can one religion be “right” and the others “wrong”? Why have so many wars been fought in the name of God?

These are just a few of the questions and doubts even ardent believers wrestle with in our culture today. Come join us this fall as we explore these questions and doubts together and seek to examine the Reasons for belief in God.

The course will begin on September 11th and will meet every other week on Thursday evenings @ 7PM for six weeks (Sept 11, Sept 25, Oct 9, Oct 23, Nov 6, Nov 20) at the Christ the King Somerville in Davis Square (204 Elm Street, Somerville, MA).

results.description:
Welcome to the Boston Anthroposophy Meetup group. The purpose of the group is to let members know about upcoming meetings, lectures, study groups and workshops on spirituality, meditation and personal development. Anthroposophy a.k.a. “Spiritual Science” encompasses many forms of spiritual striving, and our goal is to provide an open and supportive environment for discussing topics about inner spiritual development, personal growth and social transformation. As a modern way of knowing, Anthroposophy is non-denominational, and open to all who are on (or seeking) a spiritual path, and wish to share the fruits of their efforts with others. Although general in nature, it should be noted that our activities and the topics of our discussions are often based on or around the work of philosopher and spiritual scientist, Rudolf Steiner. That said, we strive to be open to all paths, and all points of view. The purpose of our group is learning and discussion, based on a firm conviction that we all have something to learn from one another!

For more information about the Boston Anthroposophical Society including ongoing study groups, please check out our website: http://www.anthroposophyboston.org
results.name: Boston Anthroposophy Meetup

We sit at the intersection of technology (UI / UX, data science), psychology (behavioral economics, positive psychology), and advocacy, and we focus on exposing our members to cutting edge tools, research, and practitioners in each of these areas so they can apply the latest learning in action design in their respective fields.

Whether the goal is to help people save more money, get in shape, cut down on electricity usage, or learn a new language, the idea is the same: how can we use research in behavioral economics and psychology to help users build habits and change their daily behavior?

topics.name: "Cloud Computing" How to use it for your business

results.description:
Today's corporate officers and IT technologists are literally deluged with marketing hype over cloud, and the economic advantages of migrating business and IT functions and applications to the cloud. 

• We have seen corporate giants like NetFlix and Sabre (global reservation system used by major airline carriers) experience cloud-based system outages, causing customer delays and significantly impacting business not just in the US, but impacted globally in the case of Sabre. 

• There are hundreds of cloud providers to choose from in the market today. Not all are enterprise ready, despite their claims. And let's face it, many have paid or biased positioning in leading independent studies released by highly respected IT research companies. 

• How does a CIO or CTO, and today's CEO, tasked to identify the essential drivers of a business, navigate? Leading independent think tanks (Gartner, Aberdeen, IDC, etc) are not fully equipped to provide battle-tested and deep thorough analysis regarding the critical issues of cloud security, network throughput, reliability and ROI when it comes to enterprise grade customers. Researchers can only convey what they read and disseminate their opinions, not facts. Gartner (NYSE:IT) even has in its disclaimer that all analysis is "opinion and not based on facts."

• It's time that we get real answers and share actual experiences from companies who are using enterprise grade cloud and from true technologists that has the experience and credentials to provide an unbiased roadmap. 

GOAL: We create leaner, more efficient companies that is secure, reliable and has the ROI to start training our current employees, and bringing jobs back to the US workforce.
results.name: Boston Cloud Computing Meetup

And we only wish everyone could know about the fun we have square dancing, which is about the best fun you can have in a couple of hours, and also practically the least expensive way to do it with your friends and family.

So, come visit us, and maybe you’ll come back to want more. No partner is needed. Opening night for the 2014-15 season, now being led by our new and illustrious caller Bob Butler, is Thursday September 11th starting at 7 o’clock.

results.description:
This group is for young widow and widowers ages 30-50. I started this group because my husband died last year at the age of 40, I was 39. I searched for young widow groups; they are very difficult to find. I would like to be there for others in the same situation.  I am starting to feel better and want to get out! There are so many questions: Is it too early? How do you start a new life? Where do you go? How do I meet new people? What about the kids? What will people think? There are so many unanswered questions in this confusing time. This groups mission is to support each other, learn as we go, and have fun doing it. Our options are unlimited. We can have coffee and talk, go to dinner, have drinks, take a walk or hike, go to an amusement park, watch a movie, learn to paint, play dates, whatever…we will be a team, we will work together and try our best to meet everyone’s needs and requests.

“New beginnings are often disguised as painful endings…” Tao Tzu
results.name: Making New Memories- Young Widow/Widowers Metrowest & RI

results.description:
Gnosis is the study of the most sacred and ancient knowledge of humanity. Gnosis is the direct experience of truth, through the awakening of consciousness.

"Change your thoughts and you change your world"

If you are a seeker on the esoteric path interested in working on yourself, the Gnosis lectures written by Samael Aun Weor are a great place to start.  Gnosis has often been referred to as the golden thread that runs through all religions.  If you enjoy the writings of H.P. Blavatsky, Alice Bailey, Rudolf Steiner, G.I. Gurdjieff,  Carl Jung, Krishnamurti, Paramahansa Yogananda, Buddha, etc., there are many parallels in the Gnostic work.  Gnosis covers a very broad spectrum of topics, with a different topic covered in every class, such as: the knowledge of the universal laws, the seven root races, the universal sound, the seven cosmos, the tree of life, the solar man, how to transform impressions, the science of breathing, the seven chakras, the sexual alchemy, astral travel, the age of Aquarius and the Pancatattwa ritual.  

Gnosis provides tools and meditation practices for spiritual development and true psychological change. These tools are practical and can be utilized by anyone in all occasions of life.
results.name: Boston Association of Gnostic Anthropology

A typical meeting might include a meditative practice, a deep feeling experience, some instruction or modeling of various practices and lots of fun, along with collaboration!

I am so very excited to announce that we will be partnering up with the Boston Area Rape Crisis Center for our April charity series!

Rape and sexual assault impact more people than you think - maybe even someone you know.

In the United States, 1 in 6 women and 1 in 33 men reported experiencing an attempted or completed rape at some time in their lives...

The Boston Area Rape Crisis Center (BARCC) is committed to giving survivors and their families and friends the resources they need to reclaim their lives and begin healing, to raising awareness of the issues survivors face, and to ending sexual violence through healing and social change.

Here at TFW Boston, we have the opportunity to help an amazing cause. I look forward to seeing all of you there!

Saturday April 11, 11:45am-1pm

Address:

33 Harrison Ave.

7th Floor

Boston, MA 02111

WARRIORS!! Please take a second to read this...

On January 10th, Nayna's life changed. One of her family members was hit by a car while walking down the street with his 5 year old son...

After 6 days in a coma, he passed away.

He was only 39 years old and a father of two. His wife, Rameelaben, is still learning english, making it very hard for her to support her family.

Nayna has kindly opened her doors, taking care of both children and is helping Rameelaben find work and start a new life....

Every Saturday for the month of February, we are hosting a Charity workout to help raise money for the children's future.

results.description:
Tired of being stuck in the house all day with your kids with nothing to do than to watch kids shows, then this is a group for you...yes you stay at home, working moms and even dads who are interested in cooking, baking, swapping recipes, sewing, hanging out, etc. All skills levels and kids are welcome. I started this group because my family and I moved to Waltham from Florida September 2013 with our 4 old son and 18 month old daughter and I want to socialize with other mommies and for my kids to have playmates . I had a similar group when we lived in Florida with my girlfriends and it was amazing!! Parents if you have a special needs child(ren), please don't be shy about joining.  Please note that mamabakers meet ups are every other week, mostly AM groups and PM at the members request.  This is a judgement free, inviting and fun group so if this sounds like the group for you, please feel free to join!  

As of March 1st there is a strick "Mamabakers" policy. Due to the group being held at my private residence, I'm forced to limit the membership to 20-25 members and so far I've kept it at 20-21 members but have been receiving numerous request for membership but is forced to decline their request. I'm overwhelmed with messages in regards to joining the group so I've spoken to the active members and we've implemented a solution. Every member must attend a meetup session once every 2 months to see if the group is the right fit for them, if you don't comply you'll be sent a reminder and if it's ignored you'll become inactive. Starting in the spring I may host meetups on Saturdays or Sundays to accommodate every member. If you have any questions or suggestions please feel free to message me. My intention isn't to offend anyone and I hope you truly understand.  In order for a member request to be approved, a picture of yourself or family member must be present thanks!!

results.description:
Women Outdoors is a national, nonprofit organization whose mission is to provide a supportive environment where all women can have fun and challenge themselves in a community of women who love the outdoors while respecting the earth. Women Outdoors promotes leadership, friendship, adventure and enjoyment in the great outdoors.

An all-volunteer organization, Women Outdoors has regional chapters in states throughout the US, all of which organize activities for members such as hiking, biking, kayaking and cross-country skiing.

To become a member of this Meetup group, you must use a recognizable facial photo of yourself in your profile that we can use to identify you at our events. A positive attitude goes a long way, too!  :)

You can learn more at www.womenoutdoors.org.

Membership Dues - There are NO membership dues to join this Meetup, though donations of any size are gratefully accepted and will go toward an annual outing and party.  Although it does cost to maintain a Meetup group, the national Women Outdoors organization generously subsidizes our cost and hopes you'll consider joining. There are many benefits to joining Women Outdoors, including being eligible to register for The Gathering: our yearly Memorial Day weekend at a wonderful camp in New Hampshire that features kayaking on a pond, hiking in the White Mountains, bicycling to  nearby towns, skills workshops such as orienteering, a rock climbing wall, and much more. Women Outdoors also offers subsidized or full tuition reimbursement for leadership and outdoor skills training, including first aid and kayak trip leading, for example. 

We'll soon have a badge indicating which members of this group are registered members of Women Outdoors.

To read more and join, go to http://womenoutdoors.org/joinus.
results.name: Women Outdoors — Eastern Massachusetts Meetup

topics.name: Meetings other couples who share your interest too
Happy Couples meeting other happy couples

results.description:
Tired of hanging around with friends and family who have negative attitudes about their relationships or relationships in general? Happy Couples is a Meet Up group for couples who respect each other and place a high value on creating stable, loving relationships.

Relationship negativity can be contagious, and is especially uncomfortable to be around if you are consciously working to create harmony in your life. And lets face it, hanging around couples who constantly nag and criticize each other is just a huge drag!! If you are a couple that are in a loving, respectful relationship (or are at least actively trying to achieve that) come hang out with us!

Happy Couples is primarily intended to be a social group. We will get together approximately once per month to do activities like bowling, hiking, dinner/drinks, etc., and to have fun getting to know other happy, positive couples!

Our secondary hope is that, as people get to know each other, group members can act as positive role models for each other and provide support for handling any relationship challenges that members face. However, sharing of this kind is strictly optional and can be done as selectively and privately as you wish.

It should go without saying that self-righteousness, nagging, criticism, and put downs between partners (or towards other couples) is not welcome at these meet-ups, nor is the use of negative gender stereotypes. However, we do welcome couples of all ages, races, religions, cultural and socio-economic backgrounds, and sexual orientations. 

Join us for some couples fun free of unnecessary negativity!!
results.name: Greater Boston Happy Couples

results.description: This is group is for parents and expectant parents of egg and/or sperm donor conceived children (both single and coupled parents, with donor children of any age). I started this group because I just couldn't find any groups to meet other parents raising donor-conceived kids. I'm looking forward to meeting other folks who are in a similar situation (and if you're considering using donor eggs and/or donor sperm to start your family, you're welcome too!). I want this group to be a place of support where we can bring our questions and concerns about parenting donor-conceived children and all of the issues that can bring up--for us and for our children--so that we can make the most of this incredible journey while we raise our miraculous children! ***Please note, our initial meetings will be held in Swampscott, MA (North Shore), but I'm totally open to have it in other locations if any of you are interested in hosting some meetings***
results.name: Parents of Donor Conceived Children

"A Wharton MBA graduate with a BS from MIT, I have been an MBA Admissions Consultant since 2008 and have helped hundreds of applicants around the world get into top MBA programs. Besides perfecting the MBA admissions process and making dreams come true for applicants from Tokyo to San Francisco and everywhere in between, I have also worked across consulting, financial services and strategy & corporate development roles before becoming a Full-Time admissions consultant. I ran Global Strategy / Corporate Development as a Director of a 700 person leading independent publishing company. I also worked for InterContinental Hotels Group in Global Strategy, as well as JP Morgan and Deloitte Consulting in Mergers & Acquisitions. My experience in many of the jobs applicants have today or hope to obtain post-MBA helps me advise them on the best ways to not only get into their top choice schools, but position themselves for their dream jobs."

results.description:
Great Pond Sangha is for anyone interested in Buddhist meditation, newbies and old-timers alike. We offer the following: guided and silent meditation practices primarily from the Mahayana and Natural Awareness (Dzogchen,Mahamudra) traditions of Tibetan Buddhism, info sessions for beginners, Dharma talks, discussion and Q&A, study group, half and full-day mini retreats, evening and day-long programs with visiting teachers/lamas, opportunities to engage together in Seva (sacred service), all-ages potlucks and movie nights, yearly all-ages weekend retreat. 

Some significant sources of inspiration for our group are the teachings of Lama Willa Miller, Pema Chodron, and Thich Nhat Hanh. We serve the entire Merrimack Valley community and are affiliated with North Parish U.U. 

The following weekly activities are offered free of charge and are open to anyone who would like to drop in: Wed evenings 7:30-9:00 pm Guided Meditation and Discussion; Fri mornings 8:30-9:15 am Silent Sitting and Walking Meditation. 

More info: greatpondsangha@gmail.com

www.facebook.com/greatpondsangha

PLEASE NOTE: Most of the friends who regularly attend are not Meetup members, so there are ALWAYS more people attending than it says on the Meetup site!

results.description:
Books worth reading. Do you love to read? Do you like to meet to discuss the most recent read?

Get some tips, tools and tricks for finding your next great read!

This new Book group is for people, ages 30's to 50's, interested in meeting to discuss great books at a local restaurant (tavern,cafe) with.

Instead of selecting one book for the group to read, and then discuss, like some book clubs do,  this Book Group is “theme” based.

Examples of book themes:  Books that have inspired you, Books worth a 2nd read, Fiction, Non-fiction, Humor, History, Autobiography, etc.

Members bring a book that they have read (or are reading), based on the Book event’s theme, and share their review, what they liked. Would they recommend it as a read? And open it up for the group to discuss. The plan is to divide the time between members and to keep it to a 2-3 hour window or less.

Where we will meet: The meet-up locations will be at a restaurant, or cafe nearby Burlington, Massachusetts (or within a half hour driving range of the Burlington, Massachusetts area).

Our plan is to schedule a Next Great Reads Book Meet-up once a month, on a Sunday (or Tuesday during the summer) evening.

Books can include e-books, audiobooks, coffee table books, cook books, photography books, magazine articles  or library books.

If you don’t have a book to bring with you (e.g. the book is loaned out, borrowed) , you can always bring some general information about the book with you, via notes, smartphone, or tablet, clippings etc.

Some Guidelines:  Keep in mind we are in a public setting when choosing a book. No fifty Shades. To discuss a book whose content is appropriate for a public setting.

Also, no Authors intending to use this meetup to market their books are allowed.
If the book is fiction, when discussing,  the key is not to give away the ending! (spoiler alerts).

Per club policy,we require that you  provide your real name, a face photo (so we will recognize you at the Meetup events) and, show(unhide) your meet up interests and groups (click on “unhide your interests and groups from others” in your Profiles section). No guests please. Have your guest join the meet-up group (and be approved ) so that they can attend an event.

Meet-up Costs: We do not charge member fees, nor do we have sponsors (yet) who help pay the organizer’s Meet up's annual fee (which runs about $144 a year). If members would like to help contribute towards the costs for the organizers annual fee, we will cheerfully accept voluntary donations (cash or credit card).

As a way of saying Thank You to those members who donate $5(or more), we are
offering the following perks:

If an event is full, whoever’s first on the wait list who has made a donation of $5 (or more), gets moved up to the RSVP list. With a maximum of 2 donors per event getting to move ahead (applicable up to 48 hours before the event date). This perk is valid for each and every event throughout the calendar year.

If needed, the Next Great Read Meetup Group may schedule a fundraising event as well. 

Donations are nonrefundable, and will remain with the group and only be used to fund annual organizer’s meetup.com fees For transparency, we will post the donors list in the groups Meetup page, under More section, subheading files, called Next Great Read donation list.

We are also open to any Book Meetup themes that you might be interested in. We look forward to having fun and meeting you all!
results.name: The Next Great Read... Book Club for 30's to 50's

topics.name: Growing in Intimacy with Jesus Christ

results.description:
This is a no-pressure, non-religious discussion group for anyone interested in exploring and experiencing Jesus. 

Jesus was many things - prophet, teacher, healer, role model, guide and people gatherer. MLK, Jr., Gandhi and the Dali Lama have all cited him as a major influence on their lives. 

A major part of Jesus' life was providing supernatural physical healing and spiritual freedom for people.  He worked miracles like raising the dead and had command over natural elements.  

And he saw the people around them in a way that let them know he cared about them personally. 

On Oct 30th we are exploring the questions: "If Jesus healed back then, does he still do it now?" and "Does he see me and my need?" 

Group meets every Thursday night from Oct 9-Nov 20 (7pm-8:30pm) at 73 Endicott Ave near Teele Sq. Drop in for one night or come for all of them! 

Let's explore and experience one of the most amazing people who's ever lived!
results.name: Conversations about Jesus

results.description: Many of us are familiar with B-tree indexing, the predominant indexing scheme built into nearly all DBMS platforms for the past 40-years - Including NoSQL platforms such as MongoDB. This Meetup Group is for anyone interested in learning how to take full advantage of a more modern indexing scheme, Fractal Tree indexing. Fractal Tree indexing lies at the heart of TokuMX, a high-performance, open source, fork of MongoDB . Join us to learn how you can use TokuMX to turn MongoDB into a powerful big data platform by improving data ingestion by 20x, compressing your MongoDB database by 90% and extending the life of your storage hardware systems with 2x better write-optimization - All without having to make any changes to your MongoDB applications.
results.name: TokuMX BOS - Super-charging MongoDB in Boston

results.description:
My motto is "Do Something Creative Every Day!".

I have been a scrapbooker and stamper for about 10 years now.  I started my foray into scrapbooking by attending a Creative Memories workshop and I was hooked!  My style of scrapbooking has changed over the years (can you say Sticker Sneeze?). I now use a combination of digital and tradition scrapping style. I attend scrapbooking retreats a few times a year which gives me the devoted time I need to focus on my albums.

My introduction to stamping began with taking a class at a local paper specialty store, that has now since closed (Ink About It). I fell in love with stamping! I love making hand-made cards and the first person I gave one of my cards to was my wonderful Mother-in-law! She was so appreciative that it really made my day. From there I took many classes and read many blogs to learn all about the different products and techniques that are out there! There are so many!!!

So..... that takes to me today! When I first started stamping, A Muse Artstamps were the first stamps that captured my attention. A Muse had grown over the years and is now know as A Muse Studio, a direct sales company which has an incredible product line of stamps, inks, paper, pocket page style scrapbooking albums and supplies, fabulous embellishments, ribbons, tools and so much more! For anyone not familiar with A Muse Studio, they offer an exclusive line of cling-mount red rubber stamps, custom-printed papers, ribbons, dies and embellishments for creating handmade greeting cards, scrapbook pages and more.

To continue with my love affair with card making, scrapbooking and stamping I joined A Muse Studio three years ago as an Independent Consultant. I offer workshops monthly in my home as well as doing in-home get-togethers (think of a crafty Girls Night Out). I would love to have you 'meetup' at one of my workshops.
results.name: Middlesex County Rubber Stamping & Papercrafting Group

Reiki and Hypnotherapy are both amazing tools for self-care and self-empowerment. This Reiki Share/Clinic originally began in 2000 at the Addison Gilbert Hospital and continues monthly in Manchester-by-the-Sea, MA offering Meditation and Reiki Sessions. (Private Sessions of Reiki and Hypnosis and Reiki Training also available.) Join us for 'Community, Sharing, and Caring' and Promote Peace and Well Being for All. results.description: This is our social group for people who have a love for video games, movies, anime, comic books and anything nerdy/geeky and consider themselves to be simple nerds and polite, considerate people. I am looking for people with good emotional control and who believe in compromising/getting along with others. People who truly believe that they are on this earth to work hard, play hard, and feel that they work to live, not live to work and have little desire for materialistic possessions, status quo, or fitting into society. Veterans are very welcome because I am a proud veteran. Those who consider themselves kids at heart are perfect for this group. People of all races, genders and ethnic backgrounds are welcome. I have lived all over the United States and have experience interacting with people of all walks of life and I can get along with anybody. I am looking for a general age range of 25-40 but those older or younger are welcome if they have a positive attitude. Rude or angry behavior and any type of racial, ethnic or gender discrimination will not be tolerated. I am looking for people with a very positive attitude, emotional maturity and a high level of character. It is very important that everybody is willing to interact with one another so that strong friendships can be developed and we can be a tight knit group. I myself am a very nerdy/geeky good 'ol boy and am not afraid to show others how quirky, silly and funny I am. You will not be judged by myself or others for being yourself as long as you are happy and emotionally stable. A little more about myself: I am a non-conformist. At present, I am content with my life situation. I am 33, a very real person and don't strive to be something that I am not. I'm a grown up kid and believe that the key to true happiness lies in simplicity of life with no materialism, little stress, strong emotional control, a healthy lifestyle and a logical state of mind. I prefer to stay away from Boston. I am very passionate about video games and movies (I love to quote movies) and anything that involves adventure and excitement but not danger or unnecessary risk. I grew up in a rural part of Ohio and am having trouble fitting into the culture in the Boston area. I came here for work. If you are out there and believe that you have a similar state of mind that I do, inquire about joining my group.

Writers let's meet other Writers!  This meetup is an opportunity for writers to get out, and socialize with other writers in hopes of building a community and finding our tribe.  It's so important to meet other people who do what you do and understand your life ambitions.

results.description:
We're a group of engineers who work with data and data processing systems.

We are especially interested in the aspects of those systems that *aren't* "Data Science"--those difficult and crucial activities like:

- getting, reformatting and cleaning up the data

- designing data processing systems for easy forensics

- operating valuable data processing systems in the real world

If you read that New York Times article "For Big-Data Scientists, 'Janitor Work' Is Key Hurdle to Insights" and thought "Data Janitor and Proud!" then you should join us.
