results.description: International Sundays are exclusive access events that take place on a weekly basis. The premise is simple: to deliver a night specifically tailored for a globally sophisticated crowd. Making Sundays at Minibar the premier destination for a wide variety of globally minded individuals, including but not limited to: young professionals, local socialites and fashion enthusiasts. Given the wide variety of backgrounds and nationalities, music genres rotate on a weekly basis. The night has become one of the top attractions for some of Boston's best DJs, the kind of individuals who share the vision and passion of the night's message. Where some Sundays might appear more like Salsa nights, others would be geared towards EDM, Top 40s, open-format or even Mediterranean music. Additionally, we hold fashion shows and other special themed nights (ex. Masquerade parties). International Sundays at Minibar have been going for about two years now, making Sundays one of Boston's longest continuously running nights. Upscale dress code is mandatory and admission is RSVP based. No, there is no cover. If I could cut the longer story short I would simply say that: we've built more than a typical night here, we've built a family. For further information, tables, RSVP please contact : InternationalSundays@Groupmail.com or 857-264-1321
results.name: Boston's International Sundays - Weekly

topics.name: The practical application of Gurdjieff's teachings

results.description: All and Everything, written by GI Gurdjieff, and published in 1949 lays out his ideas regarding the possibility for the further development of ordinary people. But what in me is yet undeveloped, and once developed can it address certain life questions such as personal freedom, and the cessation of unconscious suffering. Our group meets to discuss the teachings of GI Gurdjieff, and Willem Nyland who was asked by Gurdjieff to start groups in America. Through reading of All and Everything, open group discussion, and practical application, we come to understand what inner development might be, and how it would affect the way we live our lives. All who are interested are welcome.  For further information contact www.nyland.org
results.name: Boston/Nyland Gurdjieff Group

results.description: The Boston Real Time Analytics for Big Data group was created to provide a forum for those in Boston to share tips, tricks and knowledge about creating low latency data driven analytical apps to optimize your business.  Data Driven Apps effortlessly bring together your business data with your streaming big data, enabling real-time decisions.  These Apps are fast, focused, quick to deploy, and easily extensible. They are built to address a specific use case and be modified by your analysts as your business requirements change.   What if you could not only discover predictive patterns in your historical data but also identify and act on these events as they occur in real time, while it still matters?  For example: The ability to identify a hack attempt as it occurs so you can act before any damage is done.   With the variety and volume of data available these days from a number of sources (RDBMS, web logs, sensor data, social media, etc.) we're interested in discussing how you make sense of all this data and derive real business value from it in real time.
results.name: Boston Real Time Streaming Analytics for Big Data Meetup

results.description:
Calling all active retirees (or not yet retired but taking time for fun) ready to explore and play with new friends! It's "summer" all year long now for us! We can do what we want, when we want! No more waiting for weekends and then having to try to find parking in crowded lots etc. We are free! I retired from teaching this year and am looking for others who would love to get together for some fun (outdoors preferably) whenever we feel like it! Especially during the week when others are working and places are not crowded. While we will set-up activities to look forward to, those who are up for "last minute" gatherings can share their preferred "instant contact" info and we can text, email or call one another to invite for spontaneous fun.

I love to hike (easy to moderate), bike (same), kayak, scuba when in warm waters and explore new places. I also love to travel and think it would be great to have some friends to travel with. (Right now I'm looking at ways to explore New Zealand and Australia and environs, but I am open to anything.) I'll even learn to play cards again when the nights are long and the weather not so inviting. Don't let my "lack of focus" scare you- it's just about being OPEN to whatever sounds like fun as the moments arise and acting on it- with friends. I'm so happy to be retired! Come and join me ;-)

Regarding bringing friends: Please just have anyone who would like to come along join our group and sign-up for the activity online. Thank-you.


---LEGAL STUFF----

Please note that: AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING  and JOINING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  The organizers and event hosts in this group are not trained leaders or instructors. The organizers only set the time and place. Each person participating in any group event is responsible for their own safety. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol during any Retirees Ready for Adventure active outdoor event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.

By clicking on "Yes" for any event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Metrowest Retirees Ready for Adventure Group for and related to any event which I attend. I attest and verify that I (and any guest(s) I bring are physically fit to participate in any portion of each event I attend.


I grant Metrowest Retirees Ready for Adventure Group permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of all events for any purpose.


Now, let's have fun!
results.name: Metrowest Retirees (or not yet) Ready for Adventure

results.description:
This is a group for introverts who need a bit of nudging, planning or inspiration to close the laptop/book and get out a bit more. Activities will be located around Cambridge/Somerville area, but sometimes venture all the way to Boston. Activities will vary and membership is open to those who consider themselves to be true introverts. There's only one rule: participate. :-)

Please note:  This is not a group to "cure" introverts toward extroversion.   This is a group for introverts to meet others who have the same disposition -- which, I believe I read somewhere,  is about 30% of the population.  Personally,  I like who I am and do not ever wish to be "more extroverted" and I hope you feel the same about yourself.  There are plenty of Meetups for extroverts -- heck, the world favors extroversion.  Help me to carve a nice, quiet, subtle, thoughtful, respectful place for introverts to meet, socialize and celebrate who they are.  :-)
results.name: Cambridge Introverts Unite!

results.description:
Imagine what it would be like to walk through life unafraid, fully comfortable in your own skin, and peaceful - filled with joy at the wonder and flow of life. This is what Tantric Shamanism is all about. It combines the tenants of the deeply ecstatic spiritual aspects of Tantra with the practical personal power-based elements of Shamanism to create a truly luscious experience of life. 

 In this meetup, we'll explore the path into this ecstatic state of being. We'll shift perspectives, learn new ways of being, and step into stronger, fuller, more expansive expressions of ourselves.

Sacred Union - How to Have a Conscious Relationship 
When you come together spiritually and sexually at the same time, you put yourself in a position to find that sacred union that can exist between two people. In these classes, you'll find out how to create better relationships, better connection, and a higher level of intimacy. 

Spiritual Growth 
One of the things that takes us out of relationship quickly is fears, doubts, and insecurities. They are the biggest threat to us getting and keeping love in our lives. In these classes, we'll explore what it takes to really be comfortable in your own skin and how to let go of the fears and neediness that threaten your ability to have healthy relationships. 

Personal Power
In these classes, we'll be discussing how to claim and maintain your personal power. Personal power allows you to speak your truth, set and hold your boundaries, and face and overcome your fears. 

Energy Games 
If you hope to create union with your partner, you'll need to learn how to move your energy and read your partner's energy. In these classes, you'll learn how to work with energy in a fun, hands-on environment. 

And More...
We will be offering a wide variety of classes to serve the needs of those seeking an intimate connection with their partner. All genders/orientations welcome.
results.name: Tantric Shamanism

results.description:
We meet to help one another explore, form, join, or improve businesses without bosses: worker cooperatives.

Join us if you are interested in working for yourself but not working alone— nor in being someone else's boss.

This group is a regular show and tell for freedom-seeking employees, creatives, freelancers, business owners, jobless individuals, and entrepreneurs wanting to learn about and share work experiences applicable to working in a shared-ownership model.  Those of us in worker cooperatives and collectives share our experiences and challenges and discuss ways to make our businesses and our lives better.

Worker cooperatives are businesses owned and controlled by the people who work in them. They are a time-tested way to create quality jobs, and are gaining momentum as a strategy to build and anchor wealth in communities.
results.name: Boston/Cambridge Worker Cooperative Meetup

topics.name: Growing Business thru Fun & Effective Networking

results.description:
Are you looking to grow your business through referrals? Do you enjoy meeting smart, engaging and friendly people with the same goal? 

We are a fun and dedicated group of professionals, entrepreneurs and business owners expanding our businesses by passing referrals to each other. We get to know fellow members — their experience, skills, and talents— then can serve as informal sales teams for each other. Note: allow only one person per profession, so emails us to find out whether there is an "open seat" for you. 

So far this year, we have passed 558 referrals to group members that were worth $1.1 million in business – not bad for a group of 29 people! We are a chapter of Business Networking International, and unlike other networking organizations, BNI allows only one person to represent a given profession so you alone represent your industry, product or service, giving you an edge over your competition. 

We meet from 7-8:30 a.m. in Newton, MA at Cabot Park Village, 280 Newtonville Avenue. The meetings provide lots of opportunities to learn about members' businesses and to network.  And there's a lot of laughter!

Contact us through Meetup and we can tell you whether there is an available seat for your profession/trade. You can also see who is in our group by checking out our website. Hope to meet you soon!

http://www.bnimass.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=4775&t=cc67d5b8a84561cee1166961e91bc074c0751107276f2ad979f997b573979946&name=BNI%20BNI%20Newton%20Connectors
results.name: Newton Connectors: A Business Referral Networking Group

results.description:
Hey Ladies,

I have recently moved back to the city and I see the social scene is building. I believe some of us women may not know everything that Boston has to offer. I work for a major hospital and have some discounts for some fun events. I am starting this group in hopes that I can bring together a strong network of black women in the area. I envision the group to be a social group reminiscent of the olden days. I hope to mix the old with the new. Interested in a big hat Sunday brunch? community service? night life? speed dating, travel? girl's nights? a friend for life? as support group for life? help in all aspects of life? I hope for this group to the ultimate "girlfriend's, meets sex and the city, meets your church mother group.

results.description:
Find hope and healing while going through separation or divorce. We learn about relevant topics and discuss them. We support each other during a difficult time in our lives. Friends who have been through separation and divorce are here to help us.

One time registration fee of $20 includes a workbook and snacks.  Scholarships are available.

Topics are presented from a Christian perspective, however all are invited to attend.

All meetings take place at Park Street Church, 1 Park Street, Boston, MA  02108.  Located downtown at the Park Street T stop on the red and green lines.  Parking discounts available after 4pm weekdays and on weekends at One Beacon Street garage ($9. Stamp your ticket at our event) and Boston Common garage ($9.  Buy a voucher from the receptionist at our event).  See www.parkstreet.org/directions for further information.

results.description:
We help people connect with the right resources, from an angel investor to a coach or mentor or team member. Holding 4-12 programs every month, surely there's something of interest for yu: clean tech? medical instruments? Marketing? Robotics?

We are building a destination for people in technology in MetroWest including Worcester county  -- business side and tech side -- who like to learn while expanding their network.

Industry sectors (medical devices, life sciences, robotics, manufacturing, software, IoT, big data, clean tech and energy, mobile apps, consumer electronics) b

Business topics (funding, marketing) and plain old networking (with a twist as we cover LinkedIn, Social Media, Effective Networking, IP and more).

Amazing resources right on I495!

Starting a company? Ask about our coworking space and makerspace.

Thanks to the support of amazing Sponsors, MassTechCollaborative, and the VIPs who help us out!

results.description: The Boston Computational Biology and Bioinformatics (BCBB) Meetup group is a networking event for computational biologists in the Boston / Cambridge area. Thanks to the confluence of top universities, hospitals, research institutes, large pharmaceutical companies, and a vibrant biotech startup community, Boston has arguably the strongest CBB community in the nation. However, for practitioners of computational biology in Boston the landscape can appear siloed and unapproachable, perhaps due in part to the lack of a centralized networking group. The Boston CBB Meetup hopes to fill this void and act as a regular venue for computational biologists in the Boston area to meet, network, share information, and learn.
results.name: Boston Computational Biology and Bioinformatics Meetup

results.description:
This is a "pregnancy club" type group for newly pregnant women who have struggled with depression in the past, are currently feeling well, and want to prevent relapse of depression during pregnancy. It was created for women who are not currently suffering from depression, and who are planning to go off of antidepressant treatment during pregnancy (after careful thought and consultation with their psychiatrist or an expert in perinatal psychiatry).

The aim of the group is to provide extra knowlege, social support, and skills based on techniqes from reseach on resilience and prevention of depression. Our group is collaborative and flexible, social and fun! It's a great way to meet a network of women at a similar stage in pregnancy who are open to discussing the emotional and psychological side of being pregnant. We meet in downtown Boston, near MGH and are planning to begin our next group in December, so if you're interested in being a part of it, get in touch! This would be for women finding out they are pregnant in Oct/Nov/Dec.

No need to actually join this group via meetup.com if you're interested in joining our group (although we welcome you to if you'd like). You can call our office 617-724-2931
results.name: Preventing Depression in Pregnancy Together

topics.name: Drawing - Pencil, Charcoal, Pen and Ink, Markers

results.description:
The combined practice of drawing and movement enhances perception and opens up possibilities for drawing by nourishing the connection between vision and our other senses. We come to experience what we see in the context of what we feel, hear and smell, what we can remember, imagine and depict. Practiced together, movement and drawing neither dilute nor buttress one another but rather run in parallel, demanding both rigor and open-mindedness. 

This drawing and movement group should allow us to practice different movement modalities, such as the Feldenkrais Method of somatic education, the Alexander Technique, Yoga or Pilates, all the while, or alternately, drawing. In pairs or as a group, we can trade off moving and drawing each other move.
results.name: Cambridge Drawing + Movement Meetup

topics.name: Food Cravings and Weight Loss Support

results.description:
This group is dedicated to supporting members who are looking to lose weight in a healthy, safe manner. You have found the place for you if: you desire to lose weight now; have tried more diets than you can count; are confused by all of the conflicting information available; are looking for a supportive, nonjudgmental community; and want to have fun!

I've been where you are. I've tried tons of diets, pills, and potions. I've spent thousands of dollars on short term solutions to fix a long term problem. I've wondered why I couldn't lose weight when others seem to be able to do so. After numerous failures, I finally succeeded in losing 170 lbs without surgery or pills. Lasting change is possible! You can do it with the right tools and support.

Each month (usually the 2nd Thursday of the month at 7PM) I will provide tips on a health related topic followed by an open discussion.

Wanda Cox, Certified Health Coach & founder of Wellness With Wanda


http://youtu.be/xuDUl8Vhs9g
results.name: South Shore Weight Loss Community

results.description:
Are you excited about being here? Meet Mature like-minded Adults interested in learning more about Soul line dancing i.e. Line Dancing, Shuffles, slides or hustles.  Become a part of Boston's Urban Dance Community with or without a partner. Men Needed, Couples Encouraged and Singles Welcome to the partnering dance styles referred to as "Steppin" previously called  the New Bop referenced from the Hub of Chicago "Chicago-style Steppin--a partnering dance style similar to Swing, Walkin & Detroit Ballroom. This dance style can observed in social settings across US major cities. This is not Greek Steppin. 

This meetup is established to build an interest group, travel club/ class enrollment/ meetup group North & South of Boston, MA while promoting Soul line dancing & Steppin in the Northeast of the USA.

Classes are held locally and around the Northeast.  Demographics 40 plus. Steppin Parties are referred to as SETS and Line Dance Parties speaks for itself. Line dancing events take place in and around MA in these genres: Soul, Progressive-Non Country & Country line dancing in VFW or  mature, safe dance clubs environment. Both dance styles offer an escape, better agility, flexibility, mobility creating a better doctor's report.  Soul line dancing can be Empowering,Inspiring and a whole lot of FUN.  Meet the curious-minded just like you interested in one style or both. Let's Dance Boston!


Sign Up Today  www.soullinedancers.com
results.name: New England SOUL URBAN DANCES

results.description: Our mission is to promote respect and unity among all female riders by embracing the true meaning of sisterhood.  We are women of integrity who encourage a positive self image and solidarity with all motorcycle clubs.  We also support our community through charitable events and community service.

results.description: This is a group for small dogs on the South Shore to meet up and have some fun-away from the bigger dogs that tend to play rough and may view the little ones as lunch! Their aren't any off-leash dog parks designed for small dogs in the area, though their are a few unofficial locations that have become known as general dog friendly parks. Stodders Neck in Hingham and Squantum Point Park in Quincy are the two that come to mind. The goal for this group is to potentially get a group together weekly on the weekends at an outdoor location  to socialize the dogs and to let them expend energy. The owners can feel free to bring a chair,  a coffee and hopefully find some other cool, dog loving people.

topics.name: New to Bodybuilding, Fitness, Figure Competition
bodybuilding physique fitness figure bikini sport

results.description:
Do you hate going to a gym and joining 20 plus people and feel judged during a fitness class but like the camaraderie of a group setting? Do you have physical or health limitations where safe exercise or pose modifications are needed but there isn't anyone to help? Are you looking for a fitness class that will put fun back into fitness? Well look no further. Our classes offer much more than an opportunity to strengthen and stretch. In a space that is free from judgment, students can build heat, strength, or mindfulness in classes taught by positive and well-seasoned certified personal trainers or yoga instructors. No matter your fitness levels, we have a class for you!

In January, we introduced Kids Bootcamp Classes.  These are high energy fun filled classes for kids.  Increasing their overall health and fitness level by utilizing partner activities, body weight exercises, resistance bands, circuits, fitness games, and more.  This class will create an environment where kids associate fitness with fun which will foster healthy adult living habits for life. 

If you are looking for a personal attention, we specialize in personal and small group training.  In a One-on-One Personal Training session it is you and your trainer.  Your exercise program is designed for your fitness level, goals and nutritional needs.   In a small group setting you will experience the personal attention you want at a budget friendly price.  Small Group Training is limited to 2-8 people and you can join an existing group or start your own with family or friends. 

We have started conditioning and strengthening classes for athletes and gymnasts.  If you are a coach of a youth sports team or a gymnastic studio and would like us to create classes designed for your students, please contact the studio.
results.name: Reading Fitness Meetup

results.description:
Adventures in Photography (New England) is a Meetup Group for the adventurous and travel minded photographer. It provides photographic opportunities beyond the local geographic area with a broad range of interests ranging from grand landscapes to wildlife to exotic cities. Our objective is to take extraordinary images in extraordinary places in the world.

Adventures In Photography Meetup Group would like to share its passion for photography with other like-minded photo enthusiasts. Our Meetup Group will be hosting photography related events such as travel photography and other activities intended to help photographers of all levels come together and enjoy the many rewards that photography has to offer. Photographers of all skill levels who are looking to improve their skills, find new creative outlets for shooting, or just to connect with a friendly group of people to socialize and talk shop are all welcome to join.

While we do intend to offer field trips to the usual destinations that offer a rich variety of photo ops, we have no intention of stopping there. We will seek out unusual and extraordinary destinations that will offer a wide variety of photographic adventures. We intend to offer same day field trips, weekend field trips and longer photo adventures designed to accommodate wide and varied interests.

We are limited only by our imagination and your willingness to support our efforts. Everything connected with this Meetup Group will be conceived, planned and managed by photographers for photographers.
results.name: Adventures in Photography - New England

Dog Owners - Join us for events like Meet the Trainer where dog owners can ask a specific trainer or behavior expert questions in a casual environment, and everyone can learn from each others' questions.

Dog Professionals - Join us for Networking Events where we share information and network. We all have different areas of focus and strengths that we can all learn from.

I hope to see you at our next event!

Kim Courtney, Organizer

results.description:
This is a Meetup for the Developer and Cloud Computing community. Both IaaS, PaaS Open Source, Applications and computing technology will be discussed. It's a chance for developers, professionals, researchers, and enthusiasts in the Dallas area to come together.

The Verizon Global Wholesale Cloud Team is looking for ways to drive cloud adoption of the Verizon Cloud Platform. We are looking for Hackers to brainstorm and create new and exciting apps that run on the Verizon Cloud and leverage technologies from Verizon's multiple platforms (Verizon Wireless, FioS, Edgecast, Telematics and the Verizon Enterprise Network) as well as those of our Partners.

What your Meetup Group is about: Development of Apps that reside on the Verizon Cloud Platform and Accelerating adoption and usage of the Verizon Cloud.

Who should join: Developers and Cloud Enthusiasts
What members can expect of the group, and what you expect of them: Have fun and get the opportunity to develop apps on the Verizon Cloud.

results.description: The premise of Work From Bar is simple: we go to a bar, and we get some work done. That's right, we bust out our laptops, journals, etc. at the bar. You'd be surprised how much you can get don e with a beer on your hand. You can work on your day job, your side project, your novel, organizing your email - whatever you like, but you must do it while drinking your beverage of choice. This is not a meetup with speakers or a common group focus. We are not going to go around the room doing formal introductions or presentations on our work. Just show up, meet some friendly faces, and enjoy a safe space to pair your productivity with a drink.

results.description: This group is for professionals in the Boston area who work in Corporate Social Responsibility (aka CSR, Corporate Responsibility, Corporate Citizenship, Corporate Sustainability) and its various forms. Through monthly networking gatherings in a casual setting, we get together to listen to a speaker and then share ideas about CSR and network among an informed group. As such we link with allied CSR Meetup Groups in Geneva, Amsterdam, New York, Mauritius (Port Louis), Athens, Dubai and Washington DC and work closely with these groups, sharing ideas and resources with the ultimate aim of generating new thinking on what best practice CSR might look like, both in theory and in practice.

We meet at least once a month for dinners, discussion, networking and planning activities. We also hold public forums and other events on the South Shore on current social and political issues. We seek to re-boot democracy by encouraging increased voting along with support for active social and political involvement. We are open to Democrats, Republicans, Independents, Libertarians, Labor Party, Green Party and Vegetarians! In other words we welcome anyone who is interested, believes and is willing to share their ideas about the ongoing progressive improvement society and mankind in general.

Not only that, but with our dedication and enthusiasm, we help others transform their lives. Simply stated, we are professionals and make a difference. Join us for a get together with other personal trainers, fitness and dance instructirs in the Greater Boston area to exchange ideas, work on techniques, or just show off! The idea is that like other professionals, we can all gain by working together to improve ourselves, and see what others in our field are up to. No boring lectures, just kick-ass fun.

www.swetstudio.com
results.name: Boston Dance/Fitness Instructors

Many of our fellow students and friends have benefitted tremendously from this practice and we wanted to share it with you and your friends and family. We also teach external martial arts and specialize in the ability to connect the internal strength to the external to benefit daily quality of life.
results.name: Cambridge Tai Chi & Internal Arts

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents
Children of Divorce and Changing Families

results.description:
This  group was formed for the people of the south shore who may often times find themselves going to activities (or would like to) with and/or without their children. If you are in a situation where you have kids and are single, or raising kids  pretty much on your own, you may be familiar with the unique challenges and difficulties sometimes encountered. The hope is that this group will form a fun, helping, sharing, collaborative group of solos, (be it never married, divorced, widowed, or disconnected from the other parent for wk, military, etc)into a community within a community of people that would like to have a social life for both them and their children.  We can plan events, meetups and play dates with or without our kids. These meetups can be a huge spectrum of ideas...from parents meeting at a local place to us planning a big moms or dads night out in the city. There are all sorts of possibilities depending on our members. My hope is simply new friends will be made for social contact that is family friendly, or just for the mums and dads that want to connect and have fun with others in common situations.  <br> Anyone is welcome! It is not a prerequisite to be single, nor is it necessary to even have kids, if you're interested in just the adult time!?
In the future we may get to a level where we could assist each other with a huge number of things.  Ie. babysitting, car pooling..there are endless possibilities based on interests of the group! Some trips, activities, excursions, etc, are hard with little ones if you're solo-but with extra hands maybe it's more doable!? Sometimes more enjoyable for parent and kid alike. .....but, as they say, it takes a " village" so initial kiddo ideas are endless and based on the ages of the members kids..

So please join us, get Yourself a sitter, bring photo or two of the kiddos ( if you've got kids) and let's see where it goes....If you're looking to join and you don't have kids, you can get a feel for the crowd. Many people that are looking for fun stuff to do around the south shore may have kids, but they're off to college, etc, and can enjoy the adult time with other singles..... And you can enjoy kiddo activities and play dates on weeks with kids, as we plan them. 

I envision a supportive laid back group of solos that enjoy staying active, getting out here and there, being social and want to further their kids socially...As parents with our kids, plus an extra set of eyes n hands. Or just hang out and meet new people.....form connections with people who may be on a similar path at this point in their life ( or have been there) and just get out when we can.��
results.name: The VILLAGE people of the south shore-help,share,care&FUN!

results.description: Give business, get business - that is the philosophy of our business referral group, BNI South End. Meeting every week with professionals in diverse industries, with a set agenda, and active referring, our group seeks to help each member increase his or her business through meaningful, quality, and structured "word of mouth" referrals. We are looking for members who are committed to cultivating an environment where you develop personal relationships with qualified business professionals from all backgrounds. Simply put, by giving business to others, you get business in return. Every industry is welcome to our group and each industry has one seat. That means you will not be competing with other folks in the group for business in your field - the goal is to expand our referral spheres in a cooperative place. We look forward to meeting you and learning about your business!
results.name: Boston Professional Networking Group

results.description: The Bible is certainly an old book, but does the #1 Bestseller of all time have anything to tell us in the 21st century? Does the message still relate to us nearly 2000 years after its completion? If it does, how? These are all questions that our Bible discussions strive to answer by reading a short story about something Jesus said or did every week and discussing it in a group setting. We try to stay super informal, short, and fun. We'd love to have you!
results.name: Brighton Bible Discussion!

results.description:
Interested in Science Fiction & Fantasy? Welcome to a Book Club devoted to the best in both genres,
From Arthur C. Clarke to Kurt Vonnegut, and from J.R.R. Tolkien to George R.R. Martin.
We meet on the third Tuesday of each month to discuss the books we've read, hang out, eat muffins, and figure out what we would like to read in the future. Our meetings are at 7:00 pm at Sound Bites restaurant in Ball Square, Somerville. We alternate Sci-Fi and Fantasy every other month. Check the calendar, and please join us!

Hope to see you all there!
results.name: The Book Shop Sci-Fi/Fantasy Book Club

results.description: Welcome to our Working Moms Playgroup (Franklin area)! Join our group of Moms to share your motherhood experiences, find advice, give support and make new friends! Our group is geared towards infants, toddlers, pre-schoolers and Kindergarden ages. We are planning to host monthly events, such as in-home play dates, family outings to parks, museums, playgrounds & zoos, and lots of Moms only social events (book club, healthy meals supper club, coffee chat to name a few!) We plan to schedule events on Fridays, weekends and evenings. All Mom's are welcome whether you work full time, part time, or are a SAHM too!
results.name: The Working Mom's Playgroup                  (Franklin Area)

results.description:
Agile Testing Alliance (ATA) is a non-profit Agile testing community and certification organization. It is a global alliance of visionary industry leaders, prominent authors, leading educational institutions and testing evangelists who are passionate about proliferation of agile in testing. ATA’s mission is to grow agile testing awareness, practices, acceptance and to create a learning roadmap specifically in agile testing space. ATA helps agile practitioner to identify the milestones that can be evaluated, certified and recognized.

ATA provides platform for local communities to get together & share ideas on agile testing/automation through local chapters across multiple countries & cities. Greater Boston meet-up group is created for professionals in and around Boston area. We invite all Agile practitioner to come forward and spread awareness about Agile testing in their local areas through hosting events. 

We plan to host seminars/workshops on Agile Testing & Agile automation with you and for you. 

So let's do it.!!!
results.name: Agile Testing Alliance - Greater Boston Chapter

results.description: A group for casual lesbifriend horror movie meetups, zombie walks, American Horror Story fun facts and the like.
results.name: Lesbians Who <3 Horror

results.description: For the full spectrum of PC users, gamers, programmers, or tech oriented people who want to meet other like-minded individuals. The focus on LAN gaming with in-person social meetups along with the occasional competitive experience. We also host any type of meetup that involves high-end PC's that can offer programming, virtual reality, or other digital experiences. A great way to become part of the MA gaming/tech community!
results.name: LAN Gaming Sessions

results.description:
Top Rep Boston brings together today's most successful sales professionals to share their personal strategies and experiences with aspiring sales leaders who are eager to maximize their earning potential and advance their career.

Free beers, free food, and good people!
results.name: Top Rep Boston

results.description:
We welcome anybody interested in UX Research or Design. We have over 2,500 members, and continue to grow. Our annual conference attracted almost 1000 attendees last year. Join now to attend user experience events, receive job listings, and become part of the vibrant Boston user experience community.

UXPABoston.org

We publicize other local meetups and events in our monthly newsletter. Submit your event at the form below:

https://upaboston.wufoo.com/forms/m4l3odz14873t0
results.name: UXPA Boston

results.description: Grace Church is a special place where the personal experience of living by faith is enhanced through a community. We are a growing community consisting of real people who live in the real world, discovering the sacred in our every day lives and in one another. This independent ministry has become a spiritual oasis for the community at large. As the foundations of mainstream denominations have declined, a vast spiritual need has been exposed. Grace Church now has the opportunity to meet this need through familiar practices, welcoming all who are seeking a connection with God. Many are finding a place of healing, growth and peace at Grace Church in Dover. For more information, visit us at: http://www.dovergrace.org/
results.name: A unique catholic alternative at Grace Church

results.description: Come join us for monthly meetings to meet other Metrowest women and discuss interesting books from all over the world. We'll meet once a month. The first meeting will be on December 6. At the first meeting, we'll make a list of books we want to read and choose one for our first discussion in January 2015. Looking forward to good reading and good times!
results.name: Metrowest Women's International Book Club

results.description:
This group is for women in their 40's  and 50's  who have chosen to be single at this point in their life and are happy with that decision! We will use writing as a way to jumpstart conversation . We will write about finding peace with where we are, and most importantly where we would like the next chapter of our life to take us!

Independence, time and maturity is a winning combination! Looking forward to meeting women who have chosen to be empowered, who are actively finding creative ways to enrich their lives and who have closed the book on drama.

I have no doubt that there will be laughter, insight, networking and fun! 

Being a group organizer adds to the other hats that I wear regularly in my roles as nurse, health and wellness coach, free lance journalist, mom, sister, friend and avid traveler!
results.name: Unmatched by Design

results.description: Stone Soup was founded over thirty years ago by the Boston poet Jack Powers. Though it's origins are firmly footed in the Beats (highlights over the years have included Gregory Corso, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, and local figure John Wieners), the weekly gathering has included all styles of poetry at one time or another. Stone Soup Poetry meets from 8-10 p.m. every Monday at the Out of The Blue Art Gallery, now at its new location at 541 Massachusetts Avenue in Central Square Cambridge, Massachusetts with an open mike sign-up at 7:30 p.m. For questions, or to be considered for a Stone Soup feature contact us at stonesouppoetry@yahoo.com.
results.name: Stone Soup Poetry

results.description:
Each year our language school brings together nearly 1,000 international students from all over the world. They range in age from sixteen to sixty-five and are all very interested in meeting locals, practicing their English, and sharing their own languages and experiences. Now we are excited to meet members of the Boston community that are interested in joining us for various events aimed at cultural and linguistic exchange!

*We are currently looking for great new host families for our students!  If you or anyone you know might be interested in becoming a host, contact me at andrew.lewis@ef.com*
results.name: EF Brighton Language School - Community Events

results.description: Calling fair-weather commuters, weekend warriors, family caravans, kids on trikes, serious cyclists: This group is for anyone who has ANY interest in seeing bike culture develop north of Boston. I just moved into the area and am looking for other like-minded folks interested in bike riding, resources about cycling, and most importantly, helping support trails, paths, and bike lanes develop. I have lived a number of places and always benefited from the positive impact bike resources have on the community and the locations they serve. Let's help that happen up in this area.  The next few months aren't exactly full of prime riding weather, but we can still still compare notes, share tips and get ready for some spring time fun.
results.name: Biking 'bout Billerica

results.description:
I am currently developing a business idea (with 2 MIT MBA students) to improve in-store experience in the Apparel industry leveraging the Bluetooth Low Battery (iBeacons) technology. We want to launch the first app pilot and we would like to ask you for help. We are looking for a technological partner and skillful iOS programmer to start developing the first pilots of the product and to help us better understand the technological implications or our idea. are you interested? Please do not hesitate to reach me and see you in our presentation the 10th December at MIT Martin Trust Center for Entrepreneurship!

Looking forward to seeing you,

Fran

fromerot@mit.edu
results.name: iBeacon MIT Business Idea - Looking for technology support

results.description: Empowerment is through education and awakening. Asking questions helps us transform. Tong Ren and the Tam Healing System are internationally active healing modalities used to succesfully treat conditions from cancer to simple pain. Tong Ren Academy is dedicated to teaching and sharing with others, the simple techniques to heal and thrive naturally through the resources of the body. Techniques include medical massage therapy Tui Na, Acupuncture as well as Tong Ren Distance Healing.
results.name: Tong  Ren Academy Meetup

results.description: We are opening a new Title Boxing Club at 226 Causeway Street and would like to host Meetup groups for free. Pre-register to receive updates at www.titleboston.com!
results.name: Title Boston

results.description:
Do you love the arts? Are you a painter, writer, reader, musician, performer, scholar, or simply someone who appreciates the humanities in any form, whether it be through music, fine art, theater, or the written word? Are you between the ages of 21 and 39? Do you love cocktails? Lastly, do you live in the Boston/Cambridge area?

If you answered yes to these questions, then this is the right group for you. I'm founding this group because I want to meet people who, like me, enjoy cocktails, love the arts, and prefer socializing in small groups rather than in crowded parties. For this reason, each of this group's outings will be limited to six people, who will meet at different cocktail bars around Boston and Cambridge to make new friends, talk about subjects we love, and try out this area's fantastic selection of high-quality mixed drinks.
results.name: Cocktails for the Humanities

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in all things burger related! From the greasy spoon to upscale, they're all relevant. We're looking for people to meet up, kick-back and simply enjoy Tasty Burgers! Join and let's have a great time!
results.name: Burger Lovers- Boston

results.description: A running group based in the Hingham/ Weymouth Area featuring group runs in both towns. Club running enhances the running experience  and motivates us to get out there on the roads, especially when we need support and safety associated with running as a group.  IRRC will feature a fun  social aspect with occasional social events throughout the year.
results.name: Irish Riviera Running Club

results.description: Moms who are looking for new friends and new interests and hobbies after raising kids. I am new to the Boston area and hoping to meet women who share my interests. Format could be going out for a glass of wine or dinner and just making new friends and sharing adventures.
results.name: Recent Empty Nesters

results.description:
Have you ever considered getting together with other gays, lesbians and bisexuals somewhere other than a smoky room with a disco ball?Swet LGBT South End is the first and only gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, and gay-friendly group class community in South End.
This is 60 minutes of Rolling Battle Ropes, Slamming SandBells, Swinging Medicine Balls, Pulling TRX, Crawling Under Cargo Net, Hopping Over Barriers, Climbing Ropes, and Pushing Your Limit !  This is an intense full body workout that targets all of the major muscle groups. Expect to burn 700-1000 Calories. We believe in a positive approach to fitness. Unlike most group classes, this is not about berating you or intimidating you, rather we will encourage you to be your best, and then push past what you thought were your limits. We combine drills that will motivate you to finish hard and strong.


Lets Sweat!!!

www.swetstudio.com
results.name: Swet South End LGBT

topics.name: Sewing, Knitting, Crochet, Crafts Jewelry Making

results.description: Hi all, we are Common Cod Fiber Guild, and we do lots of great things! We host lectures every other month at MIT's Stata Center for guild members, but we frequently hold free and open to the public "crafty days" at MIT's Tang Center. Although some/most of us have a special love of knitting, crochet and spinning, all crafts are welcome and affirmed. You should come and give us a try!
results.name: Cambridge's Common Cod Fiber Guild Crafting Meetups

results.description: Beacons & Brews is a social meetup for Boston area ibeacon/beacon developers and enthusiasts. This event is held monthly and brings together those who want to talk shop and share what they've been working on...then grab a brew.
results.name: Beacons & Brews

results.description: Boston Rust meet up for Rust beginners and enthusiasts.
results.name: Rust Boston

results.description:
This is a group designed for those of us who bridge the marketing and technology worlds. We are passionate about discussing new marketing trends and methodologies, but as important, we want to learn HOW to actually execute on and measure these approaches using technology. So, expect to get deep in the weeds! If you are a marketer, a technologist, a data analytics expert or just someone who wants to learn, we welcome you to join us!

Topics presented will include both products as well as underlying technology. We may talk about general topics like predictive analytics, addressable TV, marketing channel trends, but we will also discuss specific technologies, such as Hadoop, Casandra, google analytics, social media API's and much more. 

Beginners and veterans alike - we are all looking forward to both learning and sharing what we know!
results.name: Boston Marketing Technology Group

results.description:
GAY FOR GOOD aims to energize and mobilize the LGBT community to interact with the greater community by volunteering time to various social welfare and environmental service projects. Each month, Gay For Good Boston selects a different non-profit to donate our time for a community service project. There is no money required. Just donate your time!

Upcoming Events:l

• Sunday, January 25, 5 PM - 8 PM: G4G Boston's Fifth Anniversary Celebration at the Rattlesnake Grill in the Back Bay

• Saturday, February 7, 10:30 AM - 1:30 PM: Ethos Out 2 Brunch at Roslindale House

• Thursday, February 12, 6:45 PM - 10 PM: Bikes Not Bombs in Jamaica Plain

For full details and to RSVP, please check our web site events page or visit our Facebook page.

So take a chance - win prizes & meet new people or hang out with old friends that like a change of pace.
